label: joy
text: During the period of falling in love, each time that we met and à especially when we had not met for a long time.

label: fear
text: When I was involved in a traffic accident.

label: anger
text: When I was driving home after  several days of hard work, there à was a motorist ahead of me who was driving at 50 km/hour and à refused, despite his low speeed to let me overtake.

label: sadness
text: When I lost the person who meant the most to me.

label: disgust
text: The time I knocked a deer down - the sight of the animal's à injuries and helplessness.  The realization that the animal was à so badly hurt that it had to be put down, and when the animal à screamed at the moment of death.

label: shame
text: When I did not speak the truth.

label: guilt
text: When I caused problems for somebody because he could not keep the à appointed time and this led to various consequences.

label: joy
text: When I got a letter offering me the Summer job that I had applied à for.

label: fear
text: When I was going home alone one night in Paris and a man came up à behind me and asked me if I was not afraid to be out alone so à late at night.

label: anger
text: When I was talking to HIM at a party for the first time in a long while and a friend came and interrupted us and HE left.

label: sadness
text: When my friends did not ask me to go to a New Year's party à with them.

label: disgust
text: When I saw all the very drunk kids (13-14 years old) in town on à Walpurgis night.

label: shame
text: When I could not remember what to say about a presentation task à at an accounts meeting.

label: guilt
text: When my uncle and my neighbour came home under police escort.

label: joy
text: [ On days when I feel close to my partner and other friends.  à When I feel at peace with myself and also experience a close à contact with people whom I regard greatly.]

label: fear
text: Every time I imagine that someone I love or I could contact a à serious illness, even death.

label: anger
text: When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility à of elucidating this.

label: sadness
text: When I think about the short time that we live and relate it to à the periods of my life when I think that I did not use this à short time.

label: disgust
text: At a gathering I found myself involuntarily sitting next to two à people who expressed opinions that I considered very low and à discriminating.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I was directing the feelings of discontent à with myself at my partner and this way was trying to put the blame à on him instead of sorting out my own feeliings.

label: guilt
text: I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material things à more important than caring for my relatives.  I feel very à self-centered.

label: joy
text: After my girlfriend had taken her exam we went to her parent's à place.

label: fear
text: When, for the first time I realized the meaning of death.

label: anger
text: When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off the à road.

label: sadness
text: When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and  à how one wants to try something else.  When I read a theoretical à book in English that I did not understand.

label: disgust
text: When I found a bristle in the liver paste tube.

label: shame
text: When I was tired and unmotivated, I shouted at my girlfriend and à and brought up negative sides of her character which are actually à not so important.

label: guilt
text: When I think that I do not study enough.  After the weekend I à think that I should have been able to have accomplished à something during that time.

label: joy
text: When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.

label: fear
text: When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives à late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could à have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.

label: anger
text: When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.

label: sadness
text: When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.

label: disgust
text: When one finds out that someone you know is not at all like one à had thought, for instance friends who steal and things like that, à quite unwarranted.

label: shame
text: When one has been unjust, stupid towards someone else.

label: guilt
text: When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.

label: joy
text: Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.

label: fear
text: When I climbed up a tree to pick apples.  The angle of the ladder à I was on did not enable me to get high enough.  This implied à that the ladder was not very stable.

text: Friends who torture animals.

text: [ Same as in anger.]

text: When I had my children.

label: fear
text: When my 2 year old son climbed up and sat on the 7th floor à balcony with his legs hanging out.  He was holding on tightly to à the upper railing of the balcony but he could have easily lost à his balance when he sat down.

label: anger
text: When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.

label: sadness
text: When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and à war.

label: disgust
text: When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.

label: shame
text: When I saw my 18 year old son grab an oxygen mask as he had à breathing difficulties.  I had a bad conscience because I had not à stopped smoking.  Medication for the dilation of his breathing à tubes also caused a sense of guilt in me.

label: guilt
text: I experience a sense of guilt as my middle son cannot express à himself like other children, neither verbally nor in writing.

label: joy
text: When my child was born.

label: fear
text: It was winter/spring and the ice was melting.  I was far out on a à jetty and I poked the ice with a long branch to try and break it. à  The branch went through the ice and I fell in, the water closed à in over my head.

label: anger
text: Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by à someone close to me.

label: sadness
text: Failing an examination.

label: disgust
text: A drunkard fell, started bleeding and wet himself.  Disgust that à turned into sadness-unpleasantness.

label: shame
text: When, as an adult I have been caught lying or behaving badly.

label: guilt
text: When I am in an environment or with a person much worse off than à me, I realize how privileged I am.

label: joy
text: When I saw a person I had not seen for a long time.

label: fear
text: When, as a child, I was nearly knocked down by a car.

label: anger
text: When I heard on the radio that the football match in Belgium had à ended in a catastrophe, and several people had died.  I could not à  understand how normal people could behave in such a way.

label: sadness
text: When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and I à am shut up in my appartment.  Nothing happens in particular à because there is no time for anything else.

label: disgust
text: When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killing à going on in the world.

label: shame
text: I lied, to be precise I cancelled a meeting with a good friend.

label: guilt
text: When one lets friends down

label: joy
text: When I was accepted for a course on finance and accounting.

label: fear
text: A bus drove over my right leg.  The event itself was not very à frightening but when I had to wait in the emergency ward for à three hours and then my leg began to swell, I was frightened.

label: anger
text: At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had à to learn all on my own.

label: sadness
text: When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.

label: disgust
text: When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilator à in the kitchen.  I was going to clean it when I found that the à drum was full of mud and slime.  I felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationship à and I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to him à nowadays.

label: guilt
text: At my Summer job a new caretaker had been employed who was my age à  but I preferred going out for lunch with the accounts personnel à rather than with him.

label: joy
text: Passed an exam by 2 points.

label: fear
text: In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in the à dark.

label: anger
text: When I spoke to Jan-Erik Wikstr…m on the telephone.

label: sadness
text: Railway station good-bye.

label: disgust
text: I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.  He was à probably an imposter.

label: shame
text: I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would not à enjoy himself if he came along.  He understood  that he would not à have fitted in and there was something in that.

label: guilt
text: I was the reason behind the break-up of my friend's relationship à with his girlfriend.  She finished with him.

label: joy
text: I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.

label: fear
text: On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch, à there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard;  I was very à scared till I managed to get him back onboard.

label: anger
text: I locked myself out.

label: sadness
text: I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.

label: disgust
text: I found some worms in the food and I had obviously eaten some.

label: shame
text: My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took him à away, and they later contacted his parents.

label: guilt
text: I hapened to overhear something which I was not meant to hear.

label: joy
text: When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.

label: fear
text: When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking character à comes towards me.

label: anger
text: At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and à distrusted me.

label: sadness
text: When I had not understood anything after a lecture.

label: disgust
text: When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.

label: shame
text: When my friend and I were discussing the good looks of a guy we à realized that he had been listening.

label: guilt
text: When I complained about a colleague to the manager and he told à her that someone had complained; this colleague came to me à believing that I liked her.

label: joy
text: At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends.  It à was all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to have à such good friends.

label: fear
text: On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car à acquaplanned.  I lost contact with the road surface for a few à seconds.

label: anger
text: Mad at my dad.

label: sadness
text: A case of unrequited love.

label: disgust
text: A bad smelling cucumber.

label: shame
text: Nearly caught masturbating.

label: guilt
text: I do not help out enough at home.

label: joy
text: I felt very happy when I won the football pools.

label: fear
text: When I flew from Athens to Copenhagen after a holiday.  The plane à was caught in a storm and it began to shake and I thouhght that à we were going to crash.

label: anger
text: When someone stole my bike.

label: sadness
text: When I saw the list of books to read for an acccouting course, I à thought " Oh God how will I ever manaage it!"

label: disgust
text: It was when I read a newspaper article on the future and they à foresaw that we would be eating frog-burgers by the year 2000.  à An illustration showed a frog between two pieces of bread.

label: shame
text: When I dropped a bottle in the state liquor store and everyboby à started laughing.

label: guilt
text: When I was young - 14, I pinched from a store and was caught.  à The store then contacted my parents.

label: joy
text: When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday.  à Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned.  It works out à well and we enjoy ourselves.

label: fear
text: When I could not find my 2 year old daughter.  I ran and looked à for her everywhere and could not find her.  (I finally found her, à she had gone to bed to sleep)

label: anger
text: When friends try to put me down or hurt me.

label: sadness
text: Marriage crises.  Boredom.

label: disgust
text: When someone makes advances that one does not want.

label: shame
text: The discovery that one has only thought of oneself.

label: guilt
text: When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.

label: joy
text: When I passed the first examination that I had to repeat.

label: fear
text: When I drove to Stockholm for the first time and drove off the à Stora Hissingen road at the wrong exit.

label: anger
text: When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.

label: sadness
text: Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studied à at the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriend à went to Greece for a holiday for a month.

label: disgust
text: When a dog is left whining outside a shop.

label: shame
text: When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep à the promise.

label: guilt
text: When I realized that I had three more examinations to take.

label: joy
text: The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of à economics.

label: fear
text: While taking a short cut through the Vasa park, I was surrounded à by three people who tried to steal my money.  I was scared and à was saved only by the appearance of other people.

label: anger
text: At a restaurant I observed how the gypsies tried to get money by à cheating the foreigners i.e non Swedish speaking.  My anger had à nothing to do with hatred against foreigners, but it was an à expression of the anger I feel when I see people being used .

label: sadness
text: At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encountering à problems one can not manage.  Thoughts revolve around failing à the subject and the consequences it would have for the future.

label: disgust
text: While walking in town I noticed how the police harrassed a man à who was under the influence of alcohol.  They terrified him with à the thought of arrest by driving close behind him on a pedestrian à street.  My disgust was directed at the gestures and the facial à expressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoying à themselves.

label: shame
text: When my boyfriend revealed that he knew that I had discovered à things of an important nature about him, I felt ashamed as I had à not mentioned it earlier.

label: guilt
text: When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.  I à feel guilty because I know that he gives a different version of à the truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he is à aware that I know that they are wrong.

label: joy
text: When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by a à margin of three marks.

label: fear
text: When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.

label: anger
text: When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did not à have a raincoat on me.

label: sadness
text: When I failed an exam.

label: disgust
text: At a Sm…rgasbord table, a man mixed differnet kinds of picked à herrings with fruit salad.

label: shame
text: When I had not prepared my contribution to the group as à thoroughly as the other members, with the result that the à overall result was poor.

label: guilt
text: When my father and I worked on the house just after he had à recovered from illness, I was rather lazy.  This meant that he à had to work hard and was not very well later.

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I à had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a à malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.

label: fear
text: When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did not à know how long he would live.

label: anger
text: When a colleague asked me for help at work, despite the fact à that he had more time to do it than I had.

label: sadness
text: When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expecting à and understood how little one's work was appreciated.

label: disgust
text: When I was weeding the garden I found a lizard in my hand.

label: shame
text: When I met a friend whom I had not seen for a long time and à heard all about her troubles, I thought that I should have got à in touch with her earlier.

label: guilt
text: I got angry at my mother for something trivial.  We were in a à bad mood because my father was very ill and I knew that my mother à really needed support.  I had reacted wrongly.

label: joy
text: New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the à steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the à first time.

label: fear
text: When I was stopped by plain clothes policemen because the car I à was driving had overturned on the Avenue.  I had been driving too à fast, and I was afraid when I was stopped, questionned and then à toild to go.  The situation ended happily since there were no à consequences.

label: anger
text: The editor changed the heading of an article that I had written.  à He considered the heading to be derogatory towards the person I had written à about.

label: sadness
text: A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer.  à Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totally à demolished car with two fatally injured passengers.  The car was à so badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at the à scene of the accident.

label: shame
text: One night I had a sexual intercourse with another man.  My sexual à desire and my curiosity had made me jump into bed with him.  I am à ashamed of myself now.

label: guilt
text: Due to laziness, I failed the term studies completely at à University.  I also wanted, to some extent, to protest against my à parents' expectations.

label: joy
text: When I got the loan for my studies.

label: fear
text: I met intoxicated people with dubious intentions in a back alley à one Wednesday night.

label: anger
text: On the T.V I saw a news feature on South Africa.  A policeman      à attacked a group of black people with a whip.

label: sadness
text: The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in à English.

label: disgust
text: Grovelling people.

label: shame
text: My inability to assert myself positively in a group.

label: guilt
text: I experience feelings of guilt because I do not study enough.

label: disgust
text: Observing someone in the cafeteria noisily gulping in his food, à having extremely bad manners.

label: shame
text: I guess I have often been ashamed after having talked badly of à other people.

label: guilt
text: Having been angry and unpleasant towards my parents.

label: joy
text: When my sister - after a history of one abortion and one à stillbirth - gave birth to a perfectly healty boy.

label: fear
text: When my sister had the still born child, she was emotionally very à deep down, and it took her a long time to recover.

label: anger
text: We were starting a student project, and the teacher we talked to à was very negative and not very helpful.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend openly let me down, preferring another girl.

label: disgust
text: I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he had à left me.

label: shame
text: Can't think of any.

label: guilt
text: Before an accident, my aunt offered me the front seat of the car, à next to the driver. I declined, she took that seat and was killed à there when the car crashed.

label: joy
text: Unexpected visit by a close friend, whom I hadn't seen for half a à year.

label: fear
text: I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range, à and was shot at.

label: anger
text: Being treated unfairly.

label: sadness
text: Breaking up with a girl.

label: disgust

label: guilt

label: joy
text: When I was accepted as a student at the college, not having à thought it possible.

label: fear
text: When I was the first to arrive at the scene after an accident, à and found that a close school friend had been killed.

label: anger
text: I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got à very angry.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died.

label: disgust
text: Not applicable.

label: joy
text: A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing at à a lake with my husband.  Suddenly it started raining while the à sun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happiness à and fulfillment.  the whole nature was full of music.

label: fear
text: I was alone at home, in bed reading a womens' magazine in which à there were storiees of paranormal experiences.  My leg was à itching and I stretched my hand to scratch and I felt another à strange hand. (later I realized that it was the corner of the à blanket)

label: anger
text: I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, this à was the second time.  One had a negative attitude towards the à lecturer.à

label: sadness
text: I heard that a former superior of mine had died, I was later at à home home reading about it in the newspaper and I thought of our à interaction and how it was no longer possible.  The limited scope à of human life is sad.

label: disgust
text: In the tram there was a fat, sickly looking woman in front of me à who was asking for directions in a thick voice.  When she got up to à go a disgusting smell of urine came from her.  I felt that I à would choke.

label: shame
text: When we were at home, my husband and I, he made a remark about à something I had done, in a perfectly friendly manner.  My deed à had been unjust and I knew that my husband was right, therefore my à sense of shame.

label: guilt
text: I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, the à way she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine.  à Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.  I felt guilty à about her sadness.

label: joy
text: I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on à my birthday.

label: fear
text: I went to practice in Sweden during summer, and I was afraid that à I would not do well.

label: anger
text: In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came to à wake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at the à highest volume into my room - it was the morning service at its à loudest.

label: sadness
text: My grandmother died suddenly last summer.

label: disgust
text: My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he à could, and once put me in a difficult situation after which I à could not but detest him.

label: shame
text: Once I arrived two hours late to my work place (a bank) and I was à still feeling feeble and tired.

label: guilt
text: Our association had Polish visitors and when they were going back à by boat I did not go to see them off (I am the chairman of the à association).

label: joy
text: I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the à vice-chairman of our student organisation.  I was really à surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it à there was worry - how shall I succeed ?

label: fear
text: Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of à names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We à read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar à room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if à I would succeed as a group leader.

label: anger
text: We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.  à Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.  I let à him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.

label: sadness
text: My grandmother died, and my mother called me one sunday morning à in the Autumn.  The way my mother told me about it, I hated her à at that moment.  She sounded as if she had been waiting for the à death of my grandmother.  I had lost a person close to me.  I à felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.  I had not à remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.

label: disgust
text: At the underground station, a drunkard came to speak to me.  He à tried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began to à speak about me with his companion.  I detested this dirty à growling man.

label: shame
text: I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be à done in groups of two.  I was talking about it to my friends when à I said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning my à work partner.  I did not quite mean what I said and I felt à ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also à a friend of mine.

label: guilt
text: I had told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with our à relationship.  I knew that I was important to him but I wanted to à be free.  I saw that this was difficult for him but I remained à firm and did not change my mind.

label: joy
text: Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her à for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking à "the same language"- meaning an inspiring discussion and à encounter.

label: anger
text: [ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me, à though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]

label: sadness
text: After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could à not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was à hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.

label: disgust
text: In the evening, while I was watching TV, my little brother came à in and started eating food he had brought from the kitchen while à I was trying to concentrate on the program.

label: shame
text: My little brother was arrested by the police at the railway station after à he had drunk some beer.

label: guilt
text: At my temporary job, I have to restrict  others' actions and make à them obey me, and this very often gives me  a feeling of guilt.  I à wish there could be some other way of acting.

label: joy
text: I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.  I expressed my feelings à in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with à complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the à hand of the other person, etc...

label: fear
text: I felt fear of the purest kind after a car accident.  The à incident and images of horror kept coming back to my mind.  I à wondered what could have happened to my sister, my friend and me, à though nothing very serious actually happened.

label: anger
text: Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, how à they had teased a young and shy girl I know.  They had despised à her conviction, scorned and touched her.  I got very angry and à did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.

label: sadness
text: My sweetheart left me, or rather we decided to break it off by à mutual consent.  The consequences were - unrestrained weeping, à feelings of loneliness, hopelessness and disconsolation.  I felt à that I should find a friend, to talk to joyfully and to forget.

label: disgust
text: Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie in à Copenhagen.  The room was full of men, who panted and à masturbated.  Very disgusting.

label: shame
text: After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, and à having been stupidly cross in every way.

label: shame
text: [ Do not know.]

label: guilt
text: Forced to fill in a questionnaire.

text: When I won a tennis match.

label: fear

label: anger
text: When my tennis match was interrupted because a kid cycled right à into the court.

label: anger
text: I had a very heavy work load and two colleagues, whom I have à nothing against, disturbed me by "terror ringing", i.e à continously interrupting me by telephoning.

text: [ Normally I do not feel disgusted.]

text: When I overtook a car on the mainroad, misjudging the distance of à an oncoming car and this resulted in tooting and flashing from à the other driver (we could have collided), and I had an à acquaintance in the car with me.

label: guilt
text: I saw a neighbour, from the same appartment block as me, lying    à on the road.  He could have been injured or ill.  I kept 20 à metres away and did not go to help him.

label: joy
text: When I met an old schhol friend (school love) who works in à Sk+vde.

label: fear
text: When I was cycling to school, I nearly got knocked down by a car à which (overtook me too closely) did not give me any swerving space.

label: anger
text: When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputies à took liberties, more than what was normal.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going à to separate.

label: shame

label: guilt

label: anger
text: I reached the bus stop and realized that I had forgotten my bus à pass.

label: sadness
text: My current work load is too much.  The feeling comes back from à time to time.

label: guilt
text: I do not have the time for other people's problems.  My à mother-in-law is sometimes depressed and I do not have the time, à the desire or the strength to help.

text: An ex-colleague asked me if I was interested in working in their à accounts bureau.  They needed "clever people" and he had à "immediately thought of me."

label: fear
text: I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of the à car when there was a lot of traffic behind me.

label: anger
text: I saw a report on T.V news on apartheid in South Africa.

label: anger
text: When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievably à angry.

text: When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time to à read.  Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.

label: disgust
text: Someone vomited on the street.

label: shame
text: I can not think of any incident when I have felt very ashamed.  à There are small incidents that I am ashamed of, for instance, à not sending money to the children in Ethiopia.

label: guilt
text: I had lunch with my ex-boyfriend and did not mention it to my à fiancee.  I felt guilty despite the fact that I felt nothing for à my ex-boyfriend.

label: joy
text: When I was finally qualified for my profession.

label: fear
text: Someone attacked me with a knife.

label: anger
text: Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that my friend's wife had cancer.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a dog which had been knocked down by a car.

label: shame
text: When I boxed my child's ears.

label: guilt
text: When I was fined for speeding.

label: joy
text: I stopped working (had a boring job).

label: fear
text: I was going home by car late one night when it was cold, dark and à windy.  I became rather panicky on the way to my house.

label: anger
text: Quarrel in the family.

label: sadness
text: When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone - à loneliness drains me.

label: disgust
text: When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.

label: shame
text: Emptied a bucket of water in a hospital.

label: guilt
text: When I feigned sick leave from work.

label: joy
text: When I get a hug from someone I love.

label: fear
text: I was driving very fast on a small road and I met an oncoming car à in a right handed bend.  The other driver was on his own side of à the road and I had to skid out of it to avoid a collision.  It à was dark.

label: anger
text: My car had been towed away by the traffic police because it had à been wrongly parked.  However the sign had been put up only after à I had already parked.

label: sadness
text: After an operation I had to stay in bed for a long time.

label: disgust
text: I was forced to stay in the canteen and eat the food that I had à not asked for but got it anyway.

label: shame
text: When I did not buy what I had promised to.

label: guilt
text: By mistake I took a book from the library which was not supposed à to be loaned out.

label: joy
text: When I won an unexpected sum of money.

label: fear
text: My 2 year old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention; I à was responsible for her.

label: anger
text: A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not have à enough confidence in me he asked a third person.

label: sadness
text: I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed    à at every menstruation.

label: disgust
text: In a warm bus full of people, someone vomited and the whole bus à stank.

label: shame
text: I complained about a colleague's behaviour as she goes back on à her word, is often absent and is irresponsible.  I found out that à she was an alcoholic and was trying to fight againt her à addiction.

label: guilt
text: I spoke to my mother on the phone.  She had skin cancer and was à waiting to be operated.  I forgot to ask her the date of the à operation and just before finishing our conversation she gave me à the date in passing.

label: joy
text: When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult à education course.  We had not met for 2 years but had both thought à a lot about each other.  A wonderful experience.à

label: fear
text: When I was cycling through the park late one night, two people à jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me.  There were à shouting something at the same time.

label: anger
text: When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying à Psychology because of its low status.

label: sadness
text: I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance.  He à was more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my point à of view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.

label: disgust
text: When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been à raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.

label: shame
text: My mother revealed personal details about me and the à negative aspects of my character to other people when I was à present but unable to defend myself.

label: guilt
text: I was unfaithful to my partner once when he was working abroad à for a long period.

label: joy
text: When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.

label: fear
text: When I saw a large spider crawling up the wall.

label: anger
text: My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drank à an enormous amount of spirit.  This was dangerous  and he did à not understand that he had done anything wrong.

label: sadness
text: When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.

label: disgust
text: When I slept with a guy because my best friend wanted me to.  à He had never had intercourse with anyone and had a terrible à complex about it.

label: shame
text: When I dated a close girlfriend's boyfriend a few times. He told à me that it was over between them and I accepted it.  When she à found out she finished our friendship.

label: guilt
text: When I broke off with my boyfriend after three years.  It was à quite unexpected for him and there was no particular reason for à the break up, such as someone else.

label: joy
text: When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and à soul.

label: fear
text: When one meets new people with whom one is forced to collaborate à with.

label: anger
text: The sports fishermen who catch gulls instead of fish with their hooks. à   It is often a mistake but it makes me angry.

label: sadness
text: I feel sad about an event I can not influence.

label: disgust
text: When a member of the family complains about the food that is à served, it disgusts me.

label: shame
text: [ Cannot recall any incident when I felt shame.]

label: guilt
text: I have chosen to put my son in a private school were the à examination marks are low.  Every time that he gives me his term à results I am left with a sense of guilt.

label: joy
text: When I was informed that I had been accepted as a student of à Psychology.

label: fear
text: When I was in a little fishing boat and we ran into hard weather à in the open sea.

label: anger
text: When I found out that the guy I was dating at a particular time à had a steady relationship going on with someone else for a long à time.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.

label: disgust
text: When I was working as a nurse in a mental hospital, a patient ate à up the contents of another patient's spitoon.

label: shame
text: At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle  à of a lesson.

label: guilt
text: I arrived an hour late for an important meeting ( I had à misunderstood the time).

label: joy
text: When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.

label: fear
text: When my son has a pain in his leg (for no apparent reason).

label: anger
text: When, after a week at school, a teacher sent a note home saying à that my son was inattentive and unable to do his lessons.

label: sadness
text: When I thought that it was going to be impossible for me to start à studying (due to wrong information from the student advisor).

label: disgust
text: At a certain person's lack of cleanliness, at home and à personally.

label: shame
text: When I made the same mistake that I had accused someone else of, and à this was obvious to a third pereson.

label: guilt
text: When I lost something that was valuable to my sister.

label: joy
text: When my son was born.

label: fear
text: When I nearly drowned in icy water wearing ice skates.  It was à difficult to get out.

label: anger
text: When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school and à my mother took the teacher's point of view.

label: sadness
text: When I was accused of neglecting work for the wrong reasons.

label: disgust
text: My parents attitude towards each other when they should become à reconciled, despite my father's long-time addiction.

label: shame
text: When I was caught stealing money from my father.

label: guilt
text: I stole a coconut cake from a reception table and when I put à in my mouth I realized that the host was watching me.

label: joy
text: When after 10 months of national service I was "downgraded" and à did not have to do the remaining 5 months.

label: fear
text: When I was reprimanded by the manager of the hotel where I à worked during Autumn 1984.

label: anger
text: When my parents drove me to a nearby place and went home à immediately instead of waiting a few hours.  They could have à easily waited.

label: sadness
text: When my ex-girlfriend and I discovered that there was a certain risk à of her being pregnant.

label: disgust
text: When I was about to clean the draining board and saw it looked à underneath the sink (I live in a students hostel).

label: shame
text: When my mother caught me masturbating.

label: guilt
text: As the only person in my family into academics, I ought to have à looked after my younger (and only) sister better, with respect to à her education and life experiences.

label: joy
text: When my older sister told us that she was thinking of joining the à rest of the family for the winter sports holiday.

label: fear
text: Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized that à there was someeone else in the chapel.  I never discovered who à it was and why he was there.

label: anger
text: When we were in high school a few guys sometimes provoked a à friend of mine.  They called her a pig and then grunted.  This à irritated most of the girls.  Once, one of the girls got angry at à my friend and said something nasty and this made me terribly à angry.

label: sadness
text: I talked to my boyfriend on the phone when I was in high spirits à and had a lot to tell him.  I had been looking forward to this à conversation and he did not listen to me to the extent that I à had anticipated.

label: disgust
text: A mother who shouts at her child for nothing.

label: shame
text: When I complained to my mother about how untidy the kitchen à loooked, she boxed my ears ( this had never happened before).

label: guilt
text: As I could not be home before midnight I called home at 11.30 and à asked them to leave the door open so that I could get in.  I à actually woke up the whole family by calling them so late.  My à mother could not go back to sleep, besides she had a conference   à the next day and really needed to sleep.

label: joy
text: When I got through the first day here at the department.

label: fear
text: When I was cycling past a parked car someone opened the door and à nearly pushed me off my bike and into the traffic.

label: anger
text: When my boyfriend sat up half the night playing computer games à with a friend.

label: sadness
text: When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a big spider from very close.

label: shame
text: When I asked a friend to return the money that I had loaned her à and then remembered that she had repayed me in several ways.

label: guilt
text: When one of my parents insinuates something about the other à (they are divorced).

label: joy
text: When i was asked to be a child's godmother.

label: fear
text: On the way down a ski slope which was difficult and steep.

label: anger
text: When my mother interfered in my life.

label: sadness
text: When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for à it.

label: disgust
text: The first time that I saw a surgeon cut off a leg and put it in a à black rubbish bag.

label: shame
text: When I forgot about a meeting at work.

label: guilt
text: When I demand too much from my friends.

label: joy
text: When my husband suddenly came to see me at my new job and à brought some flowers and cake with him.

label: fear
text: When I was nearly attackad by a man who had been chasing me.

label: anger
text: When my father asked me if I was a communist, at the same time he à made it clear that I should no longer see myself as his daughter.

label: sadness
text: When I applied for a job which I thought I had a good chance of à getting, I was not even granted an interview and did not get the à job.

label: disgust
text: T.V features showing the violation of defenceless people.

label: shame
text: When I as a child of 9 or 10 I was playing doctor with the à neighbours boys their mother caught us.

label: guilt
text: When my husband talked about the restrictions he will have to à accept in his life to make our marriage work.  I felt that it was à directed at me as it was me who had demanded the changes.  We à were with a marriage counsellor then.

label: joy
text: When we were able to afford a new sofa - a leather one which cost à SEK 20000.  I had waited for it for 2-3 years.

label: fear
text: Vertigo - standing on a ladder and painting the house.

label: anger
text: When my boss enrolled in a course to satisfy his own ends - to à trample on his associates.  I have the misfortune to have one of à my superiors in my course.

label: sadness
text: When I argue with my mother about the way she treats her two à children differently.

label: disgust
text: Spit and vomit.

label: shame
text: Spots on the seat covers of my husband's car.

label: guilt
text: Not speaking to my sister-in-law due to lack of interest in a à relationship on my side.

label: joy
text: When I recently managed to get my first consulting assignment à "myself" i.e on my own initiative.

label: fear
text: I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard who à suddenly ran into the street.  The fear came later when I     à realized what could have happened.

label: anger
text: When my friend, as usual, forgot the tickets at home for a à performance.  We missed it.

label: sadness
text: The elections of 1982 and 1985.  The thought of what a social à democrat and communist majority could achieve, especially "worker à share" funds and its extension.

label: disgust
text: A study visit to a chicken factory : the butchery, the smell, à the environment and the noise.

label: shame
text: Confession to my parents about my involvement in a moped theft.

label: guilt
text: [ No answer as I see very little difference between shame and à guilt.  Therefore see answer for "shame".]

label: joy
text: When I was appointed to position of trust in a group set up to à change the working environment.

label: fear
text: I was alone in a cottage I often stay in.  I was woken up by a à rustling sound in the middle of the night.

label: anger
text: When I tried to explain to a plumber, face to face, that the à toilet was broken and he did not believe it (it had been mended à ten times).

label: sadness
text: When the result of a project work was treated nonchalantly à intead of being criticized by the teacher.

label: disgust
text: When programmes on violence or pornography are shown on T.V.

label: shame
text: When I talked maliciously about a colleague at work to someone à else.  Immediately afterwards I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I decided to take a week s holiday without consulting the à family first.

label: joy
text: After my girl and I talked things over our relationship changed à and became positive.  A diificult time turned into pleasant one.

label: fear
text: When we could not land our plane and we knew that the fuel was à running out.  Bad weather had already frightened us.

label: anger
text: When I read about Reagan's tactical decision concerning the à South African boycott.

label: sadness
text: When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died à later.

label: disgust
text: A film were a woman was attacked and raped.  One did not see the à worst but it had the desired effect - very strong.

label: shame
text: I made a comment and it was interpreted completely differently à from what I had meant.  When I said it I realized how my mother à had understood it.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to visit my girlfriend but for different reasons à could not make it.  I rang up later to tell her that I could not à come.

label: joy
text: When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later à accepted.

label: fear
text: I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kitten à would not go out.  My partner came in and started talking about à something and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw the à kitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with fright à till I got hold of her.

label: anger
text: Some noisy guests arrived at the hotel.  I had been slightly à irritated earlier.  At night when I was trying to sleep they were à having a party so I went and yelled at them.  I wanted to sleep à as I had to get up early the next day.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that I had not been successful in getting the job I à had been expecting.  I was sure that I was sufficiently à qualified.

label: disgust
text: When my cat vomited and a worm came out which was still alive.  I à was forced to wipe it up.

label: shame
text: When I was a child it was found out that I had taken off my à clothes outdoors.  It was summer and my friend and I were out à in the woods.  It had felt exciting at that time.  My parents à discovered that my trousers were back to front and I felt à ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I stole money from my mother and she asked me later if I was à responsible.  I never admitted it.

label: joy
text: [ Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight.  à Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance.  Simply being à here on earth.]

label: fear
text: When my relationship with my family is very poor I often fear à being excluded from the group, a fear which is stronger in à situations when an argument is on hand.

label: anger
text: Recently when my sister, who is four years younger than me and à very spoiled, shouted at my mother for no apparent reason .  The à heart-broken expression on my mother's face made me feel very à angry.

label: sadness
text: When I watched the T.V programme called "The living planet" and à saw the far reaching environmental destruction caused by man.

label: disgust
text: Disgust is a feeling that I have never experienced with peoplie à but , on the other hand, it has been with repulsive animals, i;e à snakes on T.V.

label: shame
text: When relatives have acted strangely, and unfriendly towards me.

label: guilt
text: When ,due to hunger and tiredness, I became generally irritated à with my fiancee and made cutting remarks which really hurt him.  à Later I realized that my unfounded irritation had hurt the person à I love most on earth.

label: joy
text: On a boat trip to Denmark, 14 of us had a lot of fun and we à spent SEK 10 each on one armed bandits and against all odds we à won the jackpot of SEK 1000.

label: fear
text: A rainy day, I was cycling downhill and a car door suddenly à opened and while trying to avoid it the back wheels of my bike à got caught in the tram tracks.  I somersaulted but had no à injuries.

label: anger
text: On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's à car.  Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was à forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar.  The à other car drove off without even seeing what had happened.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend who had spent 6 months abroad broke off our à relationship by letter.

label: disgust
text: At the police centre a man between 40-50 was brought in.  He was à very drunk and in all likelihood had not slept indoors for a long à time and had relieved himself in his trousers.

label: shame
text: A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the à goods that he had ordered had arrived.  I had totally à forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.

label: guilt
text: I was 4-5 years old when I hid the bicycle keys of a not very à good friend.  After a few hours I pretended that I had found à it.

label: joy
text: When I was at the end-of-term party last week and had fun - was à happy and sang and drank only soft drinks.  It is possible to à have a good time without alcohol.

label: fear
text: Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and an à awful man came cycling after me.  He was shouting and I ran as à fast as my legs could carry me.

label: anger
text: In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only got à ordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given these à marks.

label: sadness
text: When I crashed my car and it had to be scrapped then.  It was my à fault and I feel depressed as I miss the car.

label: disgust
text: I had some sort of a stomach virus last week and  I vomited in à college in the morning, then in the cake shop, three times during à the trip home and again when I got home.

label: shame
text: When I was an evening school teacher it was my job to make the à coffee but I was not able to get the coffee ready on time and I à thus arrived half an hour late to the class.  On top of this the à coffee was undrinkable.

label: guilt
text: Many years ago a friend wanted me to with her to southern Europe à and I preferred to travel alone.  I felt guilty because I wanted à to go on my own.

label: joy
text: When I felt that my love was returned.

label: fear
text: When I was convinced that someonne had broken into my flat and I à woke up and heard sounds that frightened me.

label: anger
text: When it became clear that a man had used many people sexually à and psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked up à to him.  I understood that one could not trust him and I was à forced to hide this for a while.

label: sadness
text: When I feel helpless after having tried to help someone without à any result.

label: disgust
text: When I think now about the way my father behaved when filing a à divorce.

label: shame
text: When as an 8 year old, I wet myself in school.

label: guilt
text: When as a 7 year old, I stole money from my mother.

label: joy
text: When I recently got a very positive answer from a clinic telling à me that they would willingly assist and collect data for me for a à clinical pilot study.

label: fear
text: Every time I meet a certain dog that has once bitten me.

label: anger
text: When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on the à floor.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that I could not communicate properly with my à closest friend.

label: disgust
text: When I tried to explain to my child as to why there were à magazines wiith naked girls on them at the kiosk.

label: shame
text: When I stole a packet of cigarettes from a neighbour  and the à next day I owned up and returned it.

label: guilt
text: When I was forced to decline the invitation to my mother's 70th à birthday because of my work committments in another area.

label: joy
text: When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was à very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.

label: fear
text: A late Saturday night I found myself locked in the central à underground station of Stockholm with a group of 50 hard rockers à who were drunk and equipped with various kinds of chains, etc.

label: anger
text: When I was forced to call the telephone company about a bill à concerning a disconnected phone belonging to my landlord.  The à bill was four months overdue and in the meanwhile he had been à using my phone, he seemed to have no intention of having his own à phone reconnected.

label: sadness
text: Whenever I read or think about the way people treat animals and à nature.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a T.V programme on animals in the film world à (mistreated and used).

label: shame
text: When I was 13 years old I wrote passionate love letters to my à boyfriend and I later found out that his sister had read them.

label: guilt
text: When I "hated" one of mmy flatmates who was nice to me.

label: joy
text: When my 6 month old son is happy and well.

label: fear
text: A four year girl ran away from her father straight in front of my à car.  I was forced to use the emergency brakes.

label: anger
text: [ After an examine I had been satisfied with.]

label: sadness
text: When a colleague failed to contact me at the arranged time.

label: disgust
text: When I read racist slogans on the walls.

label: shame
text: About Sweden's arms exports.

label: guilt
text: Not doing something I had promised.

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to a healthy boy.

label: fear
text: When my husband and I spent a night by ourselves in a house which à was in an area on the outskirts of a large town with which we were  à not familiar.  We  heard strange noises outside the house and the  à house had glass walls so the whole thing was even more à frightening.

label: anger
text: Jealous of my husband's old girlfriend.  We met her with her à husband and there was a lot of reminiscing.

label: sadness
text: When my daughter had problems with her friends and I could see à her predicament from the window.  She was given a the cold à shoulder.

label: disgust
text: When I was an auxiliary nurse at the hospital and I had to change à the nappies, for the first time, of a very old and sick woman.

label: shame
text: When friends found out that I had been lying about where I had à been on a particular occasion.

label: guilt
text: When my middle child became very difficult to handle after the à birth of his baby brother and I did not have any patience with à him.

label: joy
text: When my husband and I decided to take a few days holiday after a à particularly trying period.

label: fear
text: Before a hospital visit prior to a D&C under anasthesia for an à expected miscarriage.

label: anger
text: Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.

label: sadness
text: Treatment to become pregnant with a negative result.

label: disgust
text: When I woke up one morning and went to the kitchen I discovered à that our dog had diarrhoea.  There were small "piles" all over à the floor and the smell was choking.

label: shame
text: When I was young, about 6 or 7, I did not make it to the toilet à on time.  I hid the dirty trousers in the cellar as I feared ità being discovered by my parents.

label: guilt
text: At work a boy was injured because of my lack of supervision.

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when it à was put against my breast.

label: fear
text: During labour when the foetal sounds became faint and there was a à big alert for a forceps delivery.

label: anger
text: At a cash desk where I had gone to buy 16 rolls of kitchen paper à at a reduced price.  After queuing with screaming children; it à turned out that I had taken two 8 roll packets instead of the one à 16 roll packet to which the rebate applied.  The assistant said à "You will have to get it another time."

label: sadness
text: When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.

label: disgust
text: The lift of Stockholm central station stank of vomit and urine.

label: shame
text: On the train a drunk person touched my baby and I reacted very à disapprovingly.  I felt ashamed later as the person had not been à aggressive though he could have been.

label: guilt
text: I get irritated with my son when he screams or is sick all over à his clean clothes.

label: joy
text: The high school entrance exam.

label: fear
text: A gang of screaming and drunk youths "captured" a tram.

label: anger
text: An unjust refree decision at a sports event when I was the team à leader.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend left me.

label: disgust
text: I was dominated by a certain person and even though I knew it I à could not change my own reactions.

label: shame
text: When I was given detention at secondary school.

label: guilt
text: When I splashed a child by not slowing down while driving à through a puddle of water.

label: joy
text: Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match between à OIS and IFK and it was certain that OIS had won the Swedish à title.

label: fear
text: I was teaching someone to drive and when we were about to crash I à was scared.

label: anger
text: A drummer who had borrowed my drums destroyed both the drumskin à and the sticks.  He did not repair them nor did he tell me about à it.

label: sadness

text: My boy-friend an I seperated on his initiative.

label: guilt

label: joy
text: After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome my à scruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. I à realized that my decision was right - and was very glad.

label: fear
text: After having slept for a short time I woke up - I had the feeling à of someone standing beside me and was very frightened. I had to à turn on the light turn on the light for several minutes before I à was able to get to sleep again.

label: anger
text: I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left à the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that à sloppiness and impudence.

label: sadness
text: My father had a complicated operation. A long time before and à also a long time after that, we did not know how he would get à over it. During all that time I felt very sad.

label: disgust
text: It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl just à because she blew her nose. I detested his behaviour.

label: shame
text: Quite recently I realized that I had had some erroneous views à about life. For instance, I had always lived for other people, à had forgotten my own person and suppressed my own feelings. I was à ashamed because I had not been concious of that until I had a à conversation about it with a person.

label: guilt
text: I had a quarrel with near persons. I said many ill-considered à things and I regretted it when it was to late.

label: joy
text: In summer when I was sailing with friends in Greece I felt joy.

label: joy

label: fear

label: anger
text: A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we were à late for something was because of me, and that I'm often late. I à know this was partly true, but felt it unjustified that à particular time and I felt I couldn't do  anything about it à anyway (i.e. being late).

label: sadness
text: Talking to a very good friend who had just had a very bad à experience which was changing his whole way of looking at life à etc.

label: disgust
text: I came across a group of people with the same basic ideas/beliefs à who were all fighting and going against what they would say was à good.

label: shame
text: I was working in a job in which I could not work quickly enough, à and was told that my work was not up to standard.

label: guilt
text: I had wasted some time instead of doing something I needed to do à to give to a friend. (Also in the time I wasted I had done some à things I did not consider morally right).

label: fear
text: Fear - paralysing - that I would not be accepted by the God who I à believed to be there because I was "morally bankrupt" (before à becoming a Christian and realising that that was why Christ came to à free us from sin and to forgive us).

label: anger
text: At my father's treatment of my mother, at his disregard for her, à and not being committed to her.

label: sadness
text: At a lack of love of my father for my mum, sadness for him more à than anyone else because he does not realise how much love and à happiness there could be between them, and is, and how much he is à damaging himself apart from mum.

label: disgust
text: At what I was capable of of selfishly using others for sexual à encounters, while I held a vision of having a deepening à above-board (you know, "girl next door") devotion to a girl in my à head. My drives and actions did not match this so consequently I à felt disgusted at my failure.

label: shame
text: At using other people, because of sexual experience that was à using another to the detriment of both. Anxiety that I may have à affected another for the worst.

label: guilt
text: For the above: guilt at not living up to my own moral à expectation, guilt for not being the type of person my patents à wanted, guilt for just about bloody everything, just realising à that I have failed drastically in my own eyes.

text: The death of a close friend.

text: Was confronted with a person having negative thoughts of other à people because of their social status, beliefs, color and à outlook on life (perspective).

text: I failed to complete a working task within the agreed time.

label: disgust
text: In a public swimming hall I saw a very aggressive man who à practically attacked the children who got in his way when he was à swimming.

label: shame
text: I was making very strong statements about infidelity in couples. à Then I discovered that one of my best friends, who had just been through à a very sad case of mutual infidelity, was listening.

label: guilt
text: I had planned a trip to the South during Easter, together with a à friend. She was very sorry when I changed my mind and decided not à to go after all.

label: fear

label: guilt
text: I was very angry with a girlfriend for interferring a little too à much with my personal affairs. I told her so rather strongly and à she started crying.

text: I was beaten up at a private New Year's party once, through no à fault of mine.

text: My nephew is a deaf and also "hyperactive" boy. I had been à responsible for looking after him for a full day, and was very à tired. Then he suddenly grabbed a knife and stabbed me in the à leg. I got so angry that I didn't feel any pain.

label: sadness
text: A woman I know is slowly dying from cancer. Observing this à process makes me sad.

text: I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date  à with my fiancee.  We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was à afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.

text: My fiancee and I were at my parent's place watching TV. There à were  only two TV-chairs and we were sitting on them when my à drunken brother came in and rudely chased my fiancee off the à chair she was sitting on.

text: I had drunk a couple of beers and my fiancee got angry at me.

label: disgust
text: We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby started à coughing and spitting into his plate.

text: We got into a fight with some chaps in front of our family house. à The value of the property destroyed was approximately 15 000 FIM. à I felt ashamed when my parents came to know about this.

label: guilt
text: We had had a party the night before and we still had some liquors à left the morning after. I went to the kitchen pretending to à prepare some tea and was caught by my fiancee pouring some rum à down my throat.

label: joy
text: While dancing in a restaurant last week.

label: fear
text: I was on the Inter Rail in Naples alone. After an evening in a à restaurant I was going back to the hotel when a prostitute à approached me to sell herself. I refused but as I carried on à walking I felt that I was being followed by someone.

text: When a girl left me.

label: sadness
text: I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry from à Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my à uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final à journey within four days.

text: On Reperbahn, in a restaurant, a "charming" old saleswoman came à to beg a drink for herself.

label: shame
text: At the funeral of my uncle, I was one of the bearers.  I was not à familiar with the etiquette and acted tactlessly because of my à ignorance.

label: guilt
text: On Reberbahn, I was in a "restaurant" where drinks were à overpriced.  I did not ask for the prices beforehand, and when à the bill came I could not pay the bill.

label: joy
text: My girlfriend gave me some feed-back and I understood that it à meant that our relationship was about to turn even closer.

label: fear
text: At the dentist's, waiting for my turn to come.

text: While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors.  I was à held responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.

label: sadness
text: When I came to know that my grandmother had died.  She was very à close to me.

text: In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his position à to advance his own interests.

text: [ Laziness makes one sad.]

text: In the traffic with a car, I nearly got crushed between a bus and à a tram.  The attention of other drivers saved me at the last moment.

text: I was disappointed and angry at the bad quality of a documentay à program on TV.  In my opinion, the topic was important and the à program should have been made with seriousness and consideration.

text: My father had a heart attack when I was not at home (I was still à living with them).  He recovered relatively well although he had à to retire (which implied relief from the stress of a small scale à enterprise).

label: guilt
text: I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture à of mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine à took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some à unnecessary work.

text: When I realized that I was far behind the others in the language à course and I could no longer catch up with the others.

text: When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university à telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.

text: While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death, à threat and fear of loosing people close to me.

text: I was angry with a friend of mine who behaved in an affected à manner.

label: guilt
text: When I think about my family (parents, brothers, sisters) guilt à is a part of my feelings.

label: fear
text: When my father was very drunk and raging at home.

text: My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I brought à another girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober I à felt quite ashamed of myself.

label: guilt
text: I got 100 FIM too much when I changed money at the bank.  They à soon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing for à me.

label: fear
text: In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn. à  One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk à (hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and à I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.

label: anger
text: I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question was à half an hour late.

label: sadness
text: The death of my grandmother.

label: disgust
text: In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as à I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load à on the tractor trailer.

label: shame
text: On the way back from a Summer spent in Sweden, I drunk with a man à in the train.  I had drunk so much that when I got home I fell à asleep in the entrance hall.  I have never drunk that much, à neither before nor after that incident.  I was ashamed because my à mother and my sister had to see me in that state and my father à had to carry me to bed.

label: guilt
text: While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bell à although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.

label: joy
text: I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.

label: fear
text: I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I saw à a man hiding behind a tree.  I got frigthened, turned around and à ran out of the forest.

label: anger
text: I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.  He was à criticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind was à unfounded.  When I reached home, I ran out of the taxi and à slammed the door.

label: sadness
text: I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been working à for a year.  That night I could not fall off to sleep.  I was sad à thinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.

label: disgust
text: I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard, smelling à terribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish that à was stinking.

label: shame
text: While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine, I was vehement and à irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.  à I was ashamed of myself when I met him the next day.

label: guilt
text: I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a à lecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of the à place.

label: joy
text: A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.

label: fear
text: Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came across à an exhibitionist.

label: anger
text: A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and à therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.

label: sadness
text: [ A person close to me told me that his positive regard depended à on my conduct.]

label: disgust
text: When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to à approach me.

label: shame
text: As a little girl, I was sick in the middle of a school day and I à vomitted in the basin of the classroom.

label: guilt
text: I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.

label: joy
text: I got to know that I had been accepted at university.

label: fear
text: I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.  At à night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids à were on the move.

label: anger
text: My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of à others.  In fact, the task in question was not supposed to be à done by me.

label: sadness
text: My father suddenly fell ill and died.

label: disgust
text: When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my à other friends and me.

label: shame
text: When I forgot a promise made to a friend of mine.

label: guilt
text: It was my turn to cook dinner.  I forgot a dish (the favourite of à the family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.

label: joy
text: My joy was the joy of meeting again.  My husband came home after à having been away for weeks (for work).  I was on the railway à station to meet him.

label: fear
text: I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from above à our bedroom.  I knew that nobody lived there since it was an à office.  I got frightened (later I was given a "natural" à explanation).

label: anger
text: A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to him à about a problem concerning his sister and me.  I was angry à because this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me and à instead spoke to my husband.  I got to know about it later the à same day.

label: sadness
text: The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to à each other.

label: disgust
text: The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us.  à I did not like the man.

label: shame
text: At school I was talking to a classmate about mathematics.  I had à grown weary of it and said : "I would like to throw the book on à the arse of Kuikka".  My classmate said : "Now, he is sitting à there and waiting for the book" (Kuikka was one of the most quiet à boys of the class).  I was ashamed of myself.

label: guilt
text: The death of my father made me feel quite guilty, because my à attitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.

label: joy
text: My mother, sister and I were thinking about old times, our à childhood, and we had a very happy time.

label: fear
text: My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.  At the à agreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had an à accident.

label: anger
text: I am a school teacher.  One of the classes does not obey me at all, à keeps on talking, does no work.  One afternoon, everything went à wrong, and I got exceedingly angry.

label: sadness
text: A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few à months old.

label: disgust
text: A series about Freud was shown on TV.  In it, a tampon had been à set in the nose of a woman, and forgotten there.  After great à pain it was taken off (close-up picture), the woman was bleeding à from the nose and the mouth.

label: shame
text: I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgot à it a couple of times.  When she asked me about it the third time, à I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.

label: guilt
text: A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.  It was not my à fault, nevertheless I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former à one.  When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know à that I almost had full marks.

label: fear
text: I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres.  à Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased à threateningly.  There were three of us divers on one safety rope.

label: anger
text: My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something à which was serious and a real burden to me.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.

label: disgust
text: [ The same as in anger.]

label: shame
text: As a child when I was blamed for peeing in the swimming-pool.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine was drunk and having an argument on the street à with a woman, appparently his girlfriend.  I was walking on the à other side of the street and thought that I was not supposed to à interfere.  Later I heard that he had shot himself that evening.

label: joy
text: My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.

label: fear
text: I was about to begin a journey in a car with an acquaintance of à mine.

label: anger
text: On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about the à increasing threat of war with the USA.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).

label: disgust
text: Watching a violent movie.

label: shame
text: The morning after a wild party.

label: guilt
text: I "picked up" a girl and I thought that I had misused my à position and authority over her as there did not seem to be any à realistic possibility of continuing the relationship.

label: joy
text: When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got "very good" à high school graduation marks.

label: fear
text: My grandmother was about to die, and it had the effect that at à night, after having read a book, and once in bed, in perfect à darkness, the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.

label: anger
text: When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been à careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary à mistakes concerning things I know and understand.

label: sadness
text: When we decided, my boyfriend and I, that we would separate, I à realized that he would have wanted to continue our relationship à and the coming separation hurt him.

label: disgust
text: When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents à treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of à them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not à encouraged and was rejected.

label: shame
text: I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents and à education.  I said something and then realized that I did not à know my friend's parents, their motives and education.  I felt à ashamed at having talked about something I did not know anything à about.

label: guilt
text: My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (I à had torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-day à enveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.

label: joy
text: I am not especially good at English, and after the high school à graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the à whole day.  In the evening, when I heard that I had done à excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My à family was at home.

label: fear
text: I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would à have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have à liked at all.  Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know à that I was not pregnant.

label: anger
text: A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using really à evil tricks to persuade me.  After he had left, I was anxious and à angry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend wanted to leave me, I felt sad and melancholic.

label: disgust
text: In a film, there was an episode where they used a chain saw to à cut a man.  I could not look at it, but I could not avoid à listening either.  I sought shelter in my boyfriend's arms.

label: shame
text: I thought I would be able to use the mangle of the house, and so à I did not want any help.  However, I blocked it and I had to get à the janitor to help me out.  He reproached me for not having à followed the instructions

label: guilt
text: I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I à kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it, I à promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after à a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.

label: joy
text: When I got an unexpected letter from  a guy, who had been my school à mate.

label: fear
text: When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that the à boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would à accidentally go off.

label: anger
text: My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try to à seek admission to other places also apart from the faculty of à Social Sciences at the university of Helsinki.  I was not at all à interested in any other place and had no time to study for other à entrance exams.

label: sadness
text: I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, but à I realized that I was not wanted.  I felt hurt, disappointed, à lonely and deserted.

label: disgust
text: When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen à carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in, à this acquaintance had helped her move in.à

label: shame
