text: I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I à tended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener was à amused.

label: guilt
text: When I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place, I tried to have a à pleasant time and did not really take care of the child.  I do à not care very much about children.

label: joy
text: When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was à unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not à surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.

label: fear
text: When a big angry dog put its snout on my arm and had I made one à movement it would have bitten me.

label: anger
text: When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me à from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was à being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.

label: sadness
text: [ When after a night of sleeping in another's arms, one wakes à alone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not the à same that one meets in the morning.]

label: disgust
text: When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.  A à subtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness and à neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.

label: shame
text: Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel à ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted à to say.  Thoughtlessness.

label: guilt
text: When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place.  à Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.

label: joy
text: When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a à moment.

label: fear
text: My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed à at night.

label: anger
text: My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell à me if they were visiting me or not.

label: sadness
text: A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.

label: shame
text: I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.

label: guilt
text: I did not go to help a friend of mine, though she probably needed à me.

label: joy
text: When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and à went well.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fence à when  a train was coming.

label: anger
text: When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the à stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his à friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would à fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of à other persons.à

label: sadness
text: I felt sad after having had an argument with my boyfriend.  I felt à that he did not understand me and that there was no point in à carrying on with the relationship.

label: disgust
text: I detested my father who was a drunkard.  He would rave, à threaten and blame my mother and me.  He finally drove us away à from home.

label: shame
text: When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend, he hit me and à behaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotel à personnel.

label: guilt
text: When as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she had à got in an easter egg.

label: joy
text: When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad, I got to know that I à had been accepted at university.

label: fear
text: At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and the à next day they promised to take revenge on me.

label: anger
text: My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a à good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me.  à Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to à defend my friend.

label: sadness
text: I got to know about the death of a close friend.

label: disgust
text: When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.  They à accurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc...

label: shame
text: When I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time, I was not à allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day when I was late, I à made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place, à though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with à my pals.

label: guilt
text: When before the last exam I have taken, I went out instead of à studying.

label: joy
text: When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought à the cloth after months of hindrances.

label: fear
text: I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job.  à After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered from à anxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studies à were the only alternative.

label: anger
text: My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke about à kicking the cat.  He had never done anything of the kind, but I à knew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.

label: sadness
text: Estrangement from my best woman friend.  We have been going à different ways for quite some time now, but the break was total à when she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.

label: disgust
text: My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values) à and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.  I have à noticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems by à drinking.  I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.

label: shame
text: Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My à life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it à disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.

label: guilt
text: A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a à wish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down an à invitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up all à my empathy.

label: joy
text: Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and à wine.

label: fear
text: The fear about my future : work, making ends meet and health. à Coping.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would never à accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems à and failed attempts at reconciliation.  My sadness was caused by à the irreversibility of the decision.

label: disgust
text: A man spat on the wall of a house.

label: shame
text: In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens and à invalids.

label: guilt
text: When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished a à nonacademic degree.

label: joy
text: When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understood à something about why I exist and what my task in life is.

label: fear
text: At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at night à I noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in a à purposeful mannner.

label: anger
text: While having a discussion with my mother, I realized that she à does not for a moment doubt the justification of her making the à decisions concerning my life.

label: sadness
text: When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact à with my parents.

label: disgust
text: While reading Olli Jalonen's new book, the distant, cold and à selfish relationships between people (in the book) made me feel à disgusted.

label: shame
text: When I approached a person of the opposite sex and was rejected.

label: guilt
text: When I noticed that my little sister was sulking, because I could à not meet her because of a misunderstanding.

label: joy
text: The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with my à boyfriend.  My parents place was getting a little crowded with à my growing bother wanting a room to himself.  I first felt doubt, à then joy, but also sadness.  The feeling of joy was the à strongest.

label: fear
text: My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at à home.  I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked à on mucus secretions.

label: anger
text: The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close à to me.(blaming us and lying)

label: sadness
text: We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.

label: disgust
text: A very drunk person.

label: shame
text: An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with a à person very close to me, when we should have been having a good à time together.

label: guilt
text: While trying to get my little brother over a ditch, he fell on à his head and started crying.  I was scared of having caused him à permanent injury.

label: joy
text: [ A chat on the telephone with a friend.]

label: fear
text: [ Meeting some new (unpleasant) people or some new, demanding à situation.]

label: anger
text: [ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]

label: sadness
text: [ When I am, in my opinion, not understood correctly. ]

label: disgust
text: [ When some people act very important in any situation.]

label: shame
text: [ Generally, when I am late in attending to matters (for example à paying bills).]

label: guilt
text: [ If one has planned to do something "important" and then, for à some reason, fails to do it.]

label: joy
text: I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waiting à for the end of the world.  Suddenly people began dancing wildly, à inspired by the band.  An unbelievable experience : wonderful à that even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think "what à others are thinking of me".  It was delightful to dance to one's à heart content.

label: fear
text: I was travelling back home by boat with two friends of mine after à a lovely holiday trip.  The night and the sea were dark, and the à wind was blowing.  I feared that death was there on the boat, I à somehow felt sure about it.  I feared being left alone.

label: anger
text: I was at home, filling my tax report.  Nobody had time to help à me.  I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go and à meet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.  I got à angry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculator à as I had not asked for it nicely.  I could not leave as I à had to wait for help and the tax report had to be done.

label: sadness
text: I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to go à home for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bear à it.  I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us by à talking in order to unite our worlds.  Result : hysterical mess, à blinding and blaming.

label: disgust
text: My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letter à addressed to me.  She denied having read it intentionally and à said "the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sun à was shining on it". Hah Hah.

label: shame
text: I feared that I would have to describe my sexual life to an à older, strange woman.

label: guilt
text: When I moved away from home.

label: joy
text: The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor à said that the ear was completely all right.

label: fear
text: My husband suddenly fell ill seriously and during the medical à examinations we did not know what would follow.

label: anger
text: The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so that à the inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.

label: sadness
text: My child, unexpectedly started acting in a restless and à disturbing way at school.  In addition his performance at school à weakened.

label: disgust
text: On a trip abroad, a lady-like member of our group turned out to à be an alcoholic.  She spoilt many days of my holidays because of à her behaviour and paranoia.

label: shame
text: I failed an exam which I thought I would certainly pass.

label: guilt
text: I had been guilty of gossiping and blaming others, and one of my à superiors at the workplace made a formal reprimand.

label: joy
text: When a student of mine (at music) performed and played remarkably well.

label: fear
text: When climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.

label: anger
text: My boy-friend came home late one night without having told me à about it before.

label: sadness
text: The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.

label: disgust
text: While watching the movie called "Deer hunter" on TV, when it à showed how prisoners were treated.

label: shame
text: When I noticed that a person I found attractive had seen me à picking my nose.

label: guilt
text: When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards à my students.

label: joy
text: When I made up with a girl-friend of mine after having been on à unfriendly terms with her (my fault).  I cried with joy that à evening.

label: fear
text: While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of à cows.

label: anger
text: When I heard that my step-mother had treated my mother in a wrong à manner.

label: sadness
text: When my friend did not pass the high school graduation à examinations.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had made à to my friends, who did not approve of them.

label: shame
text: When after having had sexual intercourse with a friend, I thought à that he had told about it to a friend of his.

label: guilt
text: When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.

label: joy
text: During lectures, I sensed an unexpressed understanding with a boy à I did not know.  We exchange glances ; I think he likes me, and I à like him too.  Perhaps he has fallen in love with me .........

label: fear
text: At night, I walk home past a forest.  Once, somebody got stabbed à in the forest.  I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.

label: anger
text: In a tram, the ticket seller was commanding, taking the role of a à leader, trying to emphasize her non-existent authority with undue à strictness towards a good-humoured drunk who could not find his à ticket at once.

label: sadness
text: A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.  I was sad à when I realized how easy it is to forget something that one had à once regarded as great and significant.

label: disgust
text: A nightmare.  I was dreaming about bloodsuckers, which I tried to à shake off from my body, they are everywhere, they get glued, they à suck.  And there are a lot of them.  I panic.

label: shame
text: I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.  I was evil in à order to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress. à  I sold my friend, I was despicable.

label: guilt
text: I met my ex boyfriend by chance.  We separated a few months ago à and I am now with a new boyfriend.  My ex boyfriend looked à depressed, and I know I am not to be blamed.

label: joy
text: [ During inter-rail-trip, after troubles, I met my little à sister.]

label: fear
text: Traveling as the only female in a railway carriage in the middle à of the night in Italy.

label: anger
text: A male, Honduran acquaintance of mine despised my opinions.

label: sadness
text: When our dog died.

label: disgust
text: While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met an à acquaintance of hers.  My friend started showing off and telling à false stories about herself and praising herself.

label: shame
text: I was dishonest to my boyfriend concerning something that is à important to our relationship.

label: guilt
text: A parking fine.

label: joy
text: After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt great à joy and relief.  I had been haunted by the thesis during the à whole of my studies.

label: fear
text: While preparing my master's thesis, I was scared that I would not à accomplish anything as the subject was rather difficult.

label: anger
text: During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering à with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for à him but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention.

label: sadness
text: The last time I felt sad and disappointed was when I did not do à as well as I had hoped in one of the final exams.  As compared à with the earlier exams, the questions, I think, were unjust.

label: disgust
text: After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who had à piled on to our party and spoilt it completely.

label: shame
text: After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the à friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers à of the party, did not drive the intruders away.

label: guilt
text: At my summer job, I was responsible for making various orders.  à It was not me who had ordered some seasonal merchandise, but when à much of it was left over and had to be thrown away in the Autumn, à I felt partly responsible for the much too large order.

label: joy
text: When I met a good friend of mine after a long time.

label: fear
text: I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in the à forest.  I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hear à noises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.

label: anger
text: When I quarelled with my parents.

label: sadness
text: Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finland à for a year as an exchange student.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a spider.

label: shame
text: While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to the à lavatory.  My cousin told grandma and she came.

label: guilt
text: While travelling in a bus with an invalid ticket, I got caught.

label: joy
text: While having a discussion with a colleague of mine, I realized that her à conception of man and work were similar to mine.

label: fear
text: While he was drunk, my life partner tried to hit me.  I felt à scared and fled to the bathroom.

label: anger
text: A "higher status" colleague of mine despised my attitude and à organization of work.

label: sadness
text: I could not meet my love, after having waited for a month, due to à illness.

label: disgust
text: Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight.

label: shame
text: My love and me rented a room in a hotel one evening.  We stayed à there a few hours and when leaving the hotel, I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: [ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made him à unhappy.  He had not been able to keep his promise.  I thus was à thinking about my own conduct towards another person.]

label: joy
text: I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcard à from a good friend (from my home town).

label: fear
text: My boyfriend hinted over the phone about wanting to "be free".  à He thus did not say it point blank, silence followed.

label: anger
text: They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.

label: sadness
text: After my boyfriend and I had separated.

label: disgust
text: In the morning, the cat of my landlady had vomited on the floor, à near the staircase I take to go to the bathroom.

label: shame
text: My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made an à unexpected visit.  I was lying lazily on the bed, reading a à newspaper and my boyfriend was studying.

label: guilt
text: The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had à left open.

label: joy
text: I got a letter from my best friend, whom I had not heard from for à a long time (a good letter).

label: fear
text: Someone knocked on the door when I was alone at home (though à there was a door bell).  I looked through the peep hole but it à had been covered.  I called my sister but she could not help me à as she was hundreds of kilometres away.

label: anger
text: My parents put pressure on me to buy clothes, when I would not à have liked to do so.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died, I saw my grandmother crying against my à aunt's shoulder (I had never seen my grandmother cry before).

label: disgust
text: At school, I detested the spinach gruel which had lumps of flour à in it.

label: shame
text: I told some acquaintances of mine something that I regretted à later.

label: guilt
text: [ I speak harshly to my parents though they only mean my own à good.]

label: joy
text: When I got a letter from home.

label: fear
text: While cycling in the country a dog started running beside me, à growling and barking, and trying to bite my foot.

label: anger
text: Disagreements with mother.  When I moved from KankaanpSS, she had à promised to help me move but broke her promise because of some à hindrance.

label: sadness
text: When I had to move away from home to study, and I knew that I à would not be coming back home for a long time.

label: disgust
text: When I noticed two spiders running on the floor in different à directions.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me, à because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.

label: guilt
text: When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited and à disappointed.

label: joy
text: I found myself a place after looking for one for a long time.

label: fear
text: [ In an aeroplane.]

label: anger
text: I was angry at my boyfriend who had promised to come to see me à but did not because he spent the evening with his pals.

label: sadness
text: The breaking up of a relationship.  We decided that the à relationship could not carry on, so it was no surprise to me. à And anyhow, I had known it would happen sooner or later.

label: disgust
text: The disgust I feel towards a certain person.

label: shame
text: After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.

label: guilt
text: At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.  My à reaction was not as it should have been.

label: joy
text: I went to see the entrance examination results at university.  I à rejoyced at my success.

label: fear
text: I borrowed a car which was supposed to be used for a long journey à a few hours later, and one of the tyres burst in the middle of à the town and I did not know what to do.

label: anger
text: An utterance, which I had intended to be a joke, was taken as an à offence.  In my opinion, this was stupid, and I got angry.

label: sadness
text: My best friend had a relatively severe illness.  I was sad à because she was suffering.

label: disgust
text: A man tried to have sexual intercourse with me, though I had à communicated my unwillingness.  Later on, I felt disgust at that à person as well as myself because I had partly submitted.

label: shame
text: I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating a à little.  When my friend remarked about it, I understood that it à was wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I am going steady with a boy, but I had sexual intercourse with à another one, and I felt guilty about it afterwards.

label: joy
text: A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.

label: fear
text: I was walking home with a friend at night along a quiet street.  à Something started rustling in the bush : it was an exhibitionist.

label: anger
text: I got angry at a friend of mine whom I caught reading my notebook à (almanach).

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died of cancer.

label: disgust
text: In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances at à me.

label: shame
text: [ Sometimes I have by accident said to another person something à in which it is easy to read a negative attitude.]

label: guilt
text: For the sheer pleasure of it, I quarelled with my boyfriend who was trying  à to be especially kind to me.

label: joy
text: When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.

label: fear
text: When abroad, while driving a car along a dark, winding road.

label: anger
text: When my sister took my things without having asked for my permission à first.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: When I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was not à democratic.

label: shame
text: While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned up à very well and they made a remark about it.

label: guilt
text: When I decided to move away from my parent's home, my mother told à me that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.

label: joy
text: When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice, à and his attitude made me glad.

label: fear
text: My episode of fright happened when I came to study.  I had to à stand in front of my still unknown fellow students and talk about à myself.  My hands shook, I flushed and became tongue-tied.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I spent a night at my boyfriend's place, à particularly because I had been harsh and spiteful when I had à left home.  The reason was that I feared a possible discussion on à the subject and I wanted to leave defiantly.

label: joy
text: I was in a restaurant with my boyfriend when I saw my best female à friend after not seeing her for two weeks.  We rejoyced, hugged à and had a long talk.

label: fear
text: One evening, while going to meet a friend of mine, I had to cross à a meadow by a dark road.  There were bushes on the other side of à the road.  The weather was damp and a bit foggy.  I heard steps à behind me and kept speeding up my steps all the time.

label: anger
text: My brother told me that a person (whom I know) had insulted him.  à I am very fond of my brother, and as he himself can not get angry à or hurt, my protectiveness was aroused and I got angry.

label: sadness
text: My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.  One evening, à when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.  My mother's à expression told me that it had died.  My knees refused to support à me and I began to weep convulsively.

label: disgust
text: I happened to see two boys fighting, one of them fell down and à hurt his head.  The other one used this to spank the head of the  boy on the ground.

label: shame
text: I had been away all night without having told my parents about à it.  In the morning when I came home, my mother looked tired.  à She said that she had been awake all night because of me and that à she was angry and disappointed.

label: guilt
text: I had not written to, or called my grandmother, who was lonely, à for a long time.  My mother asked me to call her on her behalf à and when I did so, my grandmother was delighted and she told me à that she had been waiting for some news from us.

label: joy
text: When I was sick my husband bought me a piece of cake.

label: fear
text: I saw a man who had had a heart-attack and who was being à treated for it.  I feared that my own father could have been à there.

label: anger
text: When I saw a big man hit another one, and nobody did anything.

label: sadness
text: When my sister left to go home, in Sweden, after the Christmas à Holidays.

label: disgust
text: I once watched the series called "Dynasty" on TV, and I detested à it.

label: shame
text: I feel guilty as I am not working, and even my studies are not à progressing.

label: joy
text: When my red-cheeked, content child runs to meet me in the yard of à the kindergarten and gives me a moist kiss on my cheek.

label: fear
text: A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were looking à for her.  Someone had gone to notify the police.  Something had à certainly happened to her.

label: anger
text: Without my permission, my son had made popcorn after coming back à from school.  The consequences were a spoilt kettle and chaos in à the kitchen but what could have happened with the hot grease ?

label: sadness
text: The death of a close relative.

label: disgust
text: One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means to à advance her studies faster than others.  I detested her.

label: shame
text: My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders she à committed last night.

label: guilt
text: I stopped my car in front of a pedestrian crossing as a child was à crossing the street.  The car driving in the next lane did not à stop and the child got hurt.  Had I not stopped ...

label: joy
text: After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me to à buy a rose for my mother.  We went together to a pub and my à mother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.  I à did not known about it and so was all the more glad.

label: fear
text: I work at a day care centre, and one day when the children were à outdoors a four-year old boy disappeared from the yard.  I was à not looking after them then, but as the manager it was me who was à responsible.

label: anger
text: I was on vacation, and therefore I did not attend a meeting of à the day care centre.  Nevertheless, the very day I came back they à called me early morining to ask me "what are you going to do à about the matter ?" (which had been discussed in the meeting).  à Then I got angry.

label: sadness
text: The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother and à father divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probably à move to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will be à sold (I myself have not been living at home for the past six à years).

label: disgust
text: While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behind à me (two men and a woman).  They were drunk and the conversation à was unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).  They tried à to get others to take part in the conversation.  I loathed it and à felt like crying.

label: shame
text: When I was seven years old, I stole a chewing-gum from a big à glass bowl on the counter of a nearby shop, and I got caught.

label: guilt
text: I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting à I forgot to take the minutes.

label: joy
text: I had been away from home for a long time and when I came home I à was delighted.  It was wonderful to see familiar, dear people and à I was rejoycing in advance.  I had been feeling very lonely.

label: fear
text: I awoke at night and did not remember dreaming about antthing in à particular.  I just felt oppressing fear, it was dark and all the à others were sleeping.

label: anger
text: One winter day I, unwillingly, was outdoors with my younger à brother (10 years younger than me).  I lost my temper on him and à wanted to throw my brother down the snow bank we were on.  I à pushed him but not as hard as I had wanted to. We were alone the à two of us.

label: sadness
text: I was on a class excursion, by boat to Stockholm.  At night my à class mates prepared to clebrate their motive in life which was à "life is merriment".  I felt depressed about the way they sought à happiness.

label: disgust
text: I was on my way home by bus.  A man who had drunk a fair amount of à alcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sitting à next to him.  Fortunately it was not me.

label: shame
text: I gave a wrong answer at school.

label: guilt
text: When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that à I had no time and that I would play with him the next day. à However, the next day I said the same thing.

label: joy
text: When, after a long time, I saw a girl with whom I was in love.

label: fear
text: When I was walking on a fairly out-of-the-way street.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for a à concert which I considered important.  He could not get them the à way he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.

label: sadness
text: I was sad when I saw that a beautiful girl was not attainable.

label: disgust
text: I heard somebody talk about studies in a highly enthusiastic à "student-like" way.

label: shame
text: While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, with à a bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, too à raggy.

label: guilt
text: One evening I went out with some friends of mine, although I was à supposed to stay at home with my little sister who is 11.

label: joy
text: While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever  à and amusing sketch.

label: fear
text: When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from à furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.

label: anger
text: The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing a à song about all the students who are leaving.  In the song à about me, there were things which irritated me a lot.

label: sadness
text: I worked for seven months in a factory, and made friends with a à fellow worker.  Later, I visited my former fellow workers and was à told that, while in the army, my friend had shot himself.

label: disgust
text: The behaviour of a fellow towards me and some others in the army à was really mean.  I detested this.

label: shame
text: I tried to date a girl, but she refused.

label: guilt
text: While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it, à though I had marked it as done.  By chance, I was asked to à demonstrate this very part on the blackboard.

label: joy
text: In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got à me a three day furlough.

label: fear
text: When I was 8 years old, I would usually come home from school à with my mother in a car.  For the first time I had to take the à school bus, and I mistook the bus stop and found myself two à kilometres away from where I lived.  I was very scared, wondering à how I would get back home.

label: anger
text: I read in the newspaper that the Student Lodging Fund was going à to build new appartments for refugees (in my opinion this is the à state's affair).  This is when only a fractoin of the students à can find an appartment.

label: sadness
text: I lead a rather secure life.  The only thing I can remember is a à song from the nineteenth century which is against alcohol.  Both à the melody and the word (although naive) effected my emotions.

label: disgust
text: Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this is à something I just can not tolerate.

label: shame
text: In primary school I once faltered while answering a question and à the others started laughing.

label: guilt
text: [ Generally when I am shopping I feel like I were guilty of all à the thefts through the year (I have never stolen).]

label: joy
text: When my favourite football team made a goal and was about to à win the Cup of England.

label: fear
text: I was less than 10 years old when our neighbour's dog chased me à to the roof of a small shed and there seemed to be no hope of à getting away from there.

label: anger
text: While playing a ball game, I was just about to make a goal when I à was thrown off my feet, and I failed to score the goal.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of Frantois Truffaut, the French motion  à picture director, on the radio.  I had planned to go and see his à last film.

label: disgust
text: I saw a movie called "The Thing", the film directed by John à Carpenter.  The monster in the film made me feel disgusted.

label: shame
text: I had misbehaved at a party and did not wish to meet the person à in question later.

label: guilt
text: While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.

label: joy
text: When I was in the sauna bath.

label: fear
text: I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.

label: anger
text: When I came for the lesson, it was cancelled and I had to fill in à a questionnaire instead.

label: sadness
text: When my car froze, and I could not start it.

label: disgust
text: When I saw our computer teacher.

label: shame
text: When I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the first à time.

label: guilt
text: When I was involved in a car crash.

label: joy
text: I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.

label: fear
text: My mother had not come home at midnight.  She had forgotten to à tell me about it.  I was very young and all alone at home.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend started singing (she cannot sing) and did not stop à despite my asking her to do so.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died of cancer.

label: disgust
text: When I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in which à there was a rotten human skull.

label: shame
text: As a small boy, I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.  My mother à saw it and told the driver about it.  I even knew the driver.

label: guilt
text: When I betrayed my former girlfriend.

label: anger
text: New Year's Eve party in the country, I hardly knew a person; my à partner spent most of the time at the bar. I had little à opportunity to get to know people because our table was separated à and my boyfriend's parents were present.

label: sadness
text: Christmas Eve: there was a tension between my parents, they did à not even try to restore a harmonic atmosphere. Mother stayed in à her room almost the whole day. I felt alone and was very sad.

label: disgust
text: Father said: If you are pregnant, you will have to procure à abortion. I was filled with disgust against my father.

label: shame
text: I had an intimate relation with my boyfriend, but unfortunately à we had sexual problems; therefore I deceived him, but I was à ashamed when I told my friend about it.

label: guilt
text: I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day à in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold à for half an hour.

label: joy
text: After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat we à are able to pay for.

label: fear
text: Car accident in the middle of the night.

label: anger
text: At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of a à sports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day off à because he didn't like me.

label: sadness
text: When I was six years old, my favourite cat died.

label: disgust
text: A gigantic spider climbed over my face and what is more - in my à own flat.

label: shame
text: I was very fat and felt absolutely unwell. I was afraid of à leaving the house and getting to know new people.

label: guilt
text: I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and à growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until à several weeks later.

label: joy
text: I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informed à about it, I felt joy.

label: fear
text: My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation, her à eyesight was at stake.

label: anger
text: I had a quarrel with my parents; I was convinced to be right.

label: sadness
text: I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation: à suddenly a friend came in and said "Have you already heard à that..."; there was a terrible consternation, silence, then à everybody shouted excitedly "How could that happen...".

label: disgust
text: Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunk à men thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene from à another carriage.

label: shame
text: I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended à love and affection to be able to sleep with her.

label: guilt
text: A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover's à grief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been the à reason for her action.

label: joy
text: In order to be admitted to my final examination, I had to pass à two examinations. As I had not studied very much, I resigned à myself to be left behind. Nevertheless I succeeded in these à examinations.

label: fear
text: I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day, à my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could à influence my parents to take it easy.

label: anger
text: I wanted to go to a friend of mine who had a party; at the moment à I wanted to leave, my father said I couldn't go because he needed à me for some work in the afternoon.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before, à did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half à a year later.

label: disgust
text: Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station à at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and à the government decided to delay it for another year. When my à father heard about it, he said that we needed another Hitler.

label: shame
text: There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just at à that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her à from entering the room.

label: guilt
text: I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I did à not do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraid à that he would grumble.

label: joy
text: My boyfriend returned after a long absence.

label: fear
text: My car skidded on the wet street.

label: anger
text: I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and à had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me, à played cards with other people.

label: sadness
text: A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange à manner.

label: disgust
text: In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing à with his penis in the middle of the town.

label: shame
text: Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him a à lie.

label: guilt
text: When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; I à felt guilty the next day.

label: anger
text: Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something. à He never said "please" or "thank you" or any other kind word.

label: sadness
text: My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him, but à it was hopeless, he had to be shot.

label: disgust
text: I read a book about the sexual phantasies of women; I read about à a woman having sexual intercourse with a dog.

label: shame
text: In our flat the bath-tub is in the kitchen. At the beginning I à had very intensive feelings of shame when I had a bath and people à were in the kitchen.

label: guilt
text: I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several à weeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so that à two of them perished.

label: joy
text: When I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrel à but after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.

label: fear
text: When we stayed in Vienna with our class, my friend and I behaved à incorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion from à school.

label: anger
text: When I lost my driving license because I had been driving while à under the influence of alcool.

label: sadness
text: My mother's death.

label: disgust
text: When I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think I à felt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.

label: shame
text: I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a night à club.

label: guilt
text: During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. When à we went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost his à way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he à finally arrived but after a very long time).

label: joy
text: My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to write à letters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a good à relation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that he à loved me.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I was always afraid of my father. Just when à he looked at me, I felt frightened.

label: anger
text: A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain à things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an à aggressive manner.

label: sadness
text: During the Christmas holidays, I went to see my parents and à stayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days, we had à the same conflicts we had had ten years before when I had lived à with them. They were glad when I left.

label: disgust
text: Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his nose à and glass-eye, rattling breath.

label: shame
text: When my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing there à naked.

label: guilt
text: I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell in à love with another man.

label: joy
text: When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.

label: fear
text: One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car, à but I was too frightened to go and see.

label: anger
text: When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a à chair.

label: sadness
text: A person died (not really a friend).

label: disgust
text: Several weeks ago, I had problems with friends, I felt disgusted à by a friend.

label: shame
text: When I was a child, I thought that I had to be ashamed when à asking and doing certain forbidden things.

label: guilt
text: When quarreling with friends.

label: joy
text: In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, I à was not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming joy.

label: fear
text: My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool). à Suddenly some soil fell on us, then some water. Although we tried à hard, we could not find out the cause.

label: anger
text: I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics. à Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and à started to cry. I grew angry.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend told me that she wanted to leave me.

label: disgust
text: On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day, à beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.

label: shame
text: When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was à 16). When I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a short à time.

label: guilt
text: I came home from a discotheque at half past four in the morning, à although I had promised my parents to come home at midnight. From à 3 a.m. I felt guilty towards my parents.

label: joy
text: A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.

label: fear
text: On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. It à stopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore it à but I was very frightened.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to act à as a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of an à hour before the appointed time, I had just lied down and did not à want to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I only à was talking about looking for work, but if it was possible I à would not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.

label: sadness
text: After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for half à a year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (for à economic reasons). We separated although I loved him.

label: disgust
text: In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prison à and souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted when I read à detailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of less à powerful people.

label: shame
text: When I talked to a psychotherapist for the first time, I started à to cry; first I talked to him but he did not say anything and à after a while I was crying.

label: guilt
text: I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother à always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting à my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I à just behaved aggressively towards my sister.

label: joy
text: When I worked as an "au-pair-girl" in London, I received a call à from a good friend who told me that she was in London too and à wanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call and à especially when I saw her.

label: fear
text: It was on St. Claus Day when I was five years old. St. Claus and à his Devil Servant came to see me. St. Claus' Devil Servant à rattled with his chain and bowled terribly. I was so frightened à that my parents had to ask him to leave.

label: anger
text: A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see à me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town. à Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got à impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone à skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment à to be able to see her.

label: sadness
text: When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. When à I saw his body I was sad beyond words.

label: disgust
text: A friend prepared a soup with chicken heads and invited me to eat à it. I saw the eyes staring at me and the tongues hanging out of à the bills. I was so disgusted that I felt nausea and had to leave à the room.

label: shame
text: When I had to go to the gynecologist and to sit on that special à chair, I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: After a terrible quarrel with my family, I withdrew in my room. I à felt guilty because I had caused this scene by my aggressive à behavior.

label: joy
text: I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very à much.

label: fear
text: I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relatively à well prepared.

label: anger
text: At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my new à trousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on the à trousers again.

label: sadness
text: In 1977, my grandfather, to whom I had a very close relationship, à died.

label: disgust
text: A drunken man forced me to kiss him.

label: shame
text: A friend started to insult another person without reason and I à felt ashamed of her behavior.

label: guilt
text: I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had no à possibility to call him at this time, I did not do it until 3 à p.m.

label: joy
text: After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even more à glad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.

label: fear
text: I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went very à fast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. By à chance, I met some friends who accompanied me.

label: anger
text: A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in the à morning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in the à evening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.

label: sadness
text: When my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. When I heard à about her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really à became conscious of her death at that moment.

label: disgust
text: A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many à people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said à and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear. à He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted à when he told that.

label: shame
text: In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told à the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him à that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard à that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.

label: guilt
text: After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key à inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own à house but the house of people I hardly knew.

label: joy
text: On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By à chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for à the dress-rehearsal of "Aida". It was a different world for us à full of fascination. After the representation we ate a phantastic à pizza in a restaurant near the "Arena".

label: fear
text: On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near à the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my à girlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me. à He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I à really did not like that.

label: anger
text: I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some à silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry  à clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.

label: sadness
text: I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies. à This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departure à are always very depressing.

label: disgust
text: When I stayed in the house of friends, I washed my face and à wanted to dry it with a towel. This towel seemed to have been à used over a long time already. It smelled indefinably awful.

label: shame
text: A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore, once I à stayed with him and his girlfriend, I bought some meat, but nobody à wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said "I thought à you wanted to invite us for dinner". "Of course", I said, but I à thought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought à it.

label: guilt
text: It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl à but I considered it only as an "affair". Only much later I realized à how painful this must have been for the girl.

label: joy
text: When I was informed that a short story I had written had been à accepted for publication.

label: fear
text: Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends à was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming à in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and à prevent the accident.

label: anger
text: I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had à caused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned my à efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had à intended.

label: sadness
text: Death of my grandmother.

label: disgust
text: In school I had difficulties mith mathematics. When I had to work à for an examination, I really felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: I played in a stage play. Suddenly, in front of 200 people, I à could not remember the words I had to say.

label: guilt
text: One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I à did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had à a bad conscience and felt guilty.

label: joy
text: After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.

label: fear
text: One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk men à molesting my girlfriend and me.

label: anger
text: I went singing with a group of young people on January 6th (The à three Magi), a local custom called "star singing". One of the girls, my à girlfriend, broke the star. Being the accompanying person, I felt very à angry thinking of the consequences.

label: sadness
text: When the grandmother of my friend died in a hospital. My friend à was crying and I was sad, too.

label: disgust
text: I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of à his mouth while speaking.

label: shame
text: It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something,  but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I felt à ashamed and blushed.

label: guilt
text: My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I à prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).

label: joy
text: I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for à me, I was very glad.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thought à there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and à trembled.

label: anger
text: During a lecture, a colleague who did not know anything about the à subject, got on my nerves asking silly questions.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss à them.

label: disgust
text: During a football game, another player who was perspiring very à strongly ran into me.

label: shame
text: I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did it à worse than ever. I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: During the military service, I lost a part of an equipment; I à accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.

label: joy
text: At a choral concert I appeared as a solist. The concert5 was very à good, I forgot all the hard work that had been done before. There à remained only an undescribable joy and a feeling of warmth, à security etc.

label: fear
text: I am a "cantor" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago I à had to sing too, but the organist did not tell me in time. As I à did not know the psalm, I was afraid and said that I could not à sing.

label: anger
text: During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his à girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my à brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place à for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I à had never asked her.

label: sadness
text: Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heard à about it, I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myself à to it.

label: disgust
text: I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about the à terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the à white population.

label: shame
text: My P.T. instructor also works as a masseur. He wanted to massage à me, therefore I had to undress. For the first few times this was à not easy for me; I got gradually used to it.

label: guilt
text: Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the à theoretical questions very well, but I failed the practical à driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.

label: joy
text: When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He had à undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death. à When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after à may weeks.

label: fear
text: After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to à Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a à man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his à car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being à robbed in Marocco.

label: anger
text: After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to à relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had à finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.

label: sadness
text: I met some nice people during my holdidays. When they left I knew à that I would never see them again.

label: disgust
text: A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by à insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in à front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in à order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to à calm the man, but without success. Just because he was stronger à we had to comply. From that day I detested him.

label: shame
text: For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off our à clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go à into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and à staring at us.

label: guilt
text: I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way. à My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slapped à my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.

label: joy
text: One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to à somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.

label: fear
text: I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was in the night à and I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure, nervous and à overstrained.

label: anger
text: My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said à mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died whom I had loved very much. I was very sad and à I felt totally helpless.

label: disgust
text: I watched the news at the TV, it was a commentary about à "Hainburg". I felt disgusted when I heard members of the union à speak about the situation.

label: shame
text: I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me à when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.

label: guilt
text: I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things which à I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt à guilty.

label: joy
text: A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once à she had a child she had a better relationship with them.

label: fear
text: Once our school class went skiing. On a steep slope a boy à standing behind me lost his balance, fell down and drew me with à him. I slided down the whole slope. At about 1 m distance from a à tree I could stop.

label: anger
text: It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about à the young people just because I had not immediately left my seat à to them.

label: sadness
text: When I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. I à always won in competitions, but once I was only at the fourth à place.

label: disgust
text: A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.

label: shame
text: Some men were talking about me and my sister.

label: guilt
text: During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me à outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain à hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the à circumstances

label: joy
text: I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I had à not seen for two years.

label: fear
text: I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house. à I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there à was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.

label: anger
text: At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me à and nobody mentioned anything about that.

label: sadness
text: My little cat which I had raised all by myself, hanged itself when à playing in the garden.

label: disgust
text: At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help à another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the à wrong things so that he had to repeat a year.

label: shame
text: When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her à feel hurt.

label: guilt
text: I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment à but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed à holiday job.

label: joy
text: I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our à "11-months jubilee", I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red à rose.

label: fear
text: When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I came à home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so à frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited à until somebody passed by.

label: anger
text: I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could à not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the à University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it à finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home à she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her à boyfriend.

label: sadness
text: When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His à legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I à came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few à days later he died.

label: disgust
text: When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had à big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of à the night and shouted at me.

label: shame
text: At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had à admonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to do à it. When my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to be à rebuked in front of the other pupils.à

label: guilt
text: When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. à Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried à and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.

label: joy
text: After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried à home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling à his body.

label: fear
text: One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground à floor, I was often afraid of burglers.

label: anger
text: One day, when riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from the à opposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I had à the priority.

label: sadness
text: My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly à would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was à confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.

label: disgust
text: One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimy à substance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made of à cider and threatened to throw it at me.

label: shame
text: When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had à told him that my father had retired.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I à had wanted to.

label: joy
text: A party with friends on New Year's Eve.

label: fear
text: When I was hitch-hiking and I went with a man who drived like a à madman.

label: anger
text: I was in "Hainburg" in December and I was angry about the à politicians and the police.

label: sadness
text: I met again a very good friend after a year and realized that à there had grown a certain distance between us.

label: disgust
text: When I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the à power of money.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died - at her funeral.

label: disgust
text: I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrel à which was filled with blood of pigs.

label: shame
text: I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about à our problems, I told her lies.

label: guilt
text: I had to tell a collegue the time for an appointment with another à collegue. I told her the wrong time - it was obviously my fault.

label: joy
text: I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, my à father took his purse and payed.

label: fear
text: My mother had fallen down from a ladder when she had been à gathering cherries. Her back was hurt. Just when I arrived, I saw à people of the life-saving service giving her medical care.

label: anger
text: I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking à place, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncoming à traffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed à his car on the place.

label: sadness
text: My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.

label: disgust
text: At a discussion a friend took a "faschistic view", what I had not à expected.

label: shame
text: At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was à prevented from participating in several activities.

label: guilt
text: When I was driving my motorbike I went into a bend incautiously à and fell down. I was slightly hurt, the motorbike was slightly à damaged.

label: joy
text: Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could à not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big à surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our à relationship grew closer.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and could à be freed only with big difficulties.

label: anger
text: I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive and à dangerous driving habit.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died. I had a very deep relation to her (I à lived with her for several years).

label: disgust
text: Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my à part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly à she did not give up for a longer time.

label: shame
text: When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men à and women.

label: guilt
text: When I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped into à another car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of the à other car was very angry and I let him insult me because I felt à guilty.

label: joy
text: A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and à invited me for a party.

label: fear
text: When I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling young à people approached.

label: anger
text: When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would à have liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on the à letter.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died.

label: guilt
text: When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught à me with them in my bag.

label: joy
text: When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for à hours. She was in a good mood.

label: fear
text: When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I've à just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess, à and nervous.

label: anger
text: When I wanted to talk to someone I liked and whom I have been à told likes me (by his brother and even by himself) however he à avoids any confrontation, and is vague.

label: sadness
text: After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of à support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.

label: disgust
text: When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing in à front of a group of my friends.

label: shame
text: When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a à doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

label: guilt
text: Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out to à the point of feeling sick, especially as I am fat.

label: joy
text: When planning to marry.

label: fear
text: No really strong such emotion. Just falling off to sleep when I à caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow à beside me.

label: anger
text: My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in à recent broken relationship.

label: sadness
text: Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped along à by would-be  in-laws.

label: disgust
text: No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by her à dancing instructor - he is a "user", i.e., takes advantage of her à good nature.

label: shame
text: After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of à difficult personal circumstances.

label: guilt
text: Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourth à year twice.

label: joy
text: When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians à at ther wedding.

label: fear
text: Car accident nearly occurred between us and drunk driver coming à in opposite direction it missed us by approx 1 m and collided à (after rolling twice midair) into nearby scrub.

label: anger
text: When boyfriend lied to me.

label: sadness
text: When my boyfriend took me to his father's grave.

label: disgust
text: On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years) à cigarettes.

label: shame
text: When harassed by this boy - it was sexual (refer to GUILT).

label: guilt
text: When in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeks à because of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother about à why I was home late.

label: joy
text: Getting a part-time job.

label: fear
text: Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of us à started zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180_ turn we à followed and ended up in a gully.

label: anger
text: People hunting animals.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though, à when he was sick.

label: disgust
text: People spitting in railway stations.

label: shame
text: Falling over.

label: guilt
text: Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I à shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.

label: joy
text: When my last year's second semester results came through - I was à ecstatic.

label: fear
text: I was sleeping in my room but woke in the middle of the night to à think I could hear noises and see shadows moving. I felt that à someone was in the house.

label: anger
text: At school, a couple of years ago, a so-called acquaintance told lies à about me to a teacher I was told about it by friends who overheard à the conversation.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for à himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as à we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an à unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't à jailed.

label: sadness
text: In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with à several employers, after several years of dedication I was à dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.

label: disgust
text: I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person that à didn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and the à attacked person bleeded to much.

label: shame
text: In a party of friends I got completely drunk.

label: guilt
text: Once in my homes yard, I was plaing football with my cousin and à in a certain quick the ball went on uncontrolled putting down a à bird-cage, killing it.

label: joy
text: When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job, a à boyfriend, etc. A specific sutuations, was when I started to date à a boy whom I liked for a long time.

label: fear
text: When I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.

label: anger
text: When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked, à because there where persons that didn't have problems, and à wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I had to give up something that by right was à mine and although I didn't get it, a kind of suvenir that people à don't give you the right to have.

label: disgust
text: The acts of brutal violence in generally disgusts me. Fights, à phisical aggrssion, etc.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a text à and didn't stop stuttering.

label: guilt
text: When I was reproved eighth grade of high school.

label: anger
text: When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was à rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.

label: sadness
text: The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.

label: disgust
text: In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after the à sexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.

label: shame
text: When I wanted to kiss a friend and didn't succeed, I felt shame.

label: guilt
text: On a telephone talk where I was agressive and stupid without the à least, reason or better motive.

label: joy
text: When I succeed in writing something I felt and doing it I felt à well and very happy for being able to express to myself something à that was suffocating me.

label: fear
text: When I crashed my car.

label: anger
text: When in a difficult moment I couldn't express myself correctly à and my thought came out with distortions bringing about highly à negative and distorted results.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I à was not present either to see the person or to try to share my à emotions with other friends.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide à how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of à such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she à told me.

label: shame
text: When somebody suddenly said something (about me) at a wrong à moment and I didn't agree (at that exact moment I was needing an à extremely positive word).

label: shame
text: When my mother surprised me while masturbating.

label: guilt
text: I forgot to water the flowers in our flat and was rebuked by my à friends who share the flat with me.

label: joy
text: After my final examination at school I was glad that the à examination was over and that I had passed it.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I had a nightmare. At that time, I was not à yet able to tell anybody about it, so I was very frightened. I à could not explain myself all that and I had to deal with it by à myself.

label: anger
text: I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball à offending her relatives.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died. When I heard about his death, I had a à bad feeling in my stomach and I felt as if I had lost something à very precious.

label: disgust
text: My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.

label: shame
text: Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a à nonsense.

label: guilt
text: I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a à flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was à for her to do it.

label: joy
text: For about one year I had a rather bad relation with my father. à Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay withhim and I was very à glad about it. It was a fine evening.

label: fear
text: I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went home à from the bus stop alone. It was dark, I had to go through a à forest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was very à frightened.

label: anger
text: My sister had promised to help me to do a translation from à English into German. But the day I needed her she told me that à she was busy - I was very angry.

label: sadness
text: Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long à time, but nevertheless her death came unexpectedly. I did not and à I still do not want to believe that it is true.

label: disgust
text: I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood à I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).

label: shame
text: I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would à never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed à about what I had said.

label: guilt
text: An accident happened to my little cousin because I had not taken à enough care of her. She fell on the floor and her hands were à hurt.

label: joy
text: I had a little cat which was very sick. As I liked it very much I à went to a veterinary with it. He told me how to tend it and it à really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved its à life.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, I had a terrible nightmare with St. Nicholas' à Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she à said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and a à light had to be left turned on.

label: anger
text: As I usually do not start learning until a short time before an à examination,, I once made up my mind to try to work for a longer à time. But once again I did not do it - and got a bad mark.

label: sadness
text: A friend told me about his cousin who is my girlfriend. He said à she had treated him in a mean and nasty way. I was surprised à because in front of other people she had always treated him in a à friendly way. I am very sad about it.

label: disgust
text: I went out with my sister, her boyfriend and his friend. I did à not like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissed à me. He was very strong so that I could not defend myself.

label: shame
text: During the oral part of my final examination I made a mistake in à speaking so that all the teachers laughed at me.

label: guilt
text: There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I à always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my à mother. So my mother always scolded her.

label: joy
text: When I passed my final examination at school.

label: fear
text: When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them à and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.

label: anger
text: When I felt being treated unjustly by a teacher.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died; I had a stronger relation to her than à to my mother.

label: disgust
text: When I was molested by an old drunk man.

label: shame
text: When I had a Latin examination in school.

label: guilt
text: When I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.
