label: joy
text: When I met my girlfriend again in another town after a long à separation.

label: fear
text: When I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go through à a wood.

label: anger
text: A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for an à examination.

label: sadness
text: When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.

label: disgust
text: At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered; à blood was dripping on the floor.

label: shame
text: In school I was very bad in running long distances and my à class-mates laughed at me for this reason.

label: guilt
text: I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend I à did not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurt à while he was playing.

label: joy
text: On my birthday, an old friend of mine sent me a card. I had not à met him for a year and I was very glad that he had thought of me.

label: fear
text: Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We à told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny à noises. I was terribly frightened.

label: anger
text: When we still attended school, my brother and I usually went to à see our aunt and to show her our term's report. She rewarded us à with money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's, he à got more money.

label: sadness
text: My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second à month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt à very sorry for her.

label: disgust
text: When I attended school, our class visited an institution for à mentally and physically handicapped persons. Although I tried to à control my feelings, I was disgusted.

label: shame
text: After a party I spent the night with a friend. We both were à drunk, the morning was disillusioning. A friend was me leaving à the room and I felt shabby and immoral.

label: guilt
text: I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after à it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt à guilty.

label: joy
text: A very good friend of mine had been away for three months. When à we met again, we ran up to each other and embraced.

label: fear
text: One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a à beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in à the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an empty à bottle with me.

label: anger
text: I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. He à threatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All people à stood around the open grave and cried.

label: disgust
text: At a party I met a girl who drew me to her, told me some nonsense à and always wanted to kiss me.

label: shame
text: I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The à girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: My uncle had promised to buy me a bicycle. As time went by and I à had not received it yet, I asked my father to buy it for me. à Later I heard that my uncle had wanted to offer me the bicycle on à my birthday two weeks later.

label: joy
text: Several days after my final examination at school, I was sitting à in an airplane on my way to Greece. I enjoyed that moment very à much.

label: fear
text: One night I was lying in my bed awake but I had my eyes closed. I à saw figures with terrible faces and black frocks bending over me à and touching me. I opened my eyes but I could still see them. I à had the feeling that somebody was in the room. It was terrible. à Only when I turned on the light I was able to go to sleep.

label: anger
text: I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car. à We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my à friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly à started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for à me to go to Carinthia.

label: sadness
text: Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him à very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the à hunter who shot him.

label: disgust
text: I was sitting in a station-hall and watching a lavatory à attendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something out à of a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then she à took some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and ate à them. I had to leave - I felt like vomitting.

label: shame
text: I had to go to the doctor's because of a veneral disease. I told à the doctor that I must have been infected by my boy-friend. This à was not true, but I was ashamed to tell the truth.

label: guilt
text: When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my à mother I did not admit that it was my fault.

label: joy
text: My neighbour was not able to set his car in motion because it had à snowed heavily. I helped him - he was thankful and invited me.

label: fear
text: I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not à want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.

label: anger
text: At an examination I got a bad mark just because of a small à mistake. When I went to the lector and wanted to talk about that, à he did not listen to me but sent me away.

label: sadness
text: My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I à found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with à the driver.

label: disgust
text: When I watched a report about El Salvador on TV, I saw people who à had been murdered by terrible methods.

label: shame
text: At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which is à not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had à observed that.

label: guilt
text: During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it à impossible to continue discussing.

label: joy
text: On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a long à time.

label: anger
text: When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that à the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead à of listening, I become angry.

label: sadness
text: When we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4 à weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I à had a job there.

label: disgust
text: I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgusted à when we had the dissecting-course. I cannot understand why some à persons like this course.

label: shame
text: Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. For à tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker à player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to à win the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have been à necessary.

label: guilt
text: I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we à started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said à that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some à time later I apologized for that.

label: joy
text: On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myself à and got to know many other people.

label: fear
text: I had to go to the dentist's. When he touched my tooth with his à drill, I was terribly aftaid of the pain I would feel any moment.

label: anger
text: I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating when a friend à called me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry because à I was prevented from eating.

label: sadness
text: My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which I à refused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorry à for that and something like sadness.

label: disgust
text: On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me. à At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills à me with disgust.

label: shame
text: I asked my friend to come with me to a disco because I wanted to à be with a person I know well. But when I amused myself with à others I let my friend sit alone, although I had asked her to à come.

label: guilt
text: I called my little sister to make her pick up her toy from the à floor. When she still refused after I had asked her for the à fourth time, we began to quarrel. At last the whole family was à involved in this quarrel and trouble was brewing.

label: joy
text: I had a singing-lesson, but I was not very good. The last à exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher à seemed satisfied.

label: fear
text: A teacher wanted to instill a certain opinion and a certain à behaviour into myself, what I refused. I was afraid when I saw à him.

label: anger
text: A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expected à his call impatiently but in vain.

label: sadness
text: Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for à the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas à Years ago.

label: disgust
text: A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.

label: shame
text: It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed à Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because à I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able à to join the conversation.

label: guilt
text: I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from my à boy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member à of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, but à his feelings were. I felt guilty when he said "I am not a à radiator".

label: joy
text: On my 18th birthday I passed the driving-test. I was glad because à I had had to study very much, because I had been lucky and à because - as a proof that it was really difficult - not everybody à had passed the test.

label: fear
text: At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the à whole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed me à through the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street the à car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.

label: anger
text: I had studied for almost one week for my physics-examination. à With difficulty I passed the examn. I was angry about the teacher à and also about myself because I had not remembered enough during à the examn and because the time that I spent studying was wasted.

label: sadness
text: I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I à cried for several days because I was so sad.

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very à disgusting, especially because I was eating.

label: shame
text: At a carneval-party I smooched with a man - some days later I was à rather ashamed for that.

label: guilt
text: By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt à her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.

label: joy
text: During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to know à in the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered à her very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing our à adresses.

label: fear
text: Many years ago I saw the film "Psycho" by Hitchcock for the first à time. When I saw the film I was alone and afterwards I hardly à dared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep.

label: anger
text: I had got a bad cold. My father said I must be crazy to go by à motorbike at those temperatures. When I answered him that I did à not care about a cold, he said that if I did not care for à anything I could leave him (it was for the second time he said à something like that).

label: sadness
text: I was at home alone when I realized that a young roe approached à our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It à limped. Some time later, when I thought that it had already run à away, I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that à it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the à roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.

label: disgust
text: Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one à week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my à friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was à terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an à improper and unsavoury conversation.

label: shame
text: My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my à grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory à comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had à died recently.

label: guilt
text: When I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with my à family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly à my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He à gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties à with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help à me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second à key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.

label: joy
text: I had not studied very much for my final examination at school, à so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral à examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I à heard that I had passed it.

label: fear
text: When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is à not a complicated operation, but just before it started I was à very afraid so that I will never forget it.

label: anger
text: My parents are divorced, father pays alimony for me. Two years à ago my sister who lives with father, suddenly asked mother for à money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered à her too small, she brought an action against mother. I was à terribly angry with my sister.

label: sadness
text: I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me à to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come à home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at à home. As something like that had happened to me several times à before, I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody à and I felt very sad.

label: disgust
text: Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.

label: shame
text: When I had slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for à three reasons. First, because I was only 13 years old, second, à because I did not really like him, third, because he had caught à me napping.

label: guilt
text: I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years, à when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal à that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a à bit guilty for what had happened.

label: joy
text: My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of à the life-saving dogs.

label: fear
text: I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought à that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red à switch.

label: anger
text: A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beated him à until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.

label: sadness
text: A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.

label: disgust
text: On TV I saw a report about church in Amerika. A priest was shown à who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt à disgusted.

label: shame
text: When I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and à ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after à me and insisted on my apologizing.

label: guilt
text: I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that I à always started crying so that he had to give in.

label: joy
text: To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination, à I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in the à students' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when I à had the examn, somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock in à the morning. My girl-friend who likes sleeping late, had come to à be able to be with me.

label: fear
text: I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time I à developed a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of my à examination of anatomy. While other students were examined, I was à dissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting with à fear until it was my turn.

label: anger
text: When I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sit à down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally à desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not à finished.

label: sadness
text: My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and à take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for à me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own à feelings were intensified.

label: disgust
text: When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed à only helplessness and indecision.

label: shame
text: I spent an evening with my girl-friend. When we wanted to go to à bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I threw away an object, which belonged to a friend, because I did à not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that à and I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.

label: fear
text: My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.

label: anger
text: I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg, à especially when I saw a discussion about it on TV.

label: sadness
text: Death of my father; he died of laryngeal cancer.

label: disgust
text: When I got indecent offers.

label: shame
text: When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that à I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.

label: guilt
text: My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend à himself very well; I should have taken his part.

label: joy
text: I thought that I had failed an examination, but when I was à informed about the mark, I saw that I had passed it.

label: fear
text: Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learned à enough.

label: anger
text: Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I à would win , but at last I lost the game.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather's funeral.

label: disgust
text: In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his à guts when he was still alive.

label: shame
text: I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me à something which they thought I should know. Actually I know it, à but at that time I was not able to remember it.

label: guilt
text: I had an appointment with a friend. I promised him to meet with à him, but at last I did not without having informed him.

label: joy
text: When I had a psychical crisis, I met a girl, who told me that she à had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome à them.

label: fear
text: I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick à caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars à and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on à my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because à of an occurence that had happened some time ago). When I heard à about that I was very angry.

label: sadness
text: My grandfather was seriously ill, he had only a few days left to à live. I had always loved him, but never told him. When I saw him à for the last time, I had the feeling that I had omitted so many à things I could not do again. - There was a fly sitting on his à forehead and he was too weak to drive it away. I was very sad à when I saw that.

label: disgust
text: Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes, we do not speak à about sexual things, too. But once he told such a vulgar joke, à that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me, but some of his à friends, but I was present.

label: shame
text: When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a à friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother à watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We à never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as à it was for me.

label: guilt
text: When I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wanted à to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him à that and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I had à hurt him so much.

label: joy
text: Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much. à Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their à group, although it was late in the evening.

label: fear
text: After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did à not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was à madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I à told him to be cautious, but he did not care.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I à am always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury. à Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again. à When I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it out à again and put the butter into the pan.

label: sadness
text: After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for à several days and we had got on very well. When they had left, I à had a feeling of emptyness.

label: disgust
text: I had a quarrel with a friend who lived with me in the same flat. à He moved out. Before he went he invited me and some friends for a à drink. At last he was totally drunk and smelled disgusting. à Besides, he told lies about us and behaved as if he was to be à pitied.

label: shame
text: I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and à everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought à nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything à - although I knew how he felt.

label: guilt
text: With a group of handicapped people we went to a party. When we à wanted to leave we were not able to find one of these people. I à had told his mother that we would leave at 4.30 p.m., actually it à was planned for 3.30 p.m. Therefore there was a delay.

label: joy
text: I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault, à everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he à surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.

label: fear
text: After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time, I always à trembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard steps à coming nearer.

label: anger
text: I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine à for my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent one à thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.

label: sadness
text: I had to give up my love, because it did not work out well.

label: disgust
text: I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.

label: shame
text: My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show à the letter the door, which was almost crashed, I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that à there was no reason for that.

label: joy
text: My sister had a daughter. I saw the baby for the first time à through a pane of glass and she looked at me.

label: fear
text: My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and à watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to à turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and à started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid à that he would do us a harm.

label: anger
text: I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching à the fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had payed à for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would à require.

label: sadness
text: When I was 9 years old, I got a cat, but after 3 days he died. I à was very sad, because I had nursed him and taken him to the à veterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for a à short time I had liked him very much.

label: disgust
text: When my grandmother was about 80 years old, she lived with us for à several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath à the air that smelled of her presence.

label: shame
text: I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned to à write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my à friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was à looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and à her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted à to arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerous à way. When I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a long à time, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had à been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw à how much she had worried (herself).

label: joy
text: When I was 17, I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling à light, which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became à unimportant, I heard or saw the words "overcome egotism". The à feeling of joy remained for month after that experience.

label: fear
text: When we had swimming instruction, we had to take a header from à the springboard. I usually refused to do that, but at least I was à forced to.

label: anger
text: When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other à people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.

label: sadness
text: When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.

label: disgust
text: When I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that à disgusted me.

label: shame
text: When I was 12 years old, some friends of our family had come to à watch TV. I lay on the floor and moved my pelvis. When the other à people had gone, my mother told me that it had looked as if I had à wanted to make sex.

label: guilt
text: When I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our à school who asked me what I was doing.

label: joy
text: When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me, I moved à back to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything à (normally he ofter grumbles at me).

label: fear
text: I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me, à that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband could à not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.

label: anger
text: I have a very big family. At my grandmother's funeral we all met à and everybody pretended mourning. In reality it was like a à fashion-show: everybody wanted to show himself.

label: sadness
text: Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.

label: disgust
text: After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat, one of them did à not want to leave, because he wanted to sleep with me. He said à that he had fallen in love with me, that he felt alone and so on.

label: shame
text: I look up to my Karate-teacher. When I came to a training lesson à after I had not trained for one week, I was totally stiff. I was à ashamed.

label: guilt
text: My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km à off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough à room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there à once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel à guilty.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school à (with success).

label: fear
text: Before my final examination.

label: anger
text: When my mother kept me in leading-strings.

label: sadness
text: When my father died.

label: disgust
text: When I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.

label: shame
text: When I made a fool at an examination.

label: guilt
text: When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an à examination.

label: joy
text: Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with à whom I get along very well.

label: fear
text: Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several à reasons: because it was for the first time, because the medical à check-up might be painful, because of the uncertainty and because à someone had informed me about it.

label: anger
text: My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myself à because I had problems when we seperated - I could not resign à myself to it.

label: sadness
text: A friend who was 22 years old died.

label: disgust
text: When I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I à do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very à hungry.

label: shame
text: I had to pay a fine because of speeding.

label: guilt
text: A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known à that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.

label: joy
text: When we got a young dog.

label: fear
text: I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.

label: anger
text: I had an accident with damage to the car body.

label: sadness
text: My dog died of a cerebral tumor.

label: disgust
text: When I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by a à patient whose outward appearance was distasteful.

label: shame
text: When I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undress à myself and was examined by several doctors.

label: guilt
text: When a classmate wanted to sit down, I pulled his chair away, so à that he was slightly injured.

label: joy
text: When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long à time, would come and see me.

label: fear
text: When I had my first oral examination after a long time; à especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling à that I had not studied enough and had not enough time to make up à for it.

label: anger
text: I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although à they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.

label: sadness
text: When my brother died.

label: disgust
text: I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting à open their stomaches and taking out their bowels.

label: shame
text: When I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found it à out.

label: guilt
text: My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and à sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and à when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad à about that.

label: joy
text: I unexpectedly got a present from my father.

label: fear
text: When I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the à night.

label: anger
text: My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. He à did not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.

label: sadness
text: A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.

label: disgust
text: When I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog. à I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my à sole.

label: shame
text: Some persons, who are important for me, came to see me and I had à not washed the dishes.

label: guilt
text: I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down, à was slightly injured and cried vociferously.

label: joy
text: I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long à time.

label: fear
text: I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that à country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.

label: anger
text: A friend had promised to get me a book which was very important à for my work, but she forgot it.

label: sadness
text: My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched his à soporification.

label: disgust
text: A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I à was able to break loose.

label: shame
text: When I stayed on a nudism beach, a man was watching me in a à disagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining my à body.

label: guilt
text: I had a quarrel with my father. He was depressed, because à somebody had treated him injustly. As we had an argument, it was à impossible for me to help him.

label: joy
text: My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at à the station.

label: fear
text: After a motor accident (I was the frong-seat-passenger) I spit à blood.

label: anger
text: At an office an application that I had made was turned down à because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.

label: sadness
text: My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.

label: disgust
text: I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her à awfully.

label: shame
text: After an oral examination I shook the professor's hand, but he à had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.

label: guilt
text: I spread abroad an intimate secret.

label: joy
text: I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I à was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.

label: fear
text: My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my à girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to à lose her.

label: anger
text: I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers à dropped out.

label: sadness
text: During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit à suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she à looked miserable.

label: disgust
text: On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a à woman who were quarreling, beating each other, shouting and so à on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other à in such a degrading way.

label: shame
text: My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get à along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were à sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.

label: guilt
text: I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying à in another room, but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it à would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying à - and it started crying again.

label: joy
text: I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the train à arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I felt à glad.

label: fear
text: When I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dog à standing beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know how à it would react later on.

text: At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and à the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression à on me.

text: When I was driving my car, I wanted to pick something from the à floor of the car and drove into the guide-rail. I thought that I à should not have done that and felt guilty.

text: Recently my younger brother disappeared for two days without à leaving a trace. Usually he tells me when he wants to do à something like that, therefore I was afraid that something had à happened to him.

label: anger
text: I played chess with my 12-year-old brother. I made a stupid à mistake - and he won!

label: sadness
text: It was only once that I really felt sad: at my grandfather's à funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).

label: disgust
text: 3 years ago I served in the army. Once a collegue denounced me à because of a delict, which is usually committed. I was arrested à for 3 days. I still detest this man.

label: shame
text: Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from à sleep.

label: guilt

text: A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not à responding in his favour to a request, that is: he asked me for à some money I refused, and his reaction was quite childish.

The hostesses show à signs of concern and my first thought was that something was on à the runway in our path and that we were in danger of hitting it.

label: anger
text: A person walking his dog allowed it to defecate on the footpath à outside my house. Although it had happened before, this was the à first time I had witnessed it. All the skills I had learnt from à PY 263 were thrown out the window when his indifference to my à protestation was obvious to me.

label: sadness
text: While walking through an old mining area, I unwittingly disturbed à a wallaby which, in its resultant flight, accidentally fell down à a deep mine shaft. On investigation it seemed uninjured, but it à was impossible for the wallaby to get out, and also for me to get à it out of the shaft. To prevent its suffering a slow death, I à shot it.

label: disgust
text: A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a à shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat, à then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous à from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the à bench.

label: shame
text: I had promised to contact a friend about a particular matter by a à certain date, then thought no more about it until the friend à reminded me after the date had passed.

label: guilt
text: A neighbour complained about smoke from my backyard incinerator à entering his house after a change of wind direction. I lit the à fire after originally checking that the wind would not blow the à smoke in that direction.

label: joy
text: On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquet à of flowers.

label: fear
text: When I heard that there had been some women raped at uni, just à near where I usually park my car and walk by myself at night. à Although I wasn't in danger it unnerved me for days and I was à fearful whenever walking through the area.

label: anger
text: When the person I am going out with let me down in a situation à that I was depending on them, and didn't show respect or care.

text: When I found out that a person I went to school with had died in à a car accident.

text: When I heard about the way a parent of a friend had mistreated à him, and caused a great instability.

text: When I came very late one night (or morning !) and my parents à were waiting, not so much angrgy as disappointed.

text: I was walking home late at night from lectures and someone à deliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.

text: Often I forget to give my immediate family birthday presents.

text: I noticed that Meryl Streep and I had similar cheekbones and jaw à structure.

text: I do not recall being scared in the near past.

label: anger
text: As for disgust.

text: Girl I was fond of did not initiate conversation as I expected in à tutorial.

label: disgust
text: I realised that someone was insidiously attempting to shit me off à I was disgusted with him for doing so, because I afforded him à with no excuse to do so.

label: shame
text: I do not seem to feel emotion such as shame, guilt or fear - far à out !

label: guilt
text: I cannot recall feeling guilty in the near past. REMARK - SUBJECT MAY NOT HAVE TAKEN THE EXERCISE VERY SERIOUSLY.

text: When I was complimented and called "delightful".

label: anger
text: Anger towards my lover for being late.

text: The death of my twin sister - suicide.

label: disgust
text: Disgust with myself for consistently making foolish errors in à communicating with others (asking for 1/2 Kg of nuts when I only à wanted 50 g).

label: shame
text: I had been rude to my mother at a time when she needed à comforting, not anger (death of my sister).

label: guilt
text: Guilt - because I had not written to my sister for months before à she died.

text: My current lover and I had been very busy with work and study and à had not had time alone together for almost a month until one à afternoon recently when we made love for hours and then showered à and ate together.

label: fear
text: A workmate and I had been antagonistic with each other for some à weeks - he had reacted violently to my criticisms of his work à standards.

label: anger
text: I had been having a heated argument with a lover - whose à intention was that we should marry in the near future - and was à rejected by her when I started to cry. When I stopped crying for à a moment she said "There, have you got it all out now ?".

label: sadness
text: I was alone in my parents' house, having made plans to spend the à afternoon with a lover (plans which the lover cancelled), à watching a movie and considering my life and circumstances - à pressures of examinations in particular.

label: disgust
text: I discovered some pornographic literature in a workmates drawers. à The literature featured pictures of naked women defecating on one à another.

label: shame

label: guilt
text: My mother and father had forbidden me to ride my scooter on the à road, and I had transgressed (together with the "wild" kids from à across the street) by riding my scooter down a steep hill near à our house. My mother sent the boy next door to collect me, and I à was severely scolded.

label: joy
text: Blank.

text: After going through a glass door, I sustained a number of serious à cuts which were gaping open.

label: anger
text: The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housing à accused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in the à house.

label: sadness
text: Watching "11 am". They had a programme on the starving refugees. à Their plight was a source of sadness for me.

label: disgust
text: A girl with whom I was staying having sex with a person for about à 3 nights running, and then with his brother the following night, à and back again.

label: shame
text: During an argument an acquaintance accused me of having insulted à her parents by having had sex in their house which they à overheard.

label: guilt
text: A girl whom I hadn't seen for a period of time told me that she à had been pregnant and had an abortion - I was the father.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend last told me he loved me after I gave him an à impulsive kiss.

label: fear
text: When my boyfriend was leaving to go home one night, I had a very à deep sense of uneasiness and an unwarranted fear that I wouldn't à see him again.

label: anger
text: Anger with boyfriend's best friend for alienating me and blaming à me for personality changes in my boyfriend and changes in my à boyfriend's attitude to him and his obvious egoistical attitude à himself in doing so. I also lost one of my best friends - his à girlfriend.

label: sadness
text: Death of paternal grandmother to whom I was very close - died of à cancer.

label: disgust
text: Disgust with oneself after being intoxicated enough to go to bed à with a stranger.

label: guilt
text: After being told that an ex-boyfriend had been hurt by my wearing à something he had given me when I was with another guy. I was à unaware of my actions really, as I had not considered the fact à that he had given it to me, and might see me. I still respected à his opinions of me.

label: joy
text: When I thought that my high school love and I had a mutual à emotion.

label: fear
text: I was on my surf ski. Rather large waves to strong current à separated me from my ski and we both began to drift slowly à (actually rather quickly) away to sea. The direction I was à drifting in was taking me straight over a reef on which rather à large sharks were constantly being caught. (I was alone with no à one to help me).

label: anger
text: I was enjoying the company of bird life while I was eating lunch à in a park when a group of people began throwing sticks at some of à the birds - for no reason other than the satisfaction of seeing à them being scared away.

label: sadness
text: When I left my sister's house after staying there for a few days. à She has two little boys, and they are very warm people (the à family). At the time, I was in need of this sort of contact, and à I grew very fond of children (no, I'm not a paedophiliac).

label: disgust
text: When my father revealed inconsistent morals.

label: shame

label: guilt

text: I'd just got the top mark in an exam.

label: fear
text: My brother and I were driving to Brisbane when he drove back onto à the road, perhaps cutting off another car but not noticeable - à this driver did his best to drive us off the road for about 1/2 à an hour.

label: anger
text: I was at the corner shop, which I patronise regularly I had only à a $ 50 note and I purchased about $ 3 worth of goods that I à really needed - the keeper made sarcastic remarks to others about à people using him to cash notes.

label: sadness
text: My mother died of cancer after a 4 year illness - I think the à most pregnant moment of sadness was the next morning, just as the à sun rose.

text: A lecturer in great detail spoke about his sexual experiences.

text: Car accident. Travelling as a passenger along narrow bitumen road à at night - trying to overtake semi-trailer. The truck pulled over à onto our side and we hit the wet dirt, swerved back into the à truck, back onto the verge, over a guide post and into a ditch.

label: anger
text: At school when I had a shouting argument with a friend over my à ability to carry out a particular duty in the correct way without à harming her.

text: When I found out some family friends were embezzelling the à company they worked for - using company petrol and food supplies à and claiming furniture and crockery.

text: I was terribly upset when my kitten got hit by a car. He didn't à die, but for several weeks we thought he might have to be put à down.

text: When I was young, I stole some money from my mother's purse. It à wasn't very much, but I can remember when she found it gone I à felt very guilty.

text: Day I received my T.E. score and acceptance into my chosen course. à

label: joy
text: Eating biscuits and drinking Milo (Chocolate energy drink made à with milk and usually drunk warm) with my friend at College. We à get on really well, don't withold any feelings about each other's à friends and are pretty good at cheering each other up when we are à homesick.

text: Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had à separated and hadn't planned where to meet. I wasn't sure if they à were even going to this place so I felt very conscious of being à alone.

text: A person ignored my advice, did not pay any attention to what was à saying. She acted as though I wasn't even there. We were doing à group work so everybody had the right to speak yet she just à ignored me. She made me feel insignificant.

text: A friend of mine is having psychiatric problems because of his à mother's death ages ago. He is really quiet and because it à relates back to his childhood I feel sadness for him. He doesn't à lead a normal life and it just seems unfair.

text: I was walking quite quickly and unthinking through a children's à playground, when a toddler ran in front of me I knocked him over à and he hit his head quite hard and began crying.

text: Going away for the weekend, leaving my College room open - when I à returned several friends had had a party there, leaving the mess.

text: Passing away of my father.

text: At a party where the boys were telling revolting stories about à the girls they'd been with.

text: Getting slightly intoxicated at the 1984 I.C.C. Ball.

text: I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying à for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.

text: When I received the mark well above requirements for the course I à wanted to enter, yet I was not accepted - anger at the injustice à of it, because I didn't receive early release of H.S.C. marks.

text: When I left all my friends at school (break up) knowing we would à probably all go our separate ways, and none see one another for a à long time.

text: When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I felt à breathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to come à to the surface and inhale.

label: anger
text: When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and be à examined by good experts and she deceived me.

label: sadness
text: When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered à about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see à them as soon as possible.

label: disgust
text: I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himself à with high ranking officials.

label: shame
text: When I hadn't learnt my lesson and I asked the teacher to give me à "a three" and he agreed but even he felt quite awkward. NB: In Bulgarian schools "a three" is the second worst mark.

label: guilt
text: When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my à mother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outward à factors.

label: joy
text: When you are satisfied with something, when you achieve something à you have striven to.

label: fear
text: One fears many things, for example one fears going to the à dentist. but as far as I am concerned this feeling is connected à with the examination session.

label: anger
text: When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have à been right.

label: sadness
text: For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief à when you are away from home, too.

label: anger
text: They wanted something to happen but I didn't.

label: sadness
text: I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.

label: disgust
text: I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned à out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.

label: shame
text: My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going out à with me only because of my defect.

label: guilt
text: Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.

label: joy
text: Having passed an exam.

label: fear
text: Having a car accident.

label: anger
text: I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he à had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.

label: sadness
text: The loss of a very good friend.

label: disgust
text: Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.

label: shame
text: Adultery with the girlfriend of a friend of mine, of which he à learned.

label: guilt
text: Adultery with a friend's girlfriend.

label: joy
text: I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most à of all when we are at a party.

label: fear
text: I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by à the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly à small distance.

label: anger
text: I get angry with people who attain certain status without à deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of à other people.

label: sadness
text: I feel sad when I see things done against men and nothing could à stop it - at least I think so.

label: disgust
text: I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double à dealers.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to à answer in the presence of the patients.

label: guilt
text: I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but I à haven't done it.

label: joy
text: I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher à Institute.

label: fear
text: I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.

label: anger
text: I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deserving à it or when someone deceives me.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons.

label: shame
text: When I do something unworthy.

label: guilt
text: When I offended my parents without wanting it.

label: joy
text: After each successfully passed exam I am happy.

label: fear
text: A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery. à I was afraid for her and for the baby.

label: anger
text: I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do, à naturally negative. Servility, "connections", impudence, traits à that get me mad.

label: sadness
text: My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furlough à but in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.

label: shame
text: Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for - à money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.

label: guilt
text: When I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.

label: joy
text: After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respect à and of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we see à each other rarely he had not forgotten me.

label: fear
text: Few years ago my father was very ill. He stayed at a hospital for à a long time. Then I experienced that terrible feeling that I à might lose him.

label: anger
text: I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost à my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.

label: sadness
text: We are several friends but our characters are very different and à we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself à don't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the "parties" à because there are conflicts to which one I should belong.

label: disgust
text: I stayed for several weeks with a friend of mine before she moved à to live with her husband. One evening he came drunk and made an à awful scene, which I still remember.

label: shame
text: In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time - à wherever I went, in different sutuations. I was small and I had à to be taken to kindergarten, but me the fool didn't dare to tell à exactly where, finally as a result I was late.

label: guilt
text: My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them. à But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I am à to blame for not following the advise of the others, but it is à not late still.

label: joy
text: I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student. à Because everything turned out different from my expectations. à Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a à student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the à beginning of September.

label: fear
text: In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first à months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for à all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first à time) and even forgot that I had a gun.

label: anger
text: When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in à revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights. à Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me à asleep for which he sent me to the cells.

label: sadness
text: Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for à my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years à of my life.

label: disgust
text: Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as a à friend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who's à six was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was really à silly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh! à You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. But à she had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'd à accepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better - à it was partly having my friend there.

label: shame
text: In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's à birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to get à drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit, à but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in à moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed à drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had à to leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went home à and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I à didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.

label: guilt
text: I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never my à mother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feel à when we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I felt à I'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid and à guilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.

label: joy
text: Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.

label: fear
text: Can think of no time that I have felt fear.

label: anger
text: Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a à couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had à stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my à daughter.

label: sadness
text: Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.

label: disgust
text: Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle - à driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.

label: shame
text: A daughter in court for staff pilfering, she was dressed like a à "street walker" - I had a friend form overseas with me and was à falsely trying to impress with my family.

label: guilt
text: Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with à baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk à convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the à police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.

label: joy
text: Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They à were special people to me.

label: fear
text: I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and à companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately à neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

label: anger
text: I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of à being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at à work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been à drinking.

label: sadness
text: My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away à was very sad.

label: disgust
text: Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.

label: shame
text: My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because à I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of à not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same à way.

label: guilt
text: I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while à in a position of trust.

label: joy
text: When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had à hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night à out in 20 years.

label: fear
text: While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a à woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property - à via a flooded river !

label: anger
text: A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others à in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.

label: sadness
text: A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately à offended to provoke a reaction from the police.

label: disgust
text: 4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were à entertaining "conservative" relations who wanted to see the first à episode.

label: shame
text: A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly à visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.

label: guilt
text: I had to leave an important function early because of family à commitments. Someone else had to complete my job.

label: joy
text: I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps à I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoy à being alive.

label: fear
text: I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs, à alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut à fence.

label: anger
text: In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends à unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable, à rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I à didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

label: sadness
text: I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep à going because it was late and I would be back in the next few à days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.

label: disgust
text: My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most à expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove à home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state à and her actions.

label: shame
text: A good friend of mine told me in comfidence that once he had à tried to commit suicide. To meet him you wouldn't think so. I à told another friend of mine about this when she was feeling à depressed about her twin brother's suicide. I broke a bond of à confidentiality.

label: guilt
text: When I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught, à then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to come à and get me.

label: joy
text: When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the à thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had à thought.

label: fear
text: When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.

label: disgust
text: Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm à or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had à behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made à you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the à way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.

label: shame
text: When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connected à with copying at a class-work at school.

label: guilt
text: When I have forgotten to warn somebody for something, or when I à have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.

label: joy
text: When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned à I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature à National Olympiad.

label: fear
text: When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was à necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing à him because he is so dear to me.

label: anger
text: When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at à the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and à in general the best records of all the candidates.

label: sadness
text: When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I à went to live in Sofia.

label: disgust
text: When, for example, someone is calumnating.

label: shame
text: When, for example, I fail in my undertakings.

label: guilt
text: For example, when I have promised something but I haven't à fulfilled it.

label: joy
text: Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the à worst.

label: fear
text: The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.

label: anger
text: I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.

label: sadness
text: Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

label: disgust
text: I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this à feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.

label: shame
text: I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.

label: guilt
text: It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.

label: joy
text: Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfaction à from the realization of one's desires and aims.

label: fear
text: Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping à from under my feet.

label: anger
text: Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned" à relations.

label: sadness
text: Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent à as they are when you are young.

label: disgust
text: Attitude to a related family.

label: shame
text: Exaggerating certain circumstances, wrong attitude and evaluation à of these circumstances.

label: guilt
text: Low evaluation of other people's cares.

label: joy
text: I won a sport contest.

label: fear
text: If a close relative's life is in danger.

label: anger
text: A close person lied to me.

label: sadness
text: Getting separated from my girlfriend.

label: disgust
text: Encouter with a prostitute.

label: shame
text: A theft committed by me.

label: guilt
text: Lack of respect for my parents.

label: joy
text: When my son was born.

label: fear
text: Before an examination.

label: anger
text: Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.

label: sadness
text: After the loss of a close relative.

label: disgust
text: When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of à mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.

label: shame
text: I travelled on a bus and I forgot to punch the ticket. A ticket à collector came in and I had to pay the fine. I did it with a feeling à of shame.

label: guilt
text: I forgot to convey an important announcement.

label: joy
text: Meeting a loved man.

label: fear
text: I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where à I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't à see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the à side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow à light.

label: anger
text: At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment à of one's personality.

label: sadness
text: When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.

label: disgust
text: At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.

label: shame
text: When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I à respect.

label: guilt
text: When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of à yours and you are at the bottom of it.

label: joy
text: I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the à University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I à myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When à the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other à situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of à them.

label: fear
text: This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the à terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

label: anger
text: Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking it à off with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because until à that moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motives à were brought to my knowledge later.

label: sadness
text: Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it à always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it à is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people - à friends who I love and respect.

label: disgust
text: Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes when I have meals at a à catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the à food or when watching the way some people eat.

label: shame
text: This happens to me when I am not prepared in a given subject.

label: guilt
text: Quite unconsciously I offended a girlfriend of mine. It was à really worthy to pass this fact over in silence, but I acted so, à because I believed I was right. In fact it often happens to me to à feel guilt, after I have already done the deed.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the University.

label: fear
text: I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost à for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the à hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I à felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to à me, of the unknown.

label: anger
text: In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite à pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory à which he himself had never known. His information was from à fortuitous sources.

label: sadness
text: Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick to à the window: the childhood, something was going away forever this à summer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in another à town, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I had à to manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - I à was crying.

label: disgust
text: I saw in the street a man spitting.

label: shame
text: I talked with a man who stammered and without controlling myself, à I started to talk imitating him.

label: guilt
text: Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.

label: joy
text: When I understood that I was admitted to the University.

label: fear
text: I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept à under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a à half.

label: anger
text: I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a à form.

label: sadness
text: When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.

label: disgust
text: I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect, à lied to me.

label: shame
text: I feel shame when sometimes, (unconsciously) I behave unethically à and without understanding the problems of the man I love.

label: guilt
text: When I offend somebody unfairly.

label: joy
text: A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person close à to me. Several days later my regret was great. I was beside à myself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmly à solved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.

label: fear
text: One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were à talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it à might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I à felt it a very near and possible event.

label: anger
text: Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I à was the witness of, caused anger in me.

label: sadness
text: The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused à a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the à elementary human norms.

label: shame
text: I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. But à when the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgotten à it. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.

label: guilt
text: At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He à had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison à with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of à guilt.

label: joy
text: When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

label: fear
text: I broke my knee when I was skiing over "Yastrebetz" (a racing à track in a Bulgarian winter resort).

label: anger
text: The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis à to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL à (A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.

label: sadness
text: My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this à feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was à quite strong.

label: disgust
text: A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in à order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a à scholarship for an excellent grade.

label: shame
text: I felt this feeling during the exam in higher mathematics.

label: guilt
text: My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of à amidophen.

label: joy
text: I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of à practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for "a master of sports".

label: fear
text: I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed à towards the precipice along the road.

label: anger
text: When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because à of indifference or cowardice.

label: sadness
text: When I left a man in whom I really believed.

label: disgust
text: Disgust with drunk people.

label: shame
text: When I try to lie.

label: guilt
text: When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity à better but I had not done it because of reluctance or à carelessness.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the University.

label: fear
text: When I broke my leg I felt fear.

label: anger
text: When someone lies to me.

label: sadness
text: At an unjust insult or injure.

label: disgust
text: From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when I à am in a restaurant.

label: shame
text: When I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.

label: guilt
text: When I don't fulfill my obligations.

label: joy
text: When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

label: fear
text: In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plants à and I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescued à ourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was with à us.

label: anger
text: It was quite recently, at the football match between the national à teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish à referee who ran the match quite partially.

label: sadness
text: When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and à which I had listened before together with friends.

label: disgust
text: A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.

label: shame
text: I counterfeited a mark in the school register during the lesson à in gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later when I stood à face to face with my teacher, whom I highly appreciated and à respected.

label: guilt
text: In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they à greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.

label: joy
text: I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in à the children Assembly.

label: fear
text: I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock à someone knocked violently on the door.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he à didn't come.

label: sadness
text: I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I à got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present à one with whom things are not much of a success.

label: disgust
text: Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend à then over me.

label: shame
text: I had to prepare a report but I couldn't write it. I read from a à book off-hand, I was quite uneasy and I felt I didn't manage.

label: guilt
text: My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of à mine.

label: joy
text: Bulgaria won a football match against France.

label: fear
text: I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.

label: anger
text: I was neglected undeservedly.

label: sadness
text: My grandmother died.

label: disgust
text: A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.

label: shame
text: I didn't offer my seat to a pregnant woman in the bus.

label: guilt
text: I didn't attend lectures.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.

label: fear
text: The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt à fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be à in order.

label: anger
text: About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the à due maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.

label: sadness
text: Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no à idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The à fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable à of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in à the tram.

label: shame
text: Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight but à through my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spirits à of a good driver.

label: guilt
text: Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.

label: joy
text: The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. à I can say those were the happiest months in my life.

label: fear
text: A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his à behavior.

label: anger
text: When I encountered not only with my father's lack of à understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as à a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be à right are concerned.

label: sadness
text: From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, in à which the children were involved as accusers of one of the à parents.

label: shame
text: When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.

label: guilt
text: When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take à him out to ride his byke, because I am tired.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty à days.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was à not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.

label: anger
text: I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. à Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come à home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.

label: fear
text: A fear of lack of personal powers.

label: anger
text: At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is à not treated decently.

label: sadness
text: At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).

label: disgust
text: At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity and à mostly at a philistinism.

label: shame
text: At a weakness on my part.

label: guilt
text: When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the University.

label: fear
text: Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to à interrupt my studies.

label: anger
text: I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.

label: sadness
text: At a prolonged separation with my family.

label: disgust
text: I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of à a rat.

label: shame
text: I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am not à prepared to overcome certain obstacle in my life.

label: guilt
text: I offended a person who had done much for me and who had helped à me for everything.

label: joy
text: The day when my son said for the first time "mummy".

label: fear
text: Before an exam in logics.

label: anger
text: My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then à we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to à refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my à anger.

label: sadness
text: My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers à having walks with their children.

label: disgust
text: The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to à my norms of behaviour.

label: shame
text: I was to take part in a cocktail party on the occasion of our à national holiday as a servant.

label: guilt
text: I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.

label: joy
text: The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression, à as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the à situative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it's à out of me.

label: fear
text: I bet that I would jump down from a window. I was sure that I à would jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.

label: anger
text: A honest "sliding" on the part of a girlfriend of mine. à Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books.

label: sadness
text: Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial à "explanation".

label: disgust
text: A lie on the part of a person close to me.

label: shame
text: I thought I had taken a decision but I hesitated.

label: guilt
