text: I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others. à My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.

label: joy
text: My son was born.

label: fear
text: I had a car accident.

label: anger
text: I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic à ordinance. In fact I was innocent.

label: sadness
text: I lost a close friend.

label: disgust
text: I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war. à After the film I felt disgust.

label: shame
text: I was nailed. I lied in connection with a book which I took from à the library, because I had to keep it for a longer time.

label: guilt
text: I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. My à friend relied on them.

label: joy
text: After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I à passed my last exam.

label: fear
text: Before going to the dentist.

label: anger
text: When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste à my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological à investigation and then I got really angry.

label: sadness
text: When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but à I am alone.

label: disgust
text: Some time ago a man tried to teach me something. "Tried" because à it is very difficult to teach somebody when you yourself are not à competent and cultured.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed when I am not ready for my seminar in internal à diseases, simply because the assistant professor is a person who à deserves high respect.

label: guilt
text: We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a à restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without à finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up à the idea.

label: joy
text: When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often à happenes.

label: fear
text: When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person à with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

label: anger
text: I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant, à since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.

label: sadness
text: It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.

label: disgust
text: I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look like à normal people.

label: shame
text: I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistant à professor whom I highly respect.

label: guilt
text: I got back too late after a Sunday going out without having à called up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept the à whole night.

label: joy
text: I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love à with me.

label: fear
text: I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.

label: anger
text: I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent à words.

label: sadness
text: When my dog was stolen.

label: disgust
text: I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder à people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or à moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of à mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very à loudly and threatened that with "connections" she will expel me à from the inst.

label: shame
text: I experienced long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in a à foreign language.

label: guilt
text: My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame à bacause with her it is a stress disease.

label: joy
text: When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.

label: fear
text: One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobody à took it seriously but I got frightened.

label: anger
text: I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently à and immorally

label: sadness
text: When I failed at the first entrance exam.

label: disgust
text: The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.

label: shame
text: Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.

label: joy
text: Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I à trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly à feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in à our fate.

label: fear
text: Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with à unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked à in me many negative emotions.

label: anger
text: I always get angry when somebody deceives me, or tries to conceal à his lie skilfully and this offends me even more.

label: sadness
text: Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often à recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my à general impression from severl situations which evoked this à feeling in me.

label: disgust
text: I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had à trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father. à I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this à emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can à happen in this world.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother and à sister, and with me too.

label: guilt
text: I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man, and in this way I à lost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot of à trouble.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted as a student.

label: fear
text: I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something à wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not à serious and I need not worry.

label: anger
text: With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come à with me to an occasion (she was from another town).

label: sadness
text: For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when à I don't see her even for two or three days.

label: disgust
text: For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, and à who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.

label: shame
text: I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed with à myself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. I à rarely become ashamed.

label: guilt
text: Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my à mother's presence.

label: joy
text: I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was à not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve à the pains of a patient.

label: fear
text: Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw à another one, as if out of control of the driver.

label: anger
text: I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got à angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she à kept on telling lies.

label: sadness
text: Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.

label: disgust
text: I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street. à I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed of the way I deceived that I could not help a à friend, although it was absolutely possible for me. Nothing was à revealed but I haven't called up this person since then.

label: guilt
text: I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my à lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so the à girl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.

label: joy
text: When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.

label: fear
text: Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes me à afraid.

label: anger
text: When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.

label: sadness
text: The loss of a person I loved very much.

label: disgust
text: Deception from a person I loved very much.

label: shame
text: I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them à that I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying but à she didn't stop me.

label: guilt
text: The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary à examination.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted à as a student in medicine.

label: fear
text: I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on à the terrace of the flat.

label: anger
text: I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for à the term examinations.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither à his fault nor mine.

label: disgust
text: I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words à at a man without any reason whatsoever.

label: shame
text: At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a coleague (she à asked me something) and the assistant professor made me a sharp à remark.

label: guilt
text: My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still à haven't had time to see her.

label: joy
text: When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me à alone for a few years.

label: fear
text: I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of à hours.

label: disgust
text: Some time ago I was disgusted with the "cleanness" of the à refectory of our institute.

label: shame
text: We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium à (the stadium was packed with people) and I lost my shoe in the à crowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any result and I had à to go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the whole à town !

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague à of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good à notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know à why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was à on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many à people about my applying for this institute and I decided to à prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any à preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.

label: fear
text: Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't à wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness à (and so it is now).

label: anger
text: A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one à who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told à the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and à threatened me.

label: sadness
text: Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every à school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left à each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now à I remember about it quite often.

label: disgust
text: It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to à graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel à disgusted.

label: shame
text: I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, my à coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign à friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we à roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I à didn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.

label: guilt
text: When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our à mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my à classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first à mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more à than that and I put down "very good" for fear of being scolded. à Naturally my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for à what I had done.

label: joy
text: When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - à floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general à one).

label: fear
text: I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and à directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it à rolled by and hit me.

label: anger
text: My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance à movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his à health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the à nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old à he was (79).

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we à had to get separated again.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was à human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for à the eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.

label: shame
text: I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well à prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I à couldn't answer.

label: guilt
text: I had undertaken to help my sister for her class work but some à unexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.

label: joy
text: I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard à about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.

label: fear
text: I had worries about a certain illness.

label: anger
text: I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased à to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had à misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that à it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.

label: sadness
text: When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him à understand I felt miserable.

label: disgust
text: I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my à affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if à nothing had happened.

label: shame
text: I feel shame when I have made a promise, I can't keep it and this à has negative effects which are caused by my behavior.

label: guilt
text: I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I à said I had not passed my last exam.

label: joy
text: I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry à examination.

label: fear
text: This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study à there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance à Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.

label: anger
text: I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, à the pedology lecturer was the cause.

label: sadness
text: This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car à accident.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would à run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.

label: guilt
text: The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted my à studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They à believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.

label: joy
text: I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working à place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at à the Higher Agricultural Institute.

label: fear
text: Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue à duty as a soldier.

label: anger
text: When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his à own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.

label: sadness
text: The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of à quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his à living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.

label: shame
text: Some time ago I promised to meet an acquaintance of mine and to à carry him some promised papers. I haven't done it until this day. à Now I feel quite awkward when I meet him.

label: guilt
text: A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my à studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.

label: joy
text: After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had à got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he à feels glad.

label: fear
text: Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance à examinations.

label: anger
text: I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be à present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.

label: sadness
text: When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for à my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of à childhood.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted with the bootlickers, with helpless people.

label: shame
text: I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.

label: guilt
text: I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days à later he died.

label: joy
text: I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited à because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam à very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.

label: fear
text: Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations à most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my à microbiology exam, because it was a decisive one.

label: anger
text: It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a à celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned à out that there was no audience at all because everyone had à pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got à furious.

label: sadness
text: When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I à can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just à parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

label: disgust
text: In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite à intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest à future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I à couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them à threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my à luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was à quite  disappointed and disgusted.

label: shame
text: During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out in à the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have à fulfilled our task well, because when our teacher came and asked à me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he à didn't deserve it.

label: guilt
text: I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. I à felt guilty before her.

label: joy
text: When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is now à my girlfriend).

label: fear
text: I fear before each exam.

label: anger
text: When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.

label: sadness
text: When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.

label: disgust
text: When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.

label: shame
text: When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teacher à tried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. I à burned with shame then.

label: guilt
text: When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home à because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a à man. But it remained undone.

label: joy
text: I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in à February.

label: fear
text: It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk à and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. à I felt fear of what could have happened.

label: anger
text: I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher, à because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.

label: sadness
text: I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it à happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think à I can call it so.

label: disgust
text: I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him à but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.

label: shame
text: Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit a à party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the à next day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said à and done on the night before.

label: guilt
text: Last year I put off an exam for the autumn session without à knowing if there was a supplementary examination session. When I à came home with my exam unpassed I felt guilty before my parents à when I remembered how much they had done for me.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I à could not feel it at all.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a à few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.

label: sadness
text: When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia à and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the à events that were taking place there.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend of à mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it à was quite shameful.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceived à them.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident à but as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished my à brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it à impossible that had driven the car.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural à Institute.

label: fear
text: I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last à year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.

label: anger
text: That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal à marks.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something à had irrevocably gone away from me.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to à interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class à with her in our first year.

label: shame
text: That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then was à cought.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had à enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.

label: joy
text: I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my à sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the à telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

label: fear
text: It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and à told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

label: anger
text: I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the à institute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark I à had got at the entrance examination.à

label: sadness
text: Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my à home town.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love à in an abominable way.

label: shame
text: I have always felt ashamed for some people's behavior to their à too old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have left à them to the mercy of fate.

label: guilt
text: I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have à to tell them I have failed an exam.

label: joy
text: Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second à birthday.

label: fear
text: When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.

label: anger
text: A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced à this feeling when I tried to chase her out.

label: sadness
text: After my father's death.

label: disgust
text: With an alcoholic.

label: shame
text: Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not have à enough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people there à and I felt quite awkward.

label: guilt
text: Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I was à directly involved in it.

label: joy
text: I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for à a long period, my father came back home.

label: fear
text: I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left à alone in this unfamiliar country.

label: anger
text: I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely à partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and à anger.

label: sadness
text: When my first girlfriend an I left each other.

label: disgust
text: During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to the à world woman.

label: shame
text: When I first had a sexual intercourse.

label: guilt
text: I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set à quite involuntarily.

label: joy
text: When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at a à kindergarten.

label: fear
text: When I first sat for an entrance examination.

label: anger
text: When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated à teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite à undeservedly.

label: sadness
text: When I got separated from my first love.

label: disgust
text: Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated à physically me and my mother.

label: shame
text: When for the first and the last time I tried to crib and the à teacher was with her back to me but right when I was taking the à materials out she turned round and saw me.

label: guilt
text: When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a high à tome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.

label: joy
text: Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He à telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.

label: fear
text: Watching a horror movie with friends.

label: anger
text: The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad à then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

label: sadness
text: The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was à of my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as well à as her family etc.

label: disgust
text: Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other à people similarly - including lying, hiding facts, being à deceitful, unfair, etc.

label: shame
text: Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling à and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in à effect lowering myself to their level.

label: guilt
text: Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital à after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.

label: joy
text: Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She à wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking  of à leaving the job only after 2 days employment.

label: fear
text: Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there à are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the à thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.

label: anger
text: When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he à knows needs doing.

label: sadness
text: When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother à who had passed away about a month ago.

label: disgust
text: With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and à urinated on the floor in front of everyone.

label: shame
text: When I found a letter addressed "To Mum" by my son, 6 months à later, he begged me not to sell his new shoes which he messed up à after wearing them for the first time.

label: guilt
text: When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we had à discussed and I had to be one better.

label: joy
text: Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very à close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

label: fear
text: I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate à and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited à sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear à through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings à despite my own being hurt in the process.

label: anger
text: In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of à society for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids by à Police (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a à reflection of my own shortcomings.

label: sadness
text: Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square. à Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I à went into the role of a performing clown.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, my à homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention. à Especially in learning another language.

label: shame
text: I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my à parent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived à self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as à I am.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guilty à at being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being à a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this à emotion)

label: joy
text: When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing à well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd à taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last à 3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for à Council.

label: fear
text: A Maori language oral test, yeaterday - Although I had studied à intensely - once in the examiners room "I blew it" -  I was so à nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important, but I à got only blankness.

label: anger
text: A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not à as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She à implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time, à and taking 3 University exams part time).

label: sadness
text: When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked à me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded à because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust à saddned me.

label: disgust
text: People who came to our home - and requested "Put out your smoke". à That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even à politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to à the situation.

label: shame
text: Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual family à friends dinner. Told "Not to Speak". The attitude by him was à negative/I was in mid 20s, I had done many things - a wide range à of experiences. Probably greater than he.

label: guilt
text: Not attending school, when  am not sick - but in need of mental à rest. Staff on your return query your "sickness" - it is easier à in N.Z. to be sick, rather than confide other personal reasons à etc.

label: joy
text: My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.

label: fear
text: A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a à small Lazer).

label: anger
text: A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December à last year.

label: sadness
text: My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His à death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.

label: disgust
text: A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.

label: shame
text: I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did not à accept my Visa !

label: guilt
text: When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.

label: joy
text: When my daughter was born.

label: fear
text: When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I à felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.

label: anger
text: When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving. à We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore à would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the à time.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

label: disgust
text: When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with à a rugby tour of South Africa.

label: shame
text: When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenous à language of Maori at an important function where I was the only à woman in the group and it was expected of me.

label: guilt
text: When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important à family occasion that I should not have missed.

label: joy
text: Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 à years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the à "paper work" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming à through the customs gate.

label: fear
text: I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into the à boat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water. à Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming and à someone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim, I à abruptly ended swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few days à until we had left the district.

label: anger
text: My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it à was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his à own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it à was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the à preceding week.

label: sadness
text: I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to à leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole à new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and à traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I à wouldn't see many of them again.

label: fear
text: After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was à scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want à a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way à through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and à continue my studies.

label: anger
text: This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees à with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I à always end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting so à much over unimportant trivial matters.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years, à had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been à quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes à me feel really sad.

label: disgust
text: A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to à show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people à had had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading, à unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flaunting à themselves with no shame or embarassment.

label: shame
text: Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began à to feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it was à only "the thing to do", and not really an act of love.

label: guilt
text: This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I à (being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe in à and had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many months à later, when I was doing some deeper self analysis I began to feel à guilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted for à myself and my future.

label: joy
text: My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise à birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along à too.

label: fear
text: My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway à if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I à start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are à perhaps dead.

label: anger
text: Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise à a roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn at à doing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can't à be bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.

label: sadness
text: So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved à into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially à my family - forever.

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but à is quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.

label: shame
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: guilt
text: I did not attend a social studies observation class for 1 whole à week (I am a student trainee teacher). Anyway the other teachers à thought this was okay because the teacher I was supposed to à observe was not well liked. The teacher was in fact really nice à to me - but I wanted to get out of teaching a hard topic he had à given me.

label: joy
text: Passing my pharmacy exams which meant my tertiary education for à pharmacy completed.

label: fear
text: When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to à back up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was only à about 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.

label: anger
text: When my boyfriend wouldn't dance with me on my graduation night à because he thought I could dance with my friends who were à friendly.

label: sadness
text: When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2 à yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and he à diagnosed it.

label: disgust
text: My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me à verbally.

label: shame
text: I found I was pregnant and unmarried.

label: guilt
text: When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to à Catholicism but then once received - o.k.

label: joy
text: Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special à occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my à family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process à which have been going on for centuries.

label: fear
text: I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a à social one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fear à was greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.

label: anger
text: Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.

label: sadness
text: This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish our à relationship due to some circumstances between her and her à family. I was really sad, hurt and couldn't really find any à reason why am I still living. Is this life is all about ? This à was one of few question which crept up vividly every time I à thought about what had happened.

label: disgust
text: I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body with à drugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usually à for an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they do à things stupidly and unjustly.

label: shame
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: guilt
text: This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.

label: joy
text: Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e., ill feeling.

label: fear
text: Had fear of losing husband.

label: anger
text: When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self - à to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a future à daughter-in-law.

label: sadness
text: When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.

label: disgust
text: Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering, à over-protecting and selfish attitudes.

label: shame
text: When ditched - divorced by husband.

label: guilt
text: When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of a à group.

label: joy
text: My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really à happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me à made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another à person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she à asked me.

label: fear
text: That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my à Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and à didn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adopted à at 14.

label: anger
text: (1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year à after my father died and this angered me more as I thought he à should be dead and not my father.

label: sadness
text: My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two à days after.

label: disgust
text: A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father. à I only knew the child and had not come into contact with either à parent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event and à the stepfather disgusted me.

label: shame
text: When my natural parents name would show up on papers and not my, à what I call real name.

label: guilt
text: I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to à find out and I had to tell her I had lied.

label: joy
text: Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.

label: fear
text: When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.

label: anger
text: When a man, a stranger to me, personally insulted a close woman à friend of mine in public.

label: sadness
text: After my father died suddenly of a heart attack.

label: disgust
text: When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of à mine.

label: shame
text: When I went to explain to a lecturer whom I liked that the work à expected of me was not going to be in.

label: guilt
text: When I masturbated in my room.

label: joy
text: When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And our à relationship was new, fresh, vital etc. once again.

label: fear
text: My daughter was 2 yrs she went up to a colt tried to hit it. It à turned on her and kicked her over the heart, sent her flying à through the air. I left my mother and sister to deal to her as à they are nurses. I felt I didn't want to know if she was going to à die, it was just too much.

label: anger
text: My anger is with men, their inability to be human (not all men).

label: sadness
text: The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed, à hitch-hiking to work.

label: disgust
text: With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South à Africa.

label: shame
text: That my brother and father are into alcohol, two men with à priviledge. Not using it positively.

label: guilt
text: When I betrayed my lover, she told me something in confidence, I à felt at the time I had to relay the information back to the à person concerned, as I felt the situation volitile, did this à without telling my lover, she felt like piggy in the middle, as à she was not directly concerned. Maybe you could call it gossip I à felt different after I had slept on it. If I had waited, thought, à NOW I would not have done it.

label: joy
text: A good friend, the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me à from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the à time for an informal "greeting" in the church service. She said a à few words.

label: fear
text: I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I à expected it to be very active with people, gangs, fast cars etc, à thought it was actually quite quiet, though also oppressive. I à walked about half a mile and bought a drink along the way.

label: anger
text: Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I à had made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after I à had just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.

label: sadness
text: Sitting in a bus, I heard behind, the voice of a girl I was à friendly with. After her talking for some time with another girl à I decided it wasn't her in fact that someone miming her, which it à was when I finally looked. I was talking to a friend at the time.

label: disgust
text: Having moved into a flat within the last week I felt some disgust à that a bathroom tap had been left to drip with a faulty fawcet.

label: shame
text: I criticised an action of my mother and for the first time she à genuinely took notice of it. I felt shame that I was almost à taking the part of a husband, or at least an equal which I should à not.

label: guilt
text: I felt that I contributed to a possible rift in the relationship à between a boy and girl soon to be married, in my flat after I à moved in. After stating my celibacy to him which she overheard à and didn't previously know about I suspect.

label: joy
text: My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted à to me and suggesting we write, talk and get together and see how à things went and his suggestion that I could ring and doing that it à was really good - though really insane conversation.

label: fear
text: Being sexually assaulted (not rape, but passionate kissing) by a à friend's father - he stopped when he was driving me home. I à hadn't wanted the lift, had refused 3 times, and then felt it'd à be rude to refuse again. Was really afraid of what he might do.

label: anger
text: I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end à of my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry, told him to à get out. He was surprised, hesitated; I started to move towards à him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly to à go. Because I'd got the initiative, I succeeded. A very powerful à message.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died à because she was old, but because she lived in the last few years à in an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers - à no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would be à sitting in the "lliving" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I à felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't.

label: anger
text: When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister, à close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with my à father, who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.

label: sadness
text: When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal à feelings and then days later changed her mind.

label: disgust
text: When a close friend wilfully cheated me.

label: shame
text: While intoxicated I invaded someone's (a girl's) personal space à to a large extent.

label: guilt
text: While intoxicated I damaged my sister's car in a minor way and à someone elses in a minor way.

label: joy
text: Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from à airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in à contact again.

label: fear
text: Fear of punishment for having broken an item of value to my à parents.

label: anger
text: That a friend had been badly beaten and stabbed many times and à the person that did it got away without any punishment from the à law.

label: sadness
text: The death of an animal we had reared.

label: disgust
text: Finding that a girlfriend of mine was a prostitute and had been à seeing many others during our relationship.

label: shame
text: Not having owned up to the responsibility an incident where à family car received minor damage.

label: guilt
text: Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up, partly à the use of another person.

label: joy
text: The feeling of joy when again I had confessed my sin and à experienced God's forgiving grace and cleansing power - total à enlightenment and freedome - bliss.

label: fear
text: Riding through a bush fire on an island of Australia - on a à pushbike as a little boy - all alone, lost and surrounded by à smouldering wood and flame.

label: anger
text: When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close à - I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reacted à violently, much physical responding in the dangerous situation.

label: sadness
text: My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down - à no one else there to do it.

label: disgust
text: When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with came à up to me after I had used her and acted as if nothing had à changed.

label: shame
text: When a close friend entrusted me with a secret and I let the cat à out of the bag.

label: guilt
text: Making a sexual pass at my cousin with whom I have a very close à personal relationship.

label: joy
text: First time I slept with my present girlfriend. Had been best à friends for a year but had been hesitant about getting involved à emotionally.

label: fear
text: Waiting for a taxi - when within 1/2 an hour two separate people à challenged me to fight for no apparent reason except they were à drunk.

label: anger
text: Deliberately provoked by someone close. Angered by the à deliberation not the provocation.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. These à instances summed up all the negative aspects of our relationship à which at the time seemed doomed to fail.

label: disgust
text: A close friend took part in a racist violent action.

label: shame
text: Cannot recall the emotion with any force.

label: guilt
text: Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and myself.

label: joy
text: Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position whereby à my financial, physical, spiritual and emotional needs will be à well catered for. This position fulfils a lot of my aims for the à last five years of my life.

label: fear
text: When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come to à university. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all the à requirements of study and also being older I didn't know if I à would enjoy mixing with younger people, also financial à insecurity.

label: anger
text: When a close friend failed to live up to the expectations I had à of him - thereby causing pain to his spouse. I believe that my à anger was probably a reaction of fear that I wouldn't be able to à live up to my own expectations.

label: sadness
text: Departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas, à sharing in the sorrow of her parents who were left behind.

label: disgust
text: I get disgusted with the inherent racist attitudes of my à brother-in-law in putting down various ethnic groups and also my à unwillingness to challenge him about these attitudes in order to à keep the peace.

label: shame
text: My failure to provide the appropriate emotional/spiritual level à to a sexual relationship that had a large physical content. Born à out of inconsistency with my personal beliefs and value shame at à largely using this sexual partner.

label: guilt
text: When I deliberately engineered a situation to cause tension à between friends so as to bolster the impression one of them had à of me !

label: joy
text: Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.

label: fear
text: Being harrassed for being gay; suggestions of being physically à beaten - acting as informal bouncer in a gay bar.

label: anger
text: Landlord putting up rents sneakly and slimily.

label: sadness
text: Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS being à prejudiced against at a counselling course on AIDS with 20 à others.

label: disgust
text: Hearing Norman Jones get hysterical in Parliament about law à reform (on the radio - listening with 2 others).

label: shame
text: Watching Muldoon act as my P.M.

label: guilt
text: Adolescent guilt growing up feeling "bad, immoral" sexual à desires, some 10yrs ago.

label: joy
text: Won a prize for effort.

label: fear
text: Assaulted by drunken neighbour.

label: anger
text: I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openly à disregarded.

label: sadness
text: Death of brother.

label: disgust
text: Reading literature on AIDS/homosexuality.

label: shame
text: I am ashamed at myself sometimes when I am working with à handicapped people and don't wish to be seen in public with them.

label: guilt
text: I was late meeting someone for an appointment.

label: joy
text: I was feeling really low - had been a series of fights with my à siblings, been under pressure at school and wasn't going to the à party I wanted to go - instead I was going out with my family. A à guy called and said, in effect, that I was "nice" and he liked à me. Hence the emotional joy.

label: fear
text: I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music à was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And a light flashed à on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre à that was almost empty.

label: anger
text: My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older tham I am, à bigger built and stronger I couldn't win in a physical battle and à in a verbal battle I couldn't seem to get through to her to à really hurt her.

label: sadness
text: My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she was à blood. I didn't cry but I was sad, partly due to her death and à partly I think, due to the fact that I couldn't/didn't cry.

label: disgust
text: My older sister used to pick on my brothers and sisters all of à whom were younger than her. On one occasion my brother did à something my sister didn't like. A full-scale battle began.

label: shame
text: My first real experience with a boy. We were alone. I was quite à young and pretty naive and he was pretty crude and real, sort of, à macho. It was dark, at night during the summer and we were à talking.

label: guilt
text: I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know she à wouldn't want me to and I would get into trouble if she found à out. But she was only partly justified in forbidding me to use à it. She never found out.

label: joy
text: Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other à friends.

label: fear
text: Being alone in Europe and having to catch a train and bus to the à airport, then board the plane alone.

label: anger
text: At school teacher for not allowing us to go out on New Year's Eve à when on a class trip overseas.

label: sadness
text: I was in a car accident on the way back from a weekend rowing à regatta we'd won. 5 others were in the car. I thought I'd never à be able to row again.

label: disgust
text: Our boarder burping after meals !

label: shame
text: Felt ashamed when in a group conversation and could not à understand words or comprehend the topic of discussion.

label: guilt
text: Guilty when I hadn't walked my dog for quite a few days and had à given her no attention.

label: joy
text: When I won a position on the track-team for the trans-tasman à games when I was eleven.

label: fear
text: When I was jumped by three men in a deserted area.

label: anger
text: Once a person in authority (school teacher) was telling blatant à lies about me and the headmistress would not let me defend à myself. She was also telling lies about other members of my à family.

label: sadness
text: When my mother died.

label: disgust
text: When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to à others who were unable to defend themselves was taken down a few à notches and he began to grovel. I was disgusted with his à grovelling and the manner in which he had treated others.

label: shame
text: When I was twelve I was babysitting some children but I did not à act very responsibly and one of them was injured.

label: guilt
text: When something went wrong for me I lashed out at someone else à whom I loved and who was not in any way responsible for what had à happened (my sister).

label: joy
text: Easter holiday - I had been working weekends and had just left.

label: fear
text: Haven't been frightened for ages.

label: anger
text: I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a à policy of strict positive - negative reinforcement to the à children involved. Children who measured up to his standards were à made a fuss of - children who didn't were ignored.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad with the two situations I described before. The cat à and the school. Sadness was intermingled with the other feelings.

label: disgust
text: Next door nieghbour ran over his cat in driveway, he tried to à finish it off with a flat shovel. I would have taken cat to à veterinary to either kill humanely or cure.

label: shame
text: Haven't felt shame for ages.

label: guilt
text: I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them, she asked for à them back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found and à returned them.

label: joy
text: Getting my kitten, found at work several years ago, taking him à home in a box on my motorbike, showing it to my defacto.

label: fear
text: Obscene phone call where the person knew my name.

label: anger
text: At work being shifted to another area.

label: sadness
text: Enrolling at varsity, being told I couldn't get in to certain à papers.

label: disgust
text: Noticing my flat had maggotts !

label: shame
text: A serious drug error while nursing that I knew I was responsible à for (patient lived, no complications fortunately).

label: guilt
text: Forgot to turn up on prescribed day for jury service.

label: joy
text: When I was finally able to return to a job that I enjoyed doing à after several months absence (I was not needed during this time).

label: fear
text: When I was attacked by a teenage boy and had my wallet stolen.

label: anger
text: Someone who was speeding was forced to slow down when I pulled à out onto the road and proceeded to abuse me at the next set of à traffic lights.

label: sadness
text: When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and I à was unable to see this person because of the situation.

label: disgust
text: When someone whom I considered my friend, without telling me he à was annoyed, proceeded to ignore me for several meets with no à apparent reason.

label: shame
text: When some unforgiving acquaintance dragged up an old and rather à embarassing situation from my past.

label: guilt
text: When I made a mistake at work and when questioned about it à pretended I had nothing to do with the problem.

label: joy
text: At my wedding - standing with the man I love and acknowledging à that fact to members of family and friends.

label: fear
text: As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned à for guilt.

label: anger
text: Arriving home from work after a long and tiring day to find no à dinner prepared as I had expected.

label: sadness
text: At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurred à during university examinations and therefore I was unable to à attend her funeral.

label: disgust
text: With a Manager who insists on making crude innuendos pertaining à to sex.

label: shame
text: Cannot remember such a situation.

label: guilt
text: Breaking the left hand indicator box by moving too close to à structure.

label: joy
text: Waking in morning (early morning) and having whole day to myself.

label: fear
text: Being driven by friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little. à It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of road.

label: anger
text: Friend (male) hinted that my talking to other men at a pub was à immoral. He implied that I should remain only with my boyfriend à the entire evening.

label: sadness
text: On rising. No apparent reason.

label: disgust
text: Prolonged "niggling" of friend on a single theme which I à considered of no consequence.

label: shame
text: Felt I had not appreciated my parents enough. Regretted the à problems I'd caused.

label: guilt
text: Boyfriend doing cleaning in situation where it was my job to do à it. Later snapped at him over trivial thing. He looked downcast. à I felt guilty - "he's just done all that work for me".

label: joy
text: When my first niece was born.

label: fear
text: In a flat in Sydney - rough area at home on my own - the flat had à been burgled the night before and no way of locking the door.

label: anger
text: When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died of leukemia at age 35.

label: disgust
text: Watching an alcoholic woman who was approaching everyone at the à wharf for cigarettes - a prostitute in Auckland (elderly).

label: shame
text: Stealing money from my parents when I was young.

label: guilt
text: Two timing - going out with 2 guys at once (secretly).

label: joy
text: When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drank à and danced.

label: fear
text: Watched a horror movie which involved sexual attacks on women.

label: anger
text: My boyfriend promised to take me to see a game of tennis and rang à saying he was going to the pub with some of his friends instead.

label: sadness
text: My mother was unwell and went for many cancer tests. She spent à time in hospital being opened and closed many times.

label: disgust
text: I was driving along and saw this young guy urinating into the à gutter, in broad daylight.

label: shame
text: I kicked the dog outside on a cold night because he was annoying à me. The next day he came down with the flu and we thought he was à going to die.

label: guilt
text: I spent all weekend with a friend instead of studying for my à exams.

label: joy
text: Birth of children.

label: fear
text: Being alone at night.

text: In a hurry to get to lectures and the car would not start.

label: sadness
text: When grandfather died.

text: Obscene phone calls.

text: Being with a close friend, in the city, who was involved at the à present point in time in outrageous activity.
