text: Telling white lies.

label: joy
text: Thought had discovered true love.

label: fear
text: Stopped at lights in Mangere late one Friday night on way home à from work. Alone in car when someone came up behind the car and à started banging and shaking it. Light was red and had nowhere to à go until light changed. When green I took off.

label: anger
text: When fired unjustly from a job as casual bar-person. Charged with à giving away free drinks. Not done so and had witnesses to prove à it - both patrons and bar staff. Other staff were supportive.

label: sadness
text: Close friend leave to go overseas for an indefinite period. à Farewell scene at airport.

label: disgust
text: When employer made a pass at me whilst I was at work.

label: shame
text: When caught shoplifting and the police were called in parents à also informed.

label: guilt
text: When caught shop-lifting as for shame.

label: joy
text: Receiving understanding from within self of a subject I had à previously wished to understand better.

label: fear
text: To talk in a meeting - expound my thoughts on a subject. Fear à delayed me acting to do this.

label: anger
text: Towards wife's laziness in not performing her usual duties à because of television watching.

label: sadness
text: Watching suffering in Third World country.

label: disgust
text: Observation of people lost in the profit motive - i.e. business à managers to their actions esp.

label: shame
text: On own reading book. Recall came to mind of slight sexual à exploitation of a female (years ago) i.e. had her on even for à sexual motives.

label: guilt
text: Telling a lie to wife over phone about what I had been working à at.

label: joy
text: Meeting best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed à terribly.

label: fear
text: Confronted outside a party by some very nasty character - à gesturing to a car full of mean-acting friends - felt in danger.

label: anger
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: sadness
text: My cat died painfully and slowly.

label: disgust
text: Having unwanted attention paid to me in my place of work - à harrassment (and sexual harrassment) by another worker - à disgusted by his implications.

label: shame
text: Close friend discovered I had deceived them. Felt shame at having à done it and knowing that they knew.

label: guilt
text: Two-timing - going out with person other than guy I was in à relationship with.

label: joy
text: I was very pleased and happy when my older sister came home from à living somewhere out of town and I hadn't seen her for months. We à are very close sisters.

label: fear
text: I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist and à I thought I was lost and was going to panic.

label: anger
text: My parents didn't allow me to go to a social function that all my à friends were attending.

label: sadness
text: While still at school a friend died of cancer, after being ill à for a long time, she was 17 yrs old.

label: disgust
text: At a party my best girlfriend got really drunk and went off with à a guy she knows I really like.

label: shame
text: I was severely reprimanded for a trivial offence in front of à members of my peer group while still at school.

label: guilt
text: Someone asked me to do something and I made up an excuse and said à no. I then went and didn't the same thing with someone else and à hoped the first person never found out.

label: joy
text: When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years came à to visit with his wife which none of our family had previously à met.

label: fear
text: When I had to give a speech about some historical event, to an à audiece of about 200 people my own age whom I did not know.

label: anger
text: In arguments with a close friend or relative where my point of à view is completely disregarded.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather whom I had met only once for 3 weeks, died à after several months. I was really sad because he was a lovely à person and I did not have the means for his company.

label: disgust
text: I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wild life à films were made and was disgusted by the treatment of certain à animals in this particular programme of the polar bear.

label: shame
text: The 2nd time someone I had met cared for came over to my house I à was absolutely inebriated and was sick into a bucket.

label: guilt
text: The first time I went away with my boyfriend and lied about where à we were staying.

label: joy
text: When my former boyfriend and I reconciled and he decided that I à was very important to him. I had always wanted us to get back à together again, but had doubted the likelihood of this, so I was à very happy when my small amount of faith was vindicated.

label: fear
text: When riding in a very fastly-driven car on a lose metal road at a à very late hour - no other cars on road, and driver was taking à corners very sharply. I felt afraid - because if an accident à happened, the area was very isolated. Also, I feared for driver, à after I was dropped off - would he make it home safely.

label: anger
text: When at very short notice I agreed to work in place of a friend à who was sick, and owner of the restaurant refused to allow me a à drink later in the evening (which is usually always available for à workers), did not thank me, and was generally indifferent towards à me - I felt I did not deserve this.

label: sadness
text: When I learned that my former boyfriend had become engaged - à although I was glad that he had found what he wanted, I was very à sad at my own personal loss, since I had always hoped we might à one day reconcile.

label: disgust
text: When reading a newspaper story of a man who had committed à incestuous acts on his two-year old child - the thought that à anyone could do such a thing is abhorrent to me.

label: shame
text: When dropping a carton of boiling soup onto a co-worker's leg - à causing great pain, and for me, severe embarassment at my own à ineptitude, and shame that another person suffered as a result.

label: guilt
text: When my sister had the opportunity to do some modelling work. And à I was quite jealous - later on the photographer decided not to à take her photograph, and she was very upset - I felt guilty as a à result, almost as if I had caused her to lose her opportunity, by à not being genuinely happy for her in the first place.

label: joy
text: I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot à licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a à natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses à and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck à and it was a real adventure.

label: fear
text: A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Island à by ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals - à they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All of à them were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and were à totally terrified. Eventually these guys gave up and went looking à for us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2 à nights.

label: anger
text: I "cooked" the engine in my father's car - it was actually his à fault because he hadn't fixed the temperature gauge or told me. à When I finally got home I was absolutely screamed at and the à anger I experienced was over the injustice of it all plus the à huge row which developed.

label: sadness
text: This sounds really predictable and usual but it was absolutely à heart-rending at the time. My first lover (I was 15) just rang up à one day and announced that he had found another woman. I never à saw him again and it hurt because I was positive that it was à "TRUE LOVE" !!

label: disgust
text: I once saw an old man up the road, fossicking through the rubbish à bins and the gutter. I was really disgusted at first but I've à seen him a few times since then and now I feel really sorry for à him and I often give him cigarettes when I see him, because he à mainly goes after cigarette butts and it is revolting.

label: shame
text: When I was 15 my mother discovered various items in my room which à 15 year olds aren't usually expected to have - mainly alcohol, à marijuana and contraceptives !

label: guilt
text: NO RESPONSE.

label: joy
text: A holiday at a whitesand deserted beach. A cool evening near the à end of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toasted à marshmellows, cuddled and drank champagne.

label: fear
text: Skiing down a very icy slope, very fast in white-out conditions. à Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I was à heading.

label: anger
text: My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing à and went out with him herself.

label: sadness
text: I found a baby opposum on the road and took it home and cared for à it for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouch à under my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he said à they carried diseases.

label: disgust
text: A boyfriend with whom I split up with came over to a friend's à house where I was visiting with a male friend. In a confrontation à in another room he tried to find out if I was aroused by my à friend by feeling my parts.

label: shame
text: I told my primary teacher I hadn't done my homework as my mother à was in a car accident. My teacher rang that night to see how my à mother was - she was fine i.e. no accident !

label: guilt
text: I told my pesent boyfriend that I was an Australian as are my à parents. As the relationship developed I found it harder and à harder to confess and became sure it would end our relationship. à He eventually found out when told in front of me by my mother.

label: joy
text: Winning a race that I had been training for, for many weeks. à (Running Race).

label: fear
text: When I was very young and we moved as a family to Auckland from à Wellington, this meant new school and friends (etc.).

label: anger
text: When someone ignores what I am saying or doesn't let me have my à point of view and they monopolise a conversation.

label: sadness
text: When I got into an argument with someone and was very abusive, à but they were a close friend and I later regretted it.

label: disgust
text: When a close relative got quite drunk. It was a relative that I à had respected for a long time and looked up to as a child.

label: shame
text: When I had come home drunk the day after a party, I felt very à ashamed in front of my parents.

label: guilt
text: When I crashed by bike into an old lady crossing a road and à knocked her down.

label: joy
text: Listening to the opening bars of Tchaikovsdy's symphony No.2 à fourth movement at my sister's wedding.

label: fear
text: As a passenger in a vehicle travelling from the steep side of à Arthur's Pass in the middle of a sleet-storm, icy roads, sheer à chasms to one side, sheer face to the other.

label: anger
text: As in sadness (A), relating to this slaghter of fur-seals.

label: sadness
text: A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being à clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally à graphic. B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshima à calling for her mother.

label: disgust
text: The repression of rioting and non-rioting "Blacks" in South à Africa by the police of that "Democracy".

label: shame
text: Breaking an implicit promise.

label: guilt
text: At the age of 12 (or so) I stole from a Ranger's fruit tree an à apple. (And eventually was compelled to confess - Dostoersky à would like this).

label: joy
text: Seeing my sister after about 2 years of not seeing her. Only à spent 1 hour or so before she was off overseas with her husband à for 3 months.

label: fear
text: I imagined I heard footsteps up the hall while sleeping in bed à one night by myself in the house.

label: anger
text: Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wanted à to fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one of à my friends.

label: sadness
text: My father recently having a heart attack - spending a few months à in hospital.

label: disgust
text: My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with another à close friend of mine.

label: shame
text: Sleeping with a girl on a Saturday night and then not contacting à her in later days.

label: guilt
text: Stealing money from a milk token jar from a close friend of the à family when visiting.

label: joy
text: Talking with someone I admire a lot.

label: fear
text: Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.

label: anger
text: Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and money à stolen.

label: sadness
text: Caused a family disturbance.

label: disgust
text: Friends calling me fat - pear shaped in front of a nice girl.

label: shame
text: When I considered writing a load of crap for this emotion.

label: guilt
text: Beating my brother up.

label: joy
text: I was "best man" at my brother's wedding a year ago.

label: fear
text: Mugged while on holiday in the U.S.A.

label: anger
text: I am one of four directors of a company. We inherited land held à by our family - ours is the 5th generation. A "democratic" à decision was made to stap-bank an area of mangroves.

label: sadness
text: Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told à the group around us of advances I had made.

label: disgust
text: A drunk walked out in front of a car at night. Both lower legs à were broken. His shoe was thrown about 50 yards after the à accident.

label: shame
text: My father died 4 years ago, 18 months after my mother died. I à feld my sister was responsible for his death, in that she "hadn't à loved him". I felt ashamed for myself, and for my family.

label: guilt
text: My grandmother wanted me to help her. I was driving a tractor à pulling a dead branch off a tree. I told her she didn't respect à me.

label: joy
text: Hearing my girlfriend accept my offer of marriage.

label: fear
text: Canoeing across harbour in winds - 20 knots and rising seas.

label: anger
text: Brother continually interupting while I was talking on the à telephone.

label: sadness
text: Hearing of the death of a friend who had been skiing.

label: disgust
text: Flicking through a magazine showing pictures of homosexual men à committing various acts.

label: shame
text: Being caught by parents in a compromising situation with à girlfriend.

label: guilt
text: Describing to mother how a hole in the wall had appeared while I à was babysitting.

label: joy
text: When I found out I had passed all of my university exams.

label: fear
text: Almost crashing into the back of a car while driving along the à motorway on my motorcycle.

label: anger
text: When my girlfriend of two years told me it was all over.

label: sadness
text: A person I really like left for overseas for a few months, I had à hoped to go out with her soon.

label: disgust
text: I deliberately avoided a person who I wanted to hurt, and who à wanted to talk to me.

label: shame
text: I passed on some gossip that was untrue and cause two friends to à have a fight who were already experiencing difficulties with each à other.

label: guilt
text: Missing lectures and avoiding university work for no reason when à it had to be done.

label: joy
text: When I received my U.E. accredited as I was totally unexpecting à it and I was so happy.

label: fear
text: I went to see a movie and I went with a friend, it was really à frightening and it made me stop and think about the world around à me and what it is really like out there. I was frightened all à that night.

label: anger
text: When my flatmate put me down because she "thought" she was better à than me, or she felt she was.

label: sadness
text: When a very close friend of mine went into hospital for a major à operation and I couldn't see her for a while as I was not a à relative she had no relatives in N.Z.

label: disgust
text: One of my very good friends came to me for advice as her à boyfriend had been hitting her and beating her quite harmfully.

label: shame
text: When I let my girlfriend use my essay to help her to write hers à and the tutor found them alike.

label: guilt
text: When I had to lie to my boyfriend so that he wouldn't suspect I'd à bought him a xmas present as expensive as I had.

label: joy
text: I received an assignment back, and got an A+ grading.

label: fear
text: I was walking home one night (after getting a bus to my town) à when I was confronted by a group of males (about 6), they would à not let me pass - they made comments etc. - I crossed the road à and hurried home.

label: anger
text: I lent a text-book to a person I did not know very well, they à lost the text-book and gave me no compensation.

label: sadness
text: At the beginning of the year I moved to a new city - I felt sad à as I had to leave many friends and family members behind.

label: disgust
text: I read a newspaper article about dogs being stolen in order to à use them for fighting purposes.

label: shame
text: I was amongst a group of people talking about how the Maori à people were stirrers and causing trouble in our country. I felt à shame to be a pakeha when other pakehas had such narrow à conservative views.

label: guilt
text: I took my father's car to church one Sunday (I told them that's à where I was going ) I decided instead to go for a drive to the à beach - on the way I got a puncture.

label: joy
text: Getting University Entrance accredited and arriving home from à boarding school on accrediting leave.

label: fear
text: Thinking that I had been seen smoking at school by a teacher - à waiting to be summoned to the headmaster's office.

label: anger
text: When my mother rejected my boyfriend and made unfair judgements à on him.

label: sadness
text: At my grandfather's funeral - My grandparents virtually raised me à as my mother was a solo-parent and had to work.

label: disgust
text: Watching a TV documentary on seal clubbing.

label: shame
text: I ate very fattening food in front of my boyfriend who would like à me to lose weight. I am supposedly pursuing a modelling career à but first I must lose weight. I had been trying to diet.

label: guilt
text: I let my pet budgie loose to fly around my room one afternoon. A à few hours afterwards I found he was still free, went in and out à of my room leaving the door open. My cat got in and killed my à budgie - this happened to 3 budgies.

label: joy
text: The birth of my first child.

label: fear
text: A large german shepherd dog ran and barked at me (he didn't bite à fortunately).

label: anger
text: Most recently when the chairman at the New Zeeland Rugby Union à announced that the All Blacks' would accept the invitation of à South Africa to play rugby in that country.

label: sadness
text: When I was told a friend's baby had been born with only partial à sight. This was her first child and she was not young (the mother à that is).

label: disgust
text: When I first saw the state of a cafeteria in the grounds of the à university. Due to students own lack of concern for the à environment in which they eat and drink. Rubbish and spilled tea à and coffee left everywhere.

label: shame
text: When I as a Pakeha (white) new Zealander, was just as racially à prejudiced as other people whom I had condemned.

label: guilt
text: When my husband discovered I was having an affair with another à man.

label: joy
text: I was biking with my boyfriend, the sun shining after a long à period of bad beather, afterwards we spent the evening and night à together.

label: fear
text: I was hitchhiking and was picked up by a stranger he drove into à the woods and wanted to make love with me, I refused and escaped à from the car. When walking in the wood and hearing the car I was à afraid.

label: anger
text: In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the à opinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactions à as negative. We however only posed several questions which she à couldn't answer.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died. She stayed with us until I had the age à of 10. When she died I was 13 and I remember the moment after the à funeral: I sat on the table and cried.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about the disaster in Bophal (India).

label: shame
text: Once in a public ladies room, I opened the door of a cubicle that à was taken, although it was not locked.

label: guilt
text: In a playground I was playing at the seesaw with a little niece. à I wanted to stop but nobody came to help me. When I got off, all à alone the seesaw fell down with a big smash. My niece got hurt à above her eye. Now there is a scar.

label: joy
text: When passing the final examinations for social worker.

label: fear
text: Sleeping alone in a tent, while hearing several noises such as à rustling etc, I am afraid that there are people who are up to no à good.

label: anger
text: A man kept a seat taken by putting his coat on it after a while à the chair was still empty, I asked him if I could use the chair, à he didn't agree for the chair was for his coat.

label: sadness
text: When the relationship with my girlfriend broke up.

label: disgust
text: A piece of work was marked as bad by the teachers I and some à fellow students didn't agree with their vague criticism. I felt à myself taken in by the teachers and felt disgust.

label: shame
text: Some weeks ago I experienced a day that everything went wrong I à broke several things I felt very ashamed for I am not a sloven.

label: guilt
text: I had made an appointment with a girl to go to the movies, but à actually I had no mind when we arrived at the cinema, it was a à full house. I then went back and she went to the movie alone.

label: joy
text: A friend came to tell me that her father invited me to go on à holiday with them in Benidorm otherwise I could not afford to go à on holiday.

label: fear
text: At the age of 12 years I always had to take care of my little à brother and sister I never could sleep then. I always imagined à creepy men sneaking into our house.

label: anger
text: The landlord had selected a new lodger on her own, while we used à to do that it was not what she had done, but how she did it that à made me angry.

label: sadness
text: It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a à boyfriend, I had broken the relationship for some reasons. à Meanwhile, as I felt it, I had most sorrow.

label: shame
text: I saw a terrible accident happen and I laughed a lot of the à fright and because I was nervous.

label: guilt
text: My mother wants to talk very often about her life. I dislike this à because she always talks negatively about the same people à whatever I do it doesn't help.

label: joy
text: At the moment when I heard the result of an examination and it à proved that I succeeded the second year of my study.

label: fear
text: I have a fobic anxiety for elevators. This anxiety is worst at à the moment when the doors have to open. I have it often in the à elevator at our university.

label: anger
text: When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing to à listen to me.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend decided to make an end to our relationship.

label: disgust
text: A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better à than she is.

label: shame
text: When I am in an auditorium with people and I ask a silly question à so that everyone starts to laugh.

label: guilt
text: I moved to Nijmegen for my study. Soon after this my mother had à to be admitted in hospital because of cardiac compliants. I knew à that my moving was an important reason for this.

label: joy
text: I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when I à have done things good in relation to other people especially when à my friend says he loves me and I also tell him that I love him.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my first boyfriend threatened to make an end to à our relationship because he didn't love me enough while I loved à him very much.

label: anger
text: A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our à relationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I was à very angry about that.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.

label: disgust
text: I was once raped (one year ago) by a man who was a lot older than à me and whom I just met. Maybe it wasn't rape but the man wanted à more than I wanted to give him since there were other people in à vicinity.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I didn't study enough for my exams and as a à result I failed. I then invented idle stories to talk it good for à myself and the others.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I once went out with another boy and made love à with him while I had a close boyfriend.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend came back after being away for 10 days.

label: fear
text: When I was sitting in a car next to a man who was masturbating.

label: anger
text: When my mother told things to my sister, which I told my mother à in confindence.

label: sadness
text: Tonight in bed when I realised how bad my relationship with my à friend was.

label: disgust
text: When I was in Eindhoven on an Exhibition of Hernan Nitsche, who à made paintings with real blood. There were also photographs about à the killing of cows.

label: shame
text: When I made an end on a relationship after three years.

label: guilt
text: That I didn't want my friend to leave on holiday for 10 days à because I thought I would miss him. I was constantly trying to à persuade him.

label: joy
text: When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very à good and we were very satisfied.

label: fear
text: When my cat ran under a car and came home wounded. He could à hardly walk. I didn't dare to go to a veterinarian because I was à afraid he would kill him.

label: anger
text: I had to unscrew something on my car. I didn't succeed after two à afternoons of trying. A feeling of anger built up itself.

label: sadness
text: Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this à I lost an important source of support, certainty and joyful à moments. I cried very intensly when that happened.

label: disgust
text: A few days ago I saw two dandy girls of my age. I disliked their à clothes and their way of doing.

label: shame
text: During carnaval I danced for a few minutes normally I don't dance à because I am rigid in my moving around during a dance, I stopped à very soon.

label: guilt
text: I had a girlfriend which I used to call regularly. Then I didn't à phone her for a while. At a certain moment I felt a little à tension which became worse.

label: joy
text: At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point and à by this we won a set from a much stronger competitor.

label: fear
text: When I went out with my dog in a forest late at night when we à were on a camping.

label: anger
text: I had an appointment with someone at a certain time. The other à person didn't appear.

label: fear
text: When I entered the operation theatre and underwent a difficult à operation.

label: anger
text: When my friends left without waiting for me, after we had arranged à to go out together.

label: sadness
text: When they gave away my dog to other people without my knowledge.

label: disgust
text: When I had to eat scraps from a dust-bin, because of a bet.

label: shame
text: At the airport, eighty beer cans that I was carrying in a à bag spread all around while I was going through the metal à detector.

label: guilt
text: When I took a car which was not mine, and suddenly it stopped à working.

label: joy
text: When the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the final à of the Europe Cup at Athens.

label: fear
text: On the scenic railway at the fairground.

label: anger
text: At having an argument with a stranger, in the street.

label: sadness
text: [ The same as in guilt.]

label: disgust
text: When I entered a toilet in a bar and it stank.

label: joy
text: The day I finished my military service.

label: fear
text: When I was a child, one day, I was going home late at night and I à did not notice an uncovered man hole and fell in it.  I was in there for à several minutes.

label: anger
text: One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.

label: sadness
text: The day I left my first girlfriend.

label: disgust
text: One day I was in the countryside with several friends, and we à began to eat figs, after we were all full we noticed that all the à figs were full of worms.

label: shame
text: When I got my fingers stuck in one of the side holes of the door, à in the tube.

label: guilt
text: I ran over my dog with a bicycle when I was carrying him tied to à the handle bar.

label: joy
text: When I won the first prize in a cross country race.

label: fear
text: I found myself involved in a fight in which a person died and I à had to intervene with some risk.

label: anger
text: An argument among friends in which my opinions on the way to à spend spare time were disapproved.

label: sadness
text: I was forced to leave an unforgettable friend.

label: disgust
text: I saw the gare of a prison.  This gare and the building were in à deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.

label: shame
text: A mishap suffered on misinterpreting a girl's proposition.

label: guilt
text: I thought that I could have avoided the above situation (the one à in fear) if I had concentrated more on my work, which I hate.

label: joy
text: When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.

label: fear
text: Before I had a tooth pulled out.  I was very upset and ill.

label: anger
text: When the Real Madrid football team lost against the inter in the à U.E.F.A cup.

label: sadness
text: When my dog died.  I had reared it for nearly three years.  It à had been ill for several days and had not eaten anything.  One à morning I found it dead.

label: disgust
text: On a trip to Santander a child sitting beside me fell ill and à started to vomit, seeing this made me feel very bad.

label: shame
text: I fell down in the bus when it braked suddenly and everybody à started looking at me.

label: guilt
text: When I finished a test type of exam and did not dare to answer à any question, I doubted whether I would pass the exam  or not.

label: joy
text: When I was back home after a long time, meeting beloved people à and close friends.

label: disgust
text: When I heard about the treatment of a friend in jail. Really à inhuman. I never realised that such things also happen in the à Netherlands.

label: shame
text: I cannot remember a situation in which I felt ashamed. I was à eating with some people and a little boy I took care of. I warned à him often not to knock down his glass of mild. When I took à out his chair I knocked down my own glass.

label: guilt
text: My mother always took my side. That brought about quarrels with à my father. I knew she didn't like that and I felt very sorry for à that.

label: joy
text: When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me à she passed the examinations and that she had been admitted to the à study for speech therapy.

label: fear
text: Together with a little brother I biked on a lonely road in the à Polder. Then we were annoyed by a boy on a motorbike: he à took over, stopped, took over, etc. Then we saw he had something à in his hand, we turned until we came across a man, who à accompanied us.

label: anger
text: We lived with 3 persons in the loft of a house. It often occurred à that other persons again and again climbed the stairs with much à noise. When I was studying I couldn't concentrate and got angry.

label: sadness
text: I partly colored my hair black. My mother didn't like it and à reproached me to be a "subversive element". Later on she stated à that this was due to my friends. As I see it, this all resulted à from colouring my hair.

label: disgust
text: I was shopping in Utrecht with friends, we also ate some chips à and snacks in a snackbar, then we saw a shabby fellow. He took a à cold half eaten croquette (a snack) from a rubbish bin and eat à it.

label: shame
text: I had subscribed for this test. We were informed by our à secretary where the test took place. We went over there and thought à there was a course. So we went back again I felt ashamed that the à secretary again should see me.

label: guilt
text: I was out with a friend in a place where it was very, very busy. à When we wanted to go I bumped a person, who dropped his glass à beer I offered a new one but he didn't accept it.

label: joy
text: It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions during à an examination of personality while I thought I performed very à badly. Even now, I don't know how I managed it.

label: fear
text: My father was very angry with me, and I locked me up in the à shower. Then my father knocked his fist through the door, I was à scared to death.

label: anger
text: My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them à in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I à couldn't play them again.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hours à were terrible.

label: disgust
text: When I watched TV and saw a performance of "Prince" (a popidol). à Disgusting he'd better be a stallion.

label: shame
text: We had arranged a beach party with 20 people. There my father got à drunk I felt very ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I flew out to my mother and made rude remarks because I felt à so tense (studied too hard for an examination).

label: joy
text: Unofficially I was informed about my results of the final à examination of the secondary school. A teacher wrote them up for à me. When I went outside, I started crying with joy.

label: fear
text: I am thinking about death, the eternal of it, the unknown, the à sense of being here. Often, laying in bed in the dark and quiet, à the fear makes me feel dizzy.

label: anger
text: If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my à parents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.

label: sadness
text: I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences, à after having spend two weeks there with my friends.

label: disgust
text: Being on view in a meat-factory. Pigs being cut open, pigs being à suspended from nods, blood everywhere, decompsition.

label: shame
text: When I have suffered a terrible fit of eating, that frequently à occurs. Then I eat everything, I act like a glutton I eat big à amounts of food, sometimes even half a loaf.

label: guilt
text: When my father (physically handicapped) asks me to do something à and I raise several objections. Often I can fix it in few à moments.

label: joy
text: When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our à holiday together.

label: fear
text: When the relationship with my first girlfriend broke up and I à realized it too late.

label: anger
text: Someone who always took care for the key of the sportshall stayed à away without letting us know. Next time he did as if nothing had à happened.

label: sadness
text: When my last relation broke up.

label: disgust
text: When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in the à washing.

label: shame
text: When I forgot the birthday of my best friend and I innocently à came to visit her one week later.

label: guilt
text: When I made love with a girl, which I don't really love. However à I know that she loves me.

label: joy
text: When I passed the driving test (on the second try).

label: fear
text: I was walking in the wood at night with my boyfriend. Very à romantic. Suddenly I heard a car driving very slowly with the à lights out, it looked as if they were looking for something.

label: anger
text: I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for à them it is obligatory and they dislike it. They tease me. When one of à them cut up some material I flared up.

label: sadness
text: My sister was in coma for 3 months (due to a train accident). Now à her brainfunctions are disturbed. She will never be able to walk à and she can hardly talk.

label: disgust
text: I lived together with my boyfriend. One night he stayed away and à next day he told me that he had chat up with another girl.

label: shame
text: I talk too much, cannot keep things secret. I promised a friend à not to tell something to anybody. Neverthless, I did, and she got à informed about it. I felt very ashamed.

label: guilt
text: My parents appreciate very much me and my boyfriend coming and à have dinner with them at Christmas. However we decided to visit à his parents. My mother was rather disappointed.

label: joy
text: When I started a relation with a girl, with whom I have fallen in à love already some time ago.

label: fear
text: Once sitting in the cinema, I became very anxious (watching a à "cold" film). I do not know the reason.

label: anger
text: I work for a journal. Once the lay-out came to nothing, due to à thoughtlessness of some colleagues.

label: sadness
text: My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed and à suffered an aphasia.

label: disgust
text: Each time I am confronted with reports about repression and à torture.

label: shame
text: I wrote a letter to my father to ventilate my bottled up à feelings. Afterwards I thought it was too negative.

label: guilt
text: I chatted up with a girl who I didn't love. She however was à fallen in love with me. I felt responsible for her sorrow.

label: joy
text: I felt very happy when I heard I had passed the examination to à move up to the second year course.

label: fear
text: On a holiday in France I made a walk in the woods all alone and à very relaxed. Then a motorbike took me over and I saw the man à watching all the time. Suddenly the man stood behing me and I ran à away fast.

label: anger
text: I invited two friends. We should go out together. Those two girls à kept talking about boys, chatting up etc. I bacame sick of it.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when my boyfriend wanted to break our à relationship. Our relationship lasted two years, we shared à everything and all this was finished.

label: disgust
text: I broke an egg, with which there was something wrong, into a à little cup. There was a thick white "wad" in it. I tried to take à it out and throw it in the sink.

label: shame
text: When I was 10 years old I stained our bench with a fountain-pen, à I tried to twin the cushions, but then there were colour nuances. à Then my mother catched me, she saw it and became very angry.

label: guilt
text: I spend the night with my boyfriend, while there was also a à friend of his. We all lay on the floor to sleep. When my à boyfriend was fallen asleep the other boy and I started petting. à After 15 minutes I felt miserable and awoke my boyfriend to tell à him that.

label: joy
text: I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That à appeared to be impossible because I had to go to school. For long à time I wasn't sure if I could accompany her. Two days before the à departure they told me I was allowed to miss school.

label: fear
text: I went to the ballet lessons with a little friend in the dark. On à a very quiet place a boy approached us from behind and asked at à what time the lesson would be finished. I gave him an avoiding à answer, he took me up and wanted to run away with me.

label: anger
text: I was sleeping nicely until in the middle of the night when I became à awake because a friend called me for some (in my opinion) à nonsens reason.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell in à love with another girl, then he asked me something which implied à that he loved that girl more than he loved me.

label: disgust
text: On school, during a fancy fair, there was a stand of amnesty à international. There I read (for the first time) a description of à the tortures of a woman, what they did to her.

label: shame
text: A friend catched me while masturbating. I am not fully sure à whether she saw it or not.

label: guilt
text: When I was 4-5 years old my mother gave me some parts of a à chocolate bar and ordered me to bring it to my father working à outside. On my way I could not resist the temptation and ate it à myself.

label: joy
text: When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school, à I lived together with a girlfriend. We both were afraid to fail, à but it appeard that we both had passed.

label: fear
text: When I had left my home, my father, under false pretences, got me à in his car and drove home where we were all alone. He was seethed à with rage because I withrew from his authority. He hit me, kicked à me and threatened me.

label: anger
text: When my father took away my cherised diaries to burn them (I was à also very sad) "Oh, how I hated him".

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it any à longer. I do not regret it, but I missed my little sister very à much (and she missed me). These feelings wear off over time.

label: disgust
text: A friend and a girlfriend went to Rome for 10 days with their à class. When they were back home I heard people tell "strange" à stories about my friend and that girlfriend.

label: shame
text: When my mother found a leaf of my diary where I had written about à my mother's lack of education, especially her poor arithmetical à insight.

label: guilt
text: Very often I take care for my little sister and oversee her à duties. Most of the time everything went fine, but sometimes she à absolutely didn't want to obey; then I hit her (we frequently à were hit by our father).

label: joy
text: Passing my driver's examination (after two failures).

label: fear
text: When I was six years old we were on holiday in France. There was à very heavy weather then.

label: anger
text: A quarrel with my mother because I thought she said very à unreasonable things about me, that hit me strongly.

label: sadness
text: The disease and subsequent death of a close acquaintance. Sadness à was accompanied with feelings of powerlessness (I also à experienced sadness in the situation described under guilt).

label: disgust
text: When I take a look into a slaughter-house and when listening to à stories about torturing people or animals.

label: shame
text: Making bloopers: e.g. telling something negative about a certain à person, while that person is standing besides you and hears à everything.

label: guilt
text: I wanted to finish a relationship after 3 months. Unfortunately à my friend had a different opinion. I could not answer his à feelings this made him unhappy, and me feel guilty.

label: joy
text: When a friend of mine had her period, while thinking she was à pregnant.

label: fear
text: Fear to come and live in Nijmegen.

label: anger
text: When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.

label: sadness
text: When a friend died.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a documentary film about World War II (about Hitler à and his adepts).

label: shame
text: When I embarrassed a friend by asking him aloud if a certain à person was "the source of gossip" he told me about, while that à person was also present.

label: guilt
text: When I realised that I had rejected a boy, who was fallen in love à with me, rather bluntly four times.

label: joy
text: Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of à Nijmegen) for a while.

label: fear
text: Just before I started my study I had to move, I was very afraid à to be left alone and that I could not manage it.

label: anger
text: When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should à do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped. à Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.

label: sadness
text: When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israel à for one year.

label: disgust
text: I wanted to take something from under my bed. While doing this I à felt a dead bird laying under my bed.

label: shame
text: I stayed at home for a period because I felt depressive and I à neglected my study when people adked me, I told them that I had à freeterm and studied hard. I felt ashamed for my behavior and à lies.

label: guilt
text: After a quarrel with my mother in which matters were "inflated" à enormously.

label: joy
text: A fellow player, quite unexpectedly, scores a goal, which means a à draw.

label: fear
text: In college, I started a discussion with the teacher referring to à a question I posed. I felt very unsure and I was afraid to fail.

label: anger
text: While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man who à frequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. In à my opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.

label: sadness
text: I was together with my family one night, a few days after my à father had died, during that conversation I expressed my à displeasure because nobody understands me.

label: disgust
text: Salo, a movie film by Pasolini. People were misused and tortured à for the fun of a few elder Italian authorities, during World War à II.

label: shame
text: I was jerking me off in my bedroom, when suddenly, my mother came à in. She looked at me and immediately left the room.

label: guilt
text: My girlfriend and I agreed to go to the cinema. However I à completely forgot our appointment. I remembered it two hours à too late when I went to visit her.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend once again told me that he loved me after a à period in which he felt very depressive.

label: fear
text: I was walking alone in the street late at night (2.30 am). It was à very quiet. Then a man approached me and said "Hello".

label: anger
text: When, late at night, I discovered that they had stolen my bike.

label: sadness
text: When a friend, after being free of drugs for half a year, started à using them again.à

label: disgust
text: In a disco, there was a dirty little chap who punched my bottom.

label: anger
text: When a friend who comes visiting me unexpectedly asks for coffee à and I refuse to give him this.

label: sadness
text: Watching a football game. This remindes me of the time when my à father was still alive and when we watched football games on TV à together.

label: disgust
text: Seeing someone who has bleeding nose.

label: shame
text: Asking someone to give me back the money I once lend him because à I needed it myself.

label: guilt
text: When I tell someone no. In other words when I refuse to do à something although I could have helped him.

label: joy
text: When I got a good grade for an exam in statistics.

label: fear
text: One night at three o'clock I was followed by a cardriver, who à tried to molest me.

label: anger
text: My father promised me a bicycle for my birthday. Just before my à birthday he forgot he promised this to me.

label: sadness
text: A younger brother of a good friend of mine died (asthma).

label: disgust
text: I read a book about torture. The book described exactly how the à torturing was done.

label: shame
text: I made a joke about the rat of a boy. I compared his rat with a à sausage. I told the boy he had a delicious sausage.

label: guilt
text: After a courtship of three months I made an end to it. The boy à was very sad about this.

label: joy
text: I had a very pleasant conversation with one of my friends.

label: fear
text: I had a dream about my fiancTe leaving me and making an end to à our relation.

label: anger
text: My bicycle was demolished.

label: sadness
text: During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and à other family members crying.

label: disgust
text: A fellow student who seemed very nice later on proved to be a à slimy fellow towards a professor.

label: shame
text: My father was very angry with another man in the presence of my à friends.

label: guilt
text: I once drank too much alcohol and became very ill. This was in the à presence of my friends.

label: joy
text: This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contact à a few years ago.

label: fear
text: I was raped by a friend.

label: anger
text: Last year I had a friend visiting me for several days. The only à thing he did was sleeping, drinking, taking pills and thinking à only about himself.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend does practice and therefore leaves me alone at à night and in the weekend. In addition, she is very busy doing à several things. So we don't see each other often.

label: sadness
text: My father suddenly fell ill. He stayed for 3 months in the à hospital: the last month on intensive care of the Academic à Hospital, then he died.

label: disgust
text: Bisshop Ter Schure intoduced himself on TV to the Dutch Nation. à He spoke as if he was God himself, and didn't discuss the way he à had achieved this position.

label: shame
text: After having failed my driving test.

label: guilt
text: When I see that my mother forces my little brother (15 years) to à work very hard for school. I don't agree that she constantly puts à him to work, but I don't tell it to her, so nothing changes.

label: joy
text: I thought that someone was angry with me but, by hindsight, that à didn't appear to be the case, he even liked me.

label: fear
text: Once, late at night, I was biking home and overtook a man. He à said to me "Hello darling" I was terrified and imagined the à wildest scenes.

label: anger
text: My parents thought that I didn't do my best to pass the final à examination (secondary school). When I achieved a good grade they à said nothing, but if I had had a bad grade they would have become à very angry.

label: sadness
text: When I caused much pain and sorrow to my boyfriend by finishing à our relationship.

label: disgust
text: When I read about or think about environmental pollution, the à armor race, starvation, etc. Then one realizes that mankind is à bad, most important is power and money, at the cost of nature and à mankind.

label: shame
text: When I imitated a teacher behind his back - walking very silly.

label: guilt
text: I told someone that I still had a relationship with a boy à although it was finished already 3 months before. That person à seriously discussed several things relating that issue. Then I à felt very miserable because I had told lies.

label: joy
text: A meeting and a conversation with a woman (somewhat elder than à me) who considers me as her child (she also has one child of her à own). Last two years I lived with her (no relationship).

label: fear
text: As a child I suffered of nightmares. Even since than, I have à never been so anxious and fearful.

label: anger
text: When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices, à which my father also adheres.

label: sadness
text: I was in a hopeless situation in a dirty place. No study, no à work, only loneliness.

label: disgust
text: It is very difficult to relate it to a certain event. I am à familiar with the disgust of Sartre (la nausTe), a frequently à occurring cause may be described as "the self-assured dullness".

label: shame
text: Recently, I left my bag in the car of someone who picked me up à while hitch-hiking. I spent some effort to find out where he à lived (I succeeded).

label: guilt
text: In Biarritz (the South of France) I met some English students à who, especially for me, went to Paris and gave me food, while I à didn't have any more money.

label: joy
text: When I passed the driving test already on the first try, although à I felt more and more uncertain as the day came near.

label: fear
text: When my father suffered with dizziness. He had to be à hospitalized, because the physician didn't know what was wrong. à Because his stools were black, I thought it could be cancer.

label: anger
text: When I arranged our holiday in Paris, and my girlfriend raised à criticisms all the time.

label: sadness
text: When it suddenly appeared that our dog was dangerously ill and à probably would die. We had not expected this because he à was always very healthy. Fortunately he survived because we, in turn, à gave him medicines during the night.

label: disgust
text: When a girl in my class (on the secondary school) appeased the à teacher, resulting in getting a higher grade. This occurred often à with her.

label: shame
text: When I arrived too late at a meeting of mentor (the night before à the introduction of novices on the University start).

label: guilt
text: When my father told me that I should help my mother more often, à because she was so busy. And I realized that he was right.

label: joy
text: Passing an examination, although I felt sure I had failed.

label: fear
text: I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory and à shower with a fellow student. the shower cubicle formed the à connection between both appartments. My neighbour very often was à drunk and aggressive. One night, I was afraid that he would enter à my room.

label: anger
text: I suffer from a disease of my muscles. Therefore, I am only able à to attend lectures for half a day. So, sometimes I miss à obligatory lectures. However, the teachers do not take into à account my disease, and punish me with detention work, resulting in à an overload.

label: sadness
text: I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talk à about it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. They à try to repress it.

label: disgust
text: Grandfather lives in a home for the elderly. He always looks à forward to visits. On his birthday (by coincidence it was on à "Mummy's day") however, nobody went to see him. Is the own family à more important than grandfather ?

label: shame
text: Going out for dinner, or during one ice-cream and four spoons.

label: guilt
text: I borrowed a piece of music of someone and I always forgot to à give it back. That person wrote me a letter asking me to give it à back. I did so and I told him an idle story why I kept it for so à long.

label: fear
text: When armed robbers broke into our house at night.

label: anger
text: When a pick-pocket robbed me of my money (K20) while I  was à buying bathing soap.

label: sadness
text: When I failed the grade seven examination.

label: disgust
text: When my friend who was drunk insulted me in public for no reason at à all.

label: shame
text: When I tried to steal a book from the bookshop and was caught.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught with another man's wife.  I had taken the à opportuinty as this man was abroad but he returned that night.

label: joy
text: The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

label: fear
text: When I had gone for a boxing tournament which ended at 2 o'clock à in the morning.  I was alone on my way back, and I could hear the à barking of the dogs, the nocturnal animals and the sound of my     à own footsteps.  There had been a rumour  circulating that there à were ghosts in that area.

label: anger
text: In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.  He tried à to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my à sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down.  à There was a fight.

label: sadness
text: When my father passed away in 1978.  I was left alone with my à mother who was very sick so I had to go and live with my aunt, who à is very short tempered, till my mother was discharged from the à hospital.

label: disgust
text: When I learnt that my best friend had failed the exams.

label: guilt
text: I broke my friend's badminton racket and she kept quiet about it.

label: joy
text: Boy, you have been admitted to the medicine school and your à uncle is coming back fron Canada next week, my father told me à and it was a happy moment.

label: fear
text: I was in form five at the boarding school and my friends and I à had gone drinknig beer in the nearby village.  And we were caught à red handed there by a form master.

label: anger
text: When my mother quarrelled with my aunt over me.

label: sadness
text: My elder brother had been expelled from college and he was so à frustated that he attempted suicide - he drank bottle fragments.  à I was very sad when I learnt this.

label: disgust
text: I found out accidentaly that while my uncle was away in Canada, my à aunt had been bedding a young man on a regular basis.

label: shame
text: It was during a school holiday - I was found necking a girl in my à room by my father.

label: guilt
text: I was in grade seven and my class was planning a protest against à a rude and immoral teacher.  I sneaked out and told the à headmaster about it and so the plan was foiled.

label: joy
text: I won the first prize at the science fair, the first of the kind à at school and I was only in form II then.

label: fear
text: A close relative of mine died in a serious car accident.  I was à one of the first two people to see the corpse and I had to do it. à  Before going in to see it I was afraid as it was the first time à that I was seeing a corpse.

label: anger
text: My younger brother destroyed and gave away some of the books that à I had intended to keep for as long as possible.

label: sadness
text: When a close relative of mine passed away, it was the first time à that someone so close to me had died.

label: disgust
text: A person whom I thought to be honest took and spend the little à money that I had and I had no way of getting any money in the à few following months.

label: shame
text: While watching a religious film, I got very excited and made a à number of comments which were reproached to me by an elderly à person who respected me.

label: guilt
text: I beat up a female friend after I heard the defamatory stories that à she had been telling.  I was later called to explain my à behaviour.

label: joy
text: My 21st birthday celebration, when I cut the cake and received à the presents.

label: fear
text: Before one of my final exams of the third year - natural à sciences.

label: anger
text: When some seniors tried to scold and insult some juniors on à account of what the juniors were supposed to have said at à secondary school.

label: sadness
text: When an uncle of mine, who was close to me, passed away after à having had a stroke, before his first daughter could be named.

label: disgust
text: When my sister's boyfriend accused her of having been sleeping around.

label: shame
text: When I could not hold my bladder while making a telephone call à and ended up wetting myself.

label: guilt
text: When I was made to feel responsible for the emotional state a friend of à mine was in.

label: sadness
text: My fiancT left me for my best friend.

label: disgust
text: People who discriminate other people disgust me.

label: shame
text: On New Years eve I drank too much alcohol, so much that I had to à vomit in the presence of other people.

label: guilt
text: I have cut loose from my father a few years ago. I know he is à very sad about this.

label: joy
text: A recurrent lovesickness.

label: fear
text: I was sexually assaulted one night by a stranger.

label: anger
text: Meddlesomeness of my mother about the way I live. She thinks I am à to free in my behavior for instance when a boyfriend stays the à night.

label: sadness
text: The dying of a close member of the family.

label: disgust
text: Seeing maltreated, dead animals.

label: shame
text: A much older man took advantage of me during my childhood (four à to eight years of age).

label: guilt
text: When my friend needed my help very much and I, at that moment, made à an end to our relationship.

label: joy
text: When I passed a very important exam.

label: fear
text: When a man rang the doorbell and wanted to enter the house with à violence. I was alone at home that moment.

label: anger
text: A friend came to visit me late one night. He promised to stay à only a quarter of an hour, but he stayed 5 hours !! He didn't à leave and I was very angry.

label: sadness
text: I had to terminate a training because I wasn't suited for it. I à was very sad about this, because I very much wanted to finish à that training.

label: disgust
text: During my birthday party a friend drank too much alcohol. So much à that he had to throw up. Worst of all was that he couldn't leave à my friend alone and that he was molesting her.

label: shame
text: I tried to swindle a jeweller because my watch was broken and I à wanted to have it repaired it was a pity but they detected it.

label: guilt
text: Someone had to do a lot of efforts to make something work. With à my help he would have finished much sooner, but I wasn't in the à mood to help him.

label: joy
text: I went to visit friends and it was very companionable.

label: fear
text: I wanted to get in contact with a girl I loved, but I was afraid à she would refuse me.

label: anger
text: During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This à led to friction in a lot of situations.

label: sadness
text: Disappointed love. The girl made an end to our relationship while à I thought she was in love with me.

label: disgust
text: During military service I heard the story of someone who tried to à commit suicide and as a result of this got a week custody.

label: shame
text: I thought of myself as being clumsy when I made love for the à first time with a girl.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine had a bicycle-accident because I pulled at his à handlebar.

label: joy
text: Sitting alone in a quiet room concentrating on things happening à around me which pleases me.

label: fear
text: Sitting alone in a quiet room, concetrating on things happening à around you. Thoughts come into my mind which make me afraid.

label: anger
text: When a teacher tells a story which isn't true. It only reflects à his way of interpreting reality.

label: sadness
text: I have high expectations for my future but if I pursue the à subject in this manner I will not attain this.

label: disgust
text: I heard a broadcasting programme about parapsychology. The people à in this programme used very difficult words which I couldn't à understand. They acted exaggerated without showing any feeling.

label: shame
text: A girl asked me why I didn't dance. I told her I was ashamed to à dance. I felt myself ashamed having to tell her this.

label: guilt
text: I saved up money for a good purpose. As I also have to organise a à party I am afraid there will rest only a little money for the à good purpose I feel guilty about this.

text: My sister and brother in law returned from Sri Lanka where they à adopted a child. I went to pick them up at the airport.

label: fear
text: During a football game I made an offence towards an acquaintance. à Later on this acquaintance also tackeled me and the game became à very rude.

label: anger
text: I work at a petrol station. When there is a foreigner who wants à petrol my collegues treat him very impolite.

label: sadness
text: An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all his à life, got a cerebral hemorrhage.

label: disgust
text: A student who lives in the same house where I live is an alcoholic. He à tries to manipulate other people with his money when he has drunk à too much.

label: shame
text: When I went to a disco with a friend I started behaving badly à embarrassing him without reason.

label: guilt
text: When I talked to another student about the notes she got last à semester, not knowing that she got a lot of bad grades.

text: When I got my drivers licence.

label: fear
text: The only event I can remember is having a nightmare when I was à very young (3 years old) I dreamt about a machine which was going à to crush me.

label: anger
text: I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace à when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves à that I have fallen in love with him.

label: sadness
text: Losing a boyfriend for the second time to my friend. He fell in à love with her. The same thing happened a few months earlier with à another boyfriend.

label: disgust
text: There is a person whom I disgust. Evrey time I see her I get this à terrible feeling I disgust her whole appearance.

label: shame
text: When I am angry at someone without a good reason. Later on it à proves that he didn't do anything wrong.

label: guilt
text: My mother always evokes feelings of guilt in me. For instance à when I miss the last bus I know she will be concerned for me and à stay awake till I arrive.

label: joy
text: When I came again in contact with a girl I liked very much. And à most important she also liked me.

label: fear
text: DO NOT REMEMBER.

label: anger
text: After a hard day at the university I also had to make dinner that à evening. It failed because of a frying pan which broke.

label: sadness
text: When my father had a cerebral hemorrhage.

label: disgust
text: A story I heard recently about a baby dying after sexual à abuse.

text: During a party I overheard a conversation about china. When I à wanted to give my opinion one of the people came out to be Chinese à and his opinion was right of course.

text: When I didn't bring my girlfriend home one night. Later she told à me that a cardriver solicited her.

label: joy
text: When an old schoolfriend phoned me to arrange an appointment to à talk about old memories. I hadn't seen him for 8 years.

label: fear
text: Standing in a crowed shop or in a closed room with too much à people in it. This gives me a fearful experience.

label: anger
text: My older brother who gives me unwanted advices about problems in à my relationship with my girlfriend.

label: sadness
text: My girlfriend left the house in which we lived together a few à months ago. This made me very sad.

label: disgust
text: When my parents behave very "witty" towards me, they make insipid à jokes about which they laugh. Or my mother who treats me like a à little child.

label: shame
text: Making an unexpected talk with a professor in the canteen. This à made me shy.

label: guilt
text: Flirting with other girls while I already had a very good à relationship. When there are problems in my relationship, the à flirting increases as does the feeling of guilt.

label: joy
text: Occurs frequently. A recent experience: when going out with many à friends, nice music, after the examinations, I felt so happy I à could have embraced everybody.

label: fear
text: I lived alone in a repulsive area in the city of Rotterdam. I was à annoyed, heard a lot of Burglary and assaults. Especially in the evening à and the night I frequently felt anxious.

label: anger
text: Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.

label: sadness
text: When I finished a relation after four years, leading to much à sorrow for the other one and myself ("although it was the best à solution").

label: disgust
text: Every time I meet a certain person. We cannot get on well à together, we dislike each other.

label: shame
text: When coming up for trial because of shop lifting.

label: guilt
text: Being catched when stealing.

text: I fell over head and ears in love with someone who appeared to be à in love with me. it made me so happy that I could hardly sleep à and eat for one week.

text: One night I had to bike home all alone after a party. Then I à found out that I was pursued by a man in a car.

label: anger
text: I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion that à he decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we should à watch. I became very angry and started throwing things through à the room.

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend finished our relationship when I started studying à psychology in Nijegen, because then we would not be able to meet à frequently anymore.

label: disgust
text: A friend had a quarrel with the mother of her boyfriend because à she and her friend decided to go and live together. She needed à money for removal, then she made a great effort to reconcile.

text: I was catched when, as a little girl, I played tricks. I was very à startled then and wet my pants.

label: fear
text: Once late at night (around midnight) a person asked me to give à him a lift. He suddenly tried to attack me but I could escape. à After this he followed me for a little while.

label: anger
text: There was a lot of irritation between me and a person who lives à in the same house where I live. Suddenly it became too much for me and I à accused him of several things.

label: sadness
text: The end of a relationship (after 4 years) by doing this I hurt à the other person very much.

label: disgust
text: I saw a terrible accident in which the driver of a motor was à thrown through the frontwindow of a car. His face was completely à away.

label: shame
text: I am troubled by hair growing in my neck. I was troubled by this à for a long time and was much ashamed when someone brought his/her à hands close to my face.

label: guilt
text: Against the will and without the approval of my parents I went à for a few days to my boyfriend in Germany.

label: joy
text: When a friend of me came for an unexpected visit.

label: fear
text: When I thought the house was on fire at night.

label: anger
text: When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person. à His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.

label: sadness
text: When the mother of a good friend of mine died.

label: disgust
text: A teacher was very blunt in his relation to a child so that the à child was very upset when arriving at home.

label: shame
text: I was very angry at someone.

label: guilt
text: That I didn't take the time to make an appointment with someone.

label: joy
text: After I saw my family and good friends back after staying one à year in a foreign country.

label: fear
text: When a good friend of mine behaved in a very cool manner to me à for a very long time.

text: I was in the library of medical psychology and walked into the à wrong direction. A man who came out of a room threated me very à denigrating and I became very angry in a resisting manner.

label: sadness
text: A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intense à feeling of sadness.

label: disgust
text: When an uncle of mine who is very ill started to cough wich à sounded very dirty. (He can't help it of course).

label: shame
text: At Christmas night there was a good movie on television which I à wanted to see for years. I was whining about it till someone told à me it was very childish. Then I felt shame.

label: guilt
text: A good friend of mine who is at the moment in a foreign country. à I didn't write her for several months and now I feel guilty.

label: joy
text: When I go out with my friend with enough money and good sense to à our favorite dancing.

label: fear
text: When going out I am threatened regularly by two punk-girls.

text: A friend started to shout at me. He called me an old frump.

label: sadness
text: My relationship with a boyfriend was finished and I didn't à succeed a years-course.

text: My father is someone I disgust. So when he comes close to me à a feeling of disgust overwhelms me. When I stay a week-end at my à parent's place I will remember it for long time.

label: shame
text: After a party in which I made love with a boy in public. Later on à I heard that others were talking about me and called me a slut.

label: guilt
text: When I got associated with a boy one year ago, I neglected my à best friend. When the relation with this boy finished she behaved à very easy-going towards me. I felt guilty then.

label: joy
text: When I made the winning goal during a very important football à game.

label: fear
text: A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent on à a great bald field.

label: anger
text: Seeing for the first time pictures about the so called à "treatment" of Jewish people in Nazi-Germany during World War II.

label: sadness
text: The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at the à moment of dying I was with her.

label: disgust
text: I was looking at a one-man show on television. He told very à disgusting things so that I started to be disgusted with it. à (Later on it proved that this was his intention).

label: shame
text: I was drinking a glass of wine and eating something when there à suddenly appeared pictures about the famine in some parts of à Africa.

label: guilt
text: When I don't go to my parents on Sunday and phone them to tell à them that I have to study. The truth is that I listened to sports à on the radio.

label: joy
text: When it appeared that I was not pregnant when I was several weeks à overtime.

label: fear
text: The same situation as with sadness. I was afraid about what my à parents would further do to distroy my relationship.

label: anger
text: Once again my parents distroyed a relationship.

label: sadness
text: I had this feeling when my parents distroyed a relationship with à a boy because they thought he was bad and irresponsible.

label: disgust
text: After the accident which I described in SHAME. I came to myself à and saw how terrible everything looked like. I disgusted myself à and everything I saw.

label: sadness
text: A sudden end to the relationship with my first girlfriend.

label: disgust
text: I heard part of a conversation in which one talked very low about à women.

label: shame
text: In an important situation for me, my father behaved inadequately.

label: guilt
text: When I took the car of someone without saying it to him.

text: I felt joy when I heard that I was accepted for the Free à University in Driebergen.
