text: I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friend à told me that she would go to travel next year with another good à friend. We couldn't talk this out.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I had to leave persons with whom I had a very à intense relationship I also had to leave the environment which à was part of this.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust after watching a picture on television about à torturing political prisoners in India (this happened in the à India of Indira Ghandi).

label: shame
text: I made a very insulting remark against a person whom I care for à very much. This event was caused by a third person who didn't à like the person I insulted.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt towards my mother when I went to live on rooms in à Nijmegen where I study.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend and I went out for a dinner and subsequently à went to his family. We had a very nice evening.

label: fear
text: When I walk through streets late at night. This is because I and à my friends were attacked one night without any reason for it.

label: anger
text: When I got the feeling that I had to do all the housekeeping à while my boyfriend didn't do anything. This happened in a period à of exams when I had to study very hard.

label: sadness
text: When my best friend got a boyfriend. Because of this a à relationship of ten years was finished abruptely.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgust when hearing or seeing other people being treated à inhumanely. For example torturing in chili.

label: shame
text: In my opinion guilt is a feeling which goes together with shame. à Here then I refer to the situation of guilt.

label: guilt
text: When I became angry at my boyfriend without any reason. I know he à cannot bear me being angry at him and that he can't study anymore à then.

label: joy
text: The day I heard that I passed the high school exam.

label: fear
text: I was living in rooms in a very lonely, quiet neigbourhood. à During the night it was very silent and this frightened me. The à fact of being alone in that house frightened me.

label: anger
text: We had to move to a very different city because the company where à my father worked also moved to that place. It was very difficult à for me to make new friends than.

label: sadness
text: A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. I à didn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.

label: disgust
text: A girl who also hires a room in the house where I live always à tries to make a quarrel with everyone available she disgusts me.

label: shame
text: A teacher spent a lot of time helping me without wanting to be à paid for it. For the exam I didn't got a good grade and I felt à ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I knew I had to take an exam very soon but yet I couldn't start à studying. I also knew it was very imprtant to succeed the exam à this time.

label: joy
text: When Christmas holiday started, I felt very joyful when I à finished my last exam.

label: fear
text: I was raped once when I went through a dark alley at the back of à our house. The man pushed me in the bushes. I fought back and à succeeded to escape.

label: anger
text: I was very angry at my father when he didn't give me as much à money as my brother to use for studying. Once again my brother à was better off then me.

label: sadness
text: When my gradmother died.  I felt very sad then ... The feeling à started to be worse after a while.

label: disgust
text: When I ate a rotten apple.

label: shame
text: When I didn't meet an appointment I had made. The person phoned à me but I thought of something (I told I was ill) so that I didn't à have to go.

label: guilt
text: When I have to take exams I am very excited and have not much à time for the housekeeping. Then my friend has to do everything.

label: joy
text: My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her à and telling nice things to her.

label: fear
text: When I slept for the first time all alone in the house where I à live now. A man phoned me at 2.00 am. He wanted something from à me. I was afraid.

label: anger
text: My boyfriend told me that I had very high demands towards him. In à my opinion this was wrong.

label: sadness
text: I hadn't been at my parent's place for a long time. When I went to à visit them I had high expectations, but when I was there it was à very different from what I expected.

label: disgust
text: I read a story in the newspaper about butchers treating their à animals very badly. They disgusted me.

label: shame
text: I was eating in a very nice restaurant, when the servant asked à whether I liked the food I told him that I liked it but that à there was one thing which wasn't so good. The servant than worked à very hard to make it good.

label: guilt
text: A few weeks ago I thought about an exam I had to take soon. I à remembered this just before I had to go to sleep. I felt guilt à because at the beginning of the year I planned to succeed.

label: joy
text: During my high school time I succeeded to play a concert of à Mozart on the piano when I gave my first performance I succeeded à to play it very well.

label: fear
text: When a car ran into me. The moment that I felt on the street I à thought "This is my end, I am going to die".

label: anger
text: When our cat was killed in a car-accident I was very angry at the à driver of the car because he didn't take enough care.

label: sadness
text: There is a boy who I love very much. I asked him to have dinner à with me, but he refused I don't know why he didn't go with me, à but I felt very lonely.

label: disgust
text: I saw a dog who was eating excrements.

label: shame
text: During my Highschool time I was chairman of the student's à comitee. In this function I once had to make a speech to a large à audience and I was very nervous. After three sentences I forgot à my text.

label: guilt
text: During a holiday in East-Germany I got aquainted with a boy who à lived there. We started writing, but I only wrote once. I felt à ashamed because I probably was one of his sparse contacts with à western Europe.

label: joy
text: When I saw a good friend again after not having seen her for a à long time.

label: fear
text: When I slipped on a glazed frost road and a car almost ran into à me.

label: anger
text: When people without my permission pry in my belongings and take à things out of it.

label: sadness
text: When I noticed that my parents were not in such a prosperity as à most people in my surroundings.

label: disgust
text: Seeing a pornographic movie in which animals were used.

label: shame
text: When I went for the first time in my life to a nudist-beach.

label: guilt
text: I was caught sneaking sweets.

label: joy
text: When I went to visit a friend in the hospital. She had to undergo à an operation for rupture. I was glad to hear that the operation à succeeded and that she was relieved of her pain.

label: fear
text: I had an appointment with a good friend. He came 3 hours later à than we agreed upon. During the last hour of waiting I was afraid à something might had happened, because usally he is in time.

label: anger
text: I worked together with another student on a computer-assignment. à She didn't do her best and didn't prepare herself for it. She à expected me to explain it to her.

label: sadness
text: I had a quarrel with a good friend about the fact that I didn't à pay her a visit when she expected me to come. Hereafter I was à very sad because it became a real quarrel.

label: disgust
text: I was hitch-hiking when a man stopped and gave me a lift to à Nijmegen. During the ride he asked me whether I was in for fun. à The man was fat and tatooed.

label: shame
text: I forgot something I agreed upon with a good friend.

label: guilt
text: I became very angry with my friend because he didn't do shopping, à while we agreed on him doing this. My being angry was proved to be à without reason and I felt guilty about it.

label: joy
text: When I got the positive result of my examination to achieve the à Bachelor Degree in Plychology.

label: fear
text: When I was 12 years old I frequently was pursued by others and à got sound thrashes.

label: anger
text: My girlfriend one day went out and promised to be back at 6.00 pm à however she first arrived at 10.00 pm, without a message (we had à to go out that evening).

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend decided to finish our relation.

label: disgust
text: When once again I drank too much and felt very rotten the morning à after.

label: shame
text: When I overslept for the second time on the day I had an à examination.

label: guilt
text: When having a relationship, I made love with another girl.

label: joy
text: When the girl with whom I am in love smiles at me.

label: fear

text: When a discussion resulted in an insult, which in my opinion, was à not justified.

label: sadness

label: disgust
text: When I had to finish those big amounts of homework in time.

text: When I gave water to the plants of a friend. Then one plant fell à over, and a little statue broke. I, of course, had to tell him à everything.

label: guilt

label: joy
text: On my birthday when several good friends came to visit me.

label: fear
text: I went to the apartment of my boyfriend and saw some people à before his door. I thought that something had happened.

label: anger
text: My father called me (behind my mother's back) and told me that my à mother disapproved my behavior in the weekend. However, he didn't à tell me the details and left me with unanswered questions.

label: sadness
text: I felt very lonely, was very dissatisfied with myself when I à realised that I could feel very jealous of other women because à of my boyfriend.

label: disgust
text: A scene in a film in which one man repressed another one. By à concidence, their position was reversed. The other man was à repressed in an identical way as he did before.

label: shame
text: When I do not succeed in making myself clear to other people. à When they do not understand what I say.

label: guilt
text: After the death of a girl who I disliked.

label: joy
text: I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at à first he had said that he would not do that.

label: fear
text: I was very startled when, at night at 2.00 am, a boy approached à me and yelled "I fuck you", then however he stopped and laughed at à me.

label: anger
text: When someone does not listen to me after having asked me to à repeat what I said. This happened more than one time with the à same person.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when I heard that a friend had committed suicide.

label: disgust
text: One night I saw a man being knocked down by two other men. The à victim was kicked against his head.

text: When I made acquaintance with the parents of my boyfriend for the à first time. They spoke Limburgian (a dutch dialect) and one of my à first remarks was that I disliked Limburgian dialect.

label: guilt
text: When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwards à it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved à time for it.

label: joy
text: For a few days I felt very miserable, distressed and listless, à with crying fits. When this was over I felt very happy, although à there was no special reason.

label: fear
text: I was testing my new roller skates in the street, suddenly a dog à ran barking in my direction, very threatening. I was very à startled and terribly upset.

label: anger
text: Out on a weekend with a group of people, everybody felt irritated à because at night the music didn't stop in time. And at breakfast à my boyfriend ran away because we didn't agree with him. I felt à angry.

label: sadness
text: Recently I felt very sad without any reason. It lasted for a few à days. There was nothing I liked in that period.

label: disgust
text: Someone told me a story of Amnesty International: a boy was à killed and his head was put in the litter of his girlfriend. It à looked as if she was pregnant, then she died. It is disgusting, I à can hardly write it down.

label: shame
text: I cried for 3 hours because I felt very miserable. Then I called à my boyfriend and he said lovely things to me. After this feeling à disappeared I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: Yesterday my boyfriend and I wanted to play billiards. However à there were boys playing (5 times). My boyfriend then is fed up à and chagrined. In such case I think it is my fault.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we have à made a nice walk together.

label: fear
text: The weather is very bad (fog and slipperiness) the newcast à reports many traffic accidents and my boyfriend is driving home à and still has 60 kilometers to go.

label: anger
text: Someone told me that he would stay at my home for one night. à Therefore I made big efforts to make everything ok (food). One day à before he cancelled the appointment because he had to go to à church with his parents.

label: sadness
text: We had to take our cat to the vet for mercy killing (an à injection).

label: disgust
text: When people are eating unsavoury (smacking, belching, speaking à with food in their mouth, etc.).

label: shame
text: A girl in our class was nicknamed "fatsy". Later, I heard that à she suffered from diabetes mellitus.

label: guilt
text: I made an appointment to pick up someone. However I arrived à too late and she had to wait a quarter of an hour.

label: joy
text: One night I had a very good conversation with two friends. I then à realized how worthy they were for me and how happy I was to à have them as friends.

label: fear
text: In the morning just before going to the dentist.

label: anger
text: When a very close friend with whom I have a very intimate and à bodily relationship (he had a girlfriend) started to avoid me and à didn't want to talk to me any more.

label: sadness
text: When a good friend with whom I had an intimate relationship made à clear that he didn't want to continue in the same way. He choose à his girlfriend (also a friend of mine).

label: disgust
text: When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. Sometimes à I even considered him unlikable.

label: shame
text: I had a short lasting sexual relationship with someone I didn't à love.

label: guilt
text: When I realized that I avoided two good friends with whom I à always shared toys and sorrows. I made up idle stories to avoid à telling them what happened to me.

label: joy
text: My boyfriend suffered form ill health for some months, this week à the physician told him that he was restored to health.

label: fear
text: When going out in the weekend I have to bike 5 kilometers through à lonely and dark polders, then I always have terrifying fantasies.

label: anger
text: I made an appointment with a friend to drink coffee togehter. à However, for the third time in that week she arrived an hour too à late.

label: sadness
text: My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years. à His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).

label: disgust
text: I read a newspaper report that a little boy was forced to look à while his sister was raped.

label: shame
text: We had made an appointment to complete together a piece of work. à It appeared that I was the only one who hadn't prepared anything.

label: guilt
text: I call my mother at least once a week. However last week I à completely forgot. This morning she called me, she thought I felt à ill.

label: joy
text: After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That à feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good à grade for an examination.

label: fear
text: I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation. à I was very afraid to fail.

label: anger
text: When, after having cleaned up the kitchen, two hours later I saw à that there was a big mess. It irritated me very much.

label: sadness
text: One night I was called and told that the father of a close friend à died. When I visited my friend at home and when attending the à funeral I felt very sad.

label: disgust
text: I cannot remember exactly such a situation. But I know that à once I went to a very dirty lavatory and that disgusted me.

label: shame
text: Once by coincidence I clutched a stranger (in a rather intimate à way), thinking it was my boyfriend. When by hindsight I à feel ashamed when thinking about it.

label: guilt
text: I once torn the inner tube of a bike, that was not mine. Then I à saw it was a brand new one. I felt very guilty then.

label: joy
text: When I found out that the girl, with whom I was in love, loved me à too.

label: fear
text: When my mother threatened me with thrushing me of the stairs, when à I once more should make a comment.

label: anger
text: When being made look a fool by the teacher in front of the class à during a turn.

label: sadness
text: My mother unjustly became very angry with me and sent me to my à room while my father explained that the way she saw things was à not correct. I had done things with the best intentions.

label: disgust
text: My mother was very angry with my little sister and told her to à put her hands on the table in order to beat her hands up. She à forced by means of her power.

label: shame
text: A friend came for dinner with me at home. His parents are à ordinary people. My mother, however, used the very expensive à porcelain dinner-service and the silver cutlery. I felt very à ashamed.

label: guilt
text: Once after falling in love, I imagined that particular girl to be à perfect and completely overshadowing my girlfriend. Afterwards I à realized that this image was not objective. I felt guilty against à both girls.

label: joy
text: Once a week I work as a volunteer in a biologic garden. this work à in the garden and the contact with other volunteers filled me à with joy. They also gave me support after I failed passing my à driver's test.

label: fear
text: My friend and I planned to search for old documents and utensils à in the cellar. It was very late at night when we arrived in the à cellar. He indicated the place where the police (40 years ago) found à two dead bodies. I got very scared when he told me this story.

label: joy
text: When someone made me a compliment after an examination just at à the moment I needed it. It was amicable, hearty and sincere.

label: fear
text: When I went up the stairs in a high, dark house full of shadows, à passed a door and had the feeling that someone or something was à behind me, although I knew I was alone.

label: anger
text: A friend told me it would be better for me not to be on familiar à terms with another friend, although, in my opinion he had no à reason to say such things. He only said so hoping that I à would search support from him (that, however, was not necessary).

label: sadness
text: I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason, à they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull and à unable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I could à manage things.

label: disgust
text: When I see that some people remain cold and egoistic with regard à to close friends, even in situations that those friends need à them.

label: shame
text: When I state things with great positiveness and try to convince à others, and it appears that my statement is not right.

label: guilt
text: A certain friend evokes positive feelings, when I am with him but à negative feelings when he is not present. I feel the need to à express those negative feelings. However, when I speak about him, à I always think: Why do I like this, he does not deserve this, but à still I do so.

label: joy
text: A few days ago, I hitch-hiked to Arnhems with a friend. à Everything went well: they picked us up very quickly, the sun was à shining, I was feeling free and, for the first time after long à time, happy. I really had the feeling that I was living at full à speed.

label: fear
text: My grandmother several times has been struck by cerebral à hemorrhages. Until now she recovered well each time, but there is à always the threat to loose her.

label: anger
text: I had made an appointment with three friends. We had to go out à together. When I arrived at the place, the other persons weren't à there. I became very angry because I thought they were gone à without me. That, however, didn't appear to be the case.

label: sadness
text: I finished the relationship with my boyfriend, after having felt à myself very unhappy for a long time.

label: disgust
text: A few days after I had finished the relationship with my à boyfriend, we had a quarrel. Then he hit me. At that moment I à found him disgusting.

label: shame
text: I was taking a shower in a cubicle in France. Then I discovered à that a few children were loking at me from the adjacent cubicle.

label: guilt
text: I know that a certain person feels very lonely, and that she à always looks forward to seeing me. However, often I am too à busy to visit her, then I feel guilty.

label: joy
text: A close relative of mine underwent a difficult operation, and everything à turned out fine.

label: fear
text: When I get into the tube or the train without paying for the à ticket.

label: anger
text: A class-mate urged me to carry out a particular protest along à with him, and when the time came this fellow drew back while I à had to face the situation.

label: sadness
text: When I failed the entrance exam to IMEC.

label: disgust
text: When I saw someone eating live worms.

label: shame
text: When I was a child my parents caught me with a pornographic à magazine.

label: guilt
text: [ I can not remember anything in particular.  What I can remember à is feelings of having done or said something which then had à negative consequences.]

label: joy
text: When they told me that I had got a study grant.

label: shame
text: When I wore a grotesque figure hanging down my back.

label: guilt
text: Because I had not studied.

label: joy
text: When my father was saved from a severe work accident.

label: fear
text: When I was a child I hid under the sheets out of fear of à darkness.

label: anger
text: When I first saw a person begging.

label: sadness
text: When my basket ball team lost the qualification at a final.

label: disgust
text: When I see rotten meat.

label: shame
text: When a person whom I do not want to see is continously present.

label: guilt
text: When I failed an exam I thought I could pass easily.

label: joy
text: When I got to know that I had passed the university entrance à exam.  I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.

label: fear
text: When I was very young, one day, I was in the street with my à father and brother.   While my father was talking to some à friends, I saw a dog and began to pat it.  My father told me à sharply to stop doing it because the dog had mange.  Then my à brother told me that I would die and I could not stop crying à after this.

label: anger
text: We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.  We were à dropped in another town which was unknown to us.  I needed to à urinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to the à military headquarters.  They arrested me and made me pay a fine à of 500 pts.  We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was too à late for anyone to give us a lift.

label: sadness
text: I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.  She was very pretty and I à was very happy.  But she did not turn up.  Thank God, there were à some other friends there and I was able to have a more or less à good time.

label: disgust
text: I had a class-mate who was rather stupid.  I did not like him à but I respected him.  When he tried to talk to someone, they à would not listen to him and I could not bear seeing this.

label: shame
text: I met a friend in a discotheque. he was with a girl and he told à me that she was not his girlfriend.  I, to say something, à commented that she must be a viscious woman.  He then told me à that she was his girl.

label: guilt
text: I went to a pub with a group of friends (not very close) and à I was with one girl most of the time, while the other girls in the à group wanted to be with me.  They stopped talking to the girl I à was with.

label: joy
text: The day some friends of mine and I decided to go to Galicia on à holiday.

label: fear
text: Before an exam which I, finally did not take.

label: anger
text: At home when they lost three pieces of my puzzle.

label: sadness
text: When I had an argument with a friend.

label: disgust
text: When I am dirty because I have not had a shower for a few days.

label: shame
text: Once I did not have enough money to pay for a coffee.

label: guilt
text: After an argument with a friend of mine.

label: joy
text: A friend of mine told me that I had passed the entrance exam to à the university.

label: fear
text: Before taking an exam.

label: anger
text: My family told me to leave if I was not willing to accept the à conditions they imposed on me.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine called me when I was not at home.  I phoned her à back to know what she wanted and she told me that she had dialled à the wrong number.

label: disgust
text: I had to change a baby's clothes for the first time.

label: shame
text: I fell outside the door of my house.

label: guilt
text: My younger sister was almost run over by a lorry.

label: joy
text: When my brother was born.

label: fear
text: When I almost fell down from some rocks because I had been acting à foolishly and playing dangerously.

label: anger
text: Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.

label: sadness
text: The death of a friend.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a scene on T.V where a castration was shown.

label: shame
text: Once I answered my father rudely.

label: guilt
text: When my brother ran away from home and I thought it was because à of my continously scolding him.

label: joy
text: When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.  It à made me forget all my problems.

label: fear
text: When I was ten I got shut in the school with a friend.  I had to à jump out of a window and cross a beam 10 metres high.

label: anger
text: When I was told that a boy did not want to be my friend without à any apparent reason.

label: sadness
text: When I learnt that a boy I liked had been with a girl for three à years.

label: disgust
text: When a very dirty class-mate farted in my  presence.  There was a à terrible smell.

label: shame
text: When I realized that I had a hole in my trousers after having gone à for a walk.

label: guilt
text: When I had an argument with my grandfather the day my younger à brother was born.

label: joy
text: When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for à her all night, not knowing where she was.

label: fear
text: While I was waiting for them to give me the marks of the most à difficult subject this year.

label: anger
text: I had an argument with my mother because I criticized the rules à she imposes at home, which are too rigid and arbitrary for me.

label: sadness
text: When I learned that a friend of mine had not been speaking to her à boyfriend for a week after an argument because of unfounded à jealousy.

label: disgust
text: On seeing a scene of an accident in a magazine.

label: shame
text: A few days back I had to ask a professor a ridiculous question à because I had lost at a game of cards and had to pay a forfeit.

label: guilt
text: When I shouted at my mother when she was nervous and depressed.

label: joy
text: After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was à very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.

label: fear
text: When I saw a TV program on the North American military plan à called "The startwar".

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I saw on T.V the last slaughter of negroes in à South Africa.

label: sadness
text: When I saw the pictures of the draught in Etiopia.

label: disgust
text: Whenever I see an alcoholic.

label: shame
text: On New Year's Eve, when I went to the house of my girlfriend's à parents to meet them.

label: guilt
text: When I failed an exam for which I knew that I had not studied à hard enough.

label: joy
text: The day the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the à final at Athens.

label: fear
text: The last time I was face to face with with the monstrous dog à which lives in my street.

label: anger
text: During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants à made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.

label: sadness
text: When I heard the last regulation of the socialist govrenment à concerning pensions.

label: disgust
text: When I got to know the details if the famine in East Africa.

label: shame
text: The last time I had to phone the Registry, after having called à them so many times in the last few days.

label: guilt
text: During an argument with my brother, I behaved rather à intransigently, even cruelly, wishing to morally hurt the "person" à opposed to me.

label: joy
text: When I passed an important exam.

label: fear
text: In a rather important exam, when they caught me red handed à copying.

label: anger
text: When my father addressed me directly and maliciously, thus à including me in the "family war".

label: sadness
text: When my parents got divorced.

label: disgust
text: When I was a child, one day while playing, I fell up to my waist à in mud.

label: shame
text: When I was dismissed from a job after having been accused of theft.

label: guilt
text: When I was with a girl who seemed to love me, while I was with à her just to go to bed with her.

label: joy
text: When I passed an exam which I had failed last year.

label: fear
text: When I go out alone at night.

label: anger
text: A murder.

label: sadness
text: When I failed two subjects last year.

label: disgust
text: When I see people who have no sentiments.

label: shame
text: I think that I am rather shy and do not mix with people as I à would have liked to, out of shyness.

label: guilt
text: When I triffled with other people.

label: joy
text: When I was told that I could take a week off and go for a trip à with my friends.

label: fear
text: Every time I went home with my school report.

label: anger
text: During an argument between friends, one of them accused me of à taking advantage of some other friends who usually come to the à university in my car, saying that I ask them too much money for à the petrol.

label: sadness
text: When I learned that two of my friends had had a serious car accident.

label: disgust
text: A young man was insulting and humiliating a drunken man.

label: shame
text: My aunt phoned me to ask me why I had refused the her invitation à to dinner at her home on the New Year's Eve.

label: guilt
text: I was with a girl one night and then did not call her again, à although she had asked me to do so.

label: joy
text: When I saw that I had passed an exam.  It was the last chance and à there was a lot at stake.

label: fear
text: On a trip to Santander we wanted to stop at a curve because a à friend was sick, and the car skidded of the gravel.

label: anger
text: My cousins were playing at home and one of them broke a decorative à object which was very precious to me.

label: sadness
text: All my friends arranged to go for an afternoon snack and they did à not tell me.  They told me that they did not have my phone number à but I do not think that this was true.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a film where a black was rapeing a girl while another one was à filming it for a pornographic movie.

label: shame
text: I was swimming in the sea and a wave took the top part of my à bikini away.

label: guilt
text: I was looking after a child and she fell down because I was not à paying her much attention.  One side of her face got bruised.

label: joy
text: When I pass exams, or when a close friend of mine recovered à from an illness,etc.

label: fear
text: Fights that I see in the middle of the street, robberies, fear of à darkness when going home.

label: anger
text: During a family discussion on my future and my prospects as a à student, they accused me of not bothering about looking for a job to à assume my financial situation.

label: sadness
text: [ Depressions.]

label: disgust
text: Some people whom I do not like at all, and one of the reasons is à their physical appearance.

label: shame
text: For example, to feel bad because of one's attire, to be among à people who do not belong to the same social class, to give a à wrong answer in class, to be surprised in particular situations.

label: guilt
text: Some of my friends had an argument.  I had earlier phoned one à of them and that may have influenced him to argue.

label: joy
text: When I met a very close friend of mine after one year of à separation.

label: fear
text: There was an earthquake for several minutes and I was on the à eight floor.

label: anger
text: An argument among several friends because of the irrational à behavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason and à said that we were to blame.

label: sadness
text: A class-mate died after being two months in coma, after a car à accident.

label: disgust
text: Pictures of Nazi extermination camps on a T.V program.

label: shame
text: Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire on à entering a government building with several people there.

label: guilt
text: I left a boy with whom I was going around without giving him any à explanations.

label: joy
text: When my sister was born.

label: fear
text: When they tried to rob me.

label: anger
text: When I failed an exam unfairly.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died.

label: disgust
text: When I see dead dogs on the road.

label: shame
text: When I went to see the doctor and had to take my clothes off so à that he could examine me.

label: guilt
text: When my parents quarelled over something I had done and which was à wrong.

label: joy
text: When my little sister was born.

label: fear
text: When I was attending an authorized demonstrationand the police à rushed brutally at the demonstrators, without any warning.

label: anger
text: When a professor of this faculty laughed at, and was suspicious of à a composition written by a class-mate and me.

label: sadness
text: The death of a relative, friend, or someone I esteem.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a very disagreable scene.

label: shame
text: When I had to represent my boss at a meeting.

label: guilt
text: When I inadvertantly made some close friends and relatives feel à bad.

label: joy
text: When I passed an exam.

label: fear
text: When they threatened me with a knife to take my money.

label: anger
text: When I failed an exam I thought I would pass.

label: sadness
text: When my dog died.

label: disgust
text: When I saw an accident where the man lost his head.

label: shame
text: When I tripped while getting on a bus.

label: guilt
text: When I hurt a person's feelings.

label: joy
text: I had not seen my brother for five years as he was not in Spain.   à When he arrived at the airport, I felt great joy.

label: fear
text: When two drug addicts tried to take away my money.

label: anger
text: When I saw my brother being attacked and I could not do anything.

label: sadness
text: When a class-mate died.

label: disgust
text: When a person saw that I was accused of something I had not done à and did not do anything to defend me.

label: shame
text: When inadvertantly I found myself in the ladies room.

label: guilt
text: When I broke something and a friend of mine was blamed.

label: joy
text: I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it's à difficulty.

label: fear
text: When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls, à because my car had broken down.

label: anger
text: When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration, à simply because the child had been leaning against a window.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine who was driving a car ahead of me died in a à car accident.

label: disgust
text: When I had to dissect a live mouse at school.

label: shame
text: When I was a child I had to recite a poem in a show at the end of à the term.

label: guilt
text: When I saw a program on Ethiopia on T.V, a fews hours earlier I à had thrown away some clothes and food.

label: joy
text: When I saw that the mark I had obtained in an exam was a good à one.

label: fear
text: We were in the country and I walked away from the others one à night.  Suddenly something moved sharply in front of me and I was à not able to see what it was.

label: anger
text: When I was young, I became very angry as I was not allowed to à stay up all night for the fair in my town.

label: sadness
text: When summer is over and I have to leave the town where I spend my à holidays.

label: disgust
text: When I saw several people washing their car with water from a à drain.

label: shame
text: When I inadvertantly entered the ladies room and met some girls à on my way out.

label: guilt
text: I was entrusted with an object and while using it I handled it à carelessly and it broke.

label: joy
text: When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting a à baby girl.  That was what I wanted.

label: fear
text: One night, walking along a park, I began to think that some à roughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things like à that.

label: anger
text: I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part à very well but did not know the second part.

label: sadness
text: When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.

label: disgust
text: One day I was going through the street door of my house, when a à man asked me for a doctor.  He then showed me his genitals and à asked me to cure him myself.

label: shame
text: Each time the professor asks me a question in class.

label: guilt
text: I had an argument with my boyfriend.  It was my fault but my à pride would not let me admit it.

label: joy
text: An invitation to spend 5 days at the seaside with all expenses à paid.

label: fear
text: A film on zombies.

label: anger
text: When males in my family try to assign house duties exclusively à with referance to sex.

label: sadness
text: I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with him à and and my Easter holidays.

label: disgust
text: When after a storm in the country, I left my shelter and saw a à big, fat, slimy green toad by my side.

label: shame
text: When a friend from whom I preferred to hide my private life à discovered that I had relations with a man.

label: guilt
text: When my brother had to spend all evening repairing a gear-lever à that I had broken.

label: joy
text: When I passed the university entrance exam.

label: fear
text: When I was walking down the street, some boys showed me a knife à and stole all my money.

label: anger
text: When they threw my holder down on the floor, with all my notes for à an exam inside it and they got all mixed up.

label: sadness
text: When my mother was operated.

label: disgust
text: When I see pornographic films.

label: shame
text: One day I got on the bus without any money or season ticket and à the driver threw me out.

label: guilt
text: When a friend of mine was beaten for what was my fault.

label: joy
text: My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all à very worried but it was successful.

label: fear
text: I was walking along a subway when I saw a group of louts.  I was à rather afraid because I was alone.

label: anger
text: An old woman was violently thrown down the stairs of the tube by à a group of louts.

label: sadness
text: A child, 9 years old, died in a stupid way.  He fell from a place à which was 1 metre high.

label: disgust
text: On the road there was a dead animal with its entrails showing and à its skull crushed.

label: shame
text: We were discussing a subject ( I knew very little about it) and I à was holding my ground.  They showed me that I was wrong.

label: guilt
text: I could have passed the last exam of the public competition, but à I failed as I had not studied.

label: joy
text: I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she à had obtained a grant to work in the library.

label: fear
text: Before knowing my marks I was not sure that I wanted to go to à that class.

label: anger
text: I learned that a class-mate had given a list, of peolpe who help à each other in exams, to the professor.

label: sadness
text: I phoned two friends and was not able to arrange a meeting with à either of them, so I had to change my plans.

label: disgust
text: I was in the cafeteria at the university and a class-mate told me à that a friend of hers had had all her teeth taken out because of à an infection caused by her eating a rat's nail in her hamburger.

label: shame
text: I had to meet a girlfriend to go out for a drink and she arrived à with her aunt, to whom I was introduced.  Then the aunt left.

label: guilt
text: One night, after having decided to finish our relationship, I à took my girlfriend home.  While driving back home, I felt that I à had not handled the whole thing very well.

label: joy
text: The begining of my relations with my current girlfriend.

label: fear
text: When I am alone at night after having read horror stories, and à then I heard unexplainable noises.

label: anger
text: A typical family argument.

label: sadness
text: The disqualification of two of my mates in the military service.

label: disgust
text: The sight of vomit on the street.

label: shame
text: When criticizing something about a person and then realizing that à the person whom one is talking to is similar.

label: guilt
text: Not to have studied enough when exams were near.

label: joy
text: When I pass an exam.

label: fear
text: Continous fear of a nuclear war.

label: anger
text: When you kill yourself with work and see the number of slakers à wandering around, doing nothing.

label: sadness
text: When someone in my family died.

label: disgust
text: To loose friends because of them over-estimating themselves.

label: shame
text: When people next to me play the fool.

label: guilt
text: To force someone to do something that suits me.

label: joy
text: I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began to à study for the final exam, then my friend told me that I had à passed it.  That meant that I could go home, as I do not study in à my hometown.

label: fear
text: I was in Sierra Nevada, climbing a peak over 3,000 metres high, à without any light and with many other problems.  I was afraid for à my life.

label: anger
text: I was living in a flat where things did not go very well for me.  à Finally, they threw me out and this prejudiced people I esteem a à lot.

label: sadness
text: When I read the diary of the girl with whom I was living, it was à about another boy with whom she had been going around some time back.

label: disgust
text: The man who threw me out of the flat disgusted me.

label: shame
text: The first time that I caressed a girl, I was about thirteen and à she was eighteen.  I noticed that it did not affect her at all.

label: guilt
text: I was going around with a girl without loving her.  Not only did à I go around with her, but we did many more things.  In the end I à was not very sincere to her.

label: joy
text: I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months. à  I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we à went there because we knew we would meet there.

label: fear
text: I was walking in the countryside alone when I came across two à dogs who began barking at me.  I did not know whether they were à tied up or loose, but I was afraid of them approaching me.

label: anger
text: I was angry when my sister began to talk nonsense and to laugh at à the way I swept the room.  My anger grew (I tried to control à myself).  After telling her to leave me alone, I vented my anger à on her as she did not obey me.

label: sadness
text: My mother was working with a knife and we were all laughing à heartily.  She was not able to control the knife and stuck it à deep into her hand.

label: disgust
text: I read a book whose plot and expressions were obscene and in very à bad taste.

label: shame
text: My mother had just been teaching me how to crochet, which is à thought highly improper for a boy in a town.  Just when we à finished, a neighbour walked in.

label: guilt
text: It was about midnight and I wanted to go to the countryside (I à was in town) to watch the stars in the sky.  My mother did not à like this, in spite of it I went out for a while.  My mother got à angry.

label: joy
text: A friend of mine suggested that I become a film extra.  The idea à seemed very funny to me and my reaction seemed rather outlandish à to the others.

label: fear
text: One day I went to the cinema to see a film in which I was à interested.  On arriving there I saw a long queue (which I had à not expected) and went back home without seeing the film.

label: anger
text: When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half an à hour for the next one.

label: sadness
text: When I knew I had to go out with my mother on some errands.

label: disgust
text: I saw in an ice-cream kiosque a cockroach walking through a à cornet.

label: shame
text: One day in class, the professor asked me a question concerning something à he had been explaining.  He was very close to me (beside me) and I à had no idea what to answer.

label: guilt
text: Once I had some homework to do and I did not do it.

label: joy
text: When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go à there, if I wished, in Summer.

label: fear
text: When I was operated on the knee and had to go through rehabilitation.

label: anger
text: In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I à played very badly.

label: sadness
text: When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commit à suicide.

label: disgust
text: A TV program on whale-hunting.

label: shame
text: Once when I said bad things concerning a friend.

label: guilt
text: Family discord and uneasiness due to something I did not à communicate on time.

label: joy
text: When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I à had taken this test.

label: fear
text: When my mother was robbed in a shop.

label: anger
text: I was given an exam which I thought did not measure at all my à ability or my knowledge of the subject.

label: sadness
text: When I saw the film "Johnny got his gun" which deals with the à consequences of the Vietnam war.

label: disgust
text: Some friends and I were having lunch.  Someone said something à funny and one of the guys started laughing and spat his food in a girl's à face.

label: shame
text: I was alone in the bus when I tripped and fell, and dropped all à my papers.

label: guilt
text: As I was not paying attention, my little brother fell off the à table.

label: joy
text: When I passed the university entrance exam.

label: fear
text: One night, while I was sleeping, I woke up suddenly with the à sensation that there was someone in my room.

label: anger
text: When my brother was held up and robbed.

label: sadness
text: When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.

label: disgust
text: When I see someone vomitting.

label: shame
text: When I fell head on in a fountain.

label: guilt
text: I had to undergo an operation in Summer and so my family had to à stay at home during the holidays.  I felt guilty, above all à because of my brothers.

label: joy
text: I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long à time.

label: fear
text: I had decided to propose to the man I liked to make a trip à together.  One day, during breakfast I told him my idea.  I was à afraid of his not accepting it and that the idea would end up as à a failure.

label: anger
text: A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations to à justify a wrong action.

label: sadness
text: I was having breakfast with a classmate and suddenly I began to à cry as I thought of a friend of mine whom I had not seen for a à long time.

label: disgust
text: During lunch with some classmates, a priest was also there.  He à was eating desperately as if someone was going to take his plate à away.  He did it with gluttony.  He wiped his hands on his suit à several times and it was full of crumbs.

label: shame
text: When a professor caught me absent-minded and not paying attention à to what he was saying.

label: guilt
text: One day, I was alone on duty when a patient choked while eating.  à I ran to her and tried to make her breath, but it was too late.

label: joy
text: At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had not à seen for some time

label: fear
text: Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified to à give my report card to my father.  I left it on the table and went to à bed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.

label: anger
text: When, after drinking a glass of water, I found a cockroach walking à out of the glass.

label: sadness
text: I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have à been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went à to her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how great à the distance between us was.

label: disgust
text: They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some à awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.

label: shame
text: The girl with whom I was going around had been forbidden to be à alone with me in the house.  We paid no attention to this à prohibition but one day her parents appeared and I jumped out of à the window.  They saw me.

label: guilt
text: I was driving a friend's car, and I got close to the pavement to à ask my way and I struck a parked car.

label: joy
text: Every time, in the last few days, when my girlfriend told me that à she loves me.

label: fear
text: I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain, waiting for à my uncle.  I remember that I took a big stone and it calmed me.

label: anger
text: We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were à watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering à me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)  à by hitting one of them.

label: sadness
text: [ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe back à home, I felt very sad.]

label: disgust
text: Once I had to clean a lavatory which was obstructed.  It was in a à friend's country house and there was nobody there to help me.

label: shame
text: In a Mathematics class, the professor asked me a question and I à gave the wrong answer.

label: guilt
text: When I lost my study grant without having attended any exam in à the career I had started, and it was too late to cancel my registration.

label: joy
text: A party I went to last Christmas.

label: fear
text: When my mother had a nervous illness.

label: anger
text: During my last exam.

label: sadness
text: When I had to come back from my village last Christmas.

label: disgust
text: One day I went to see a rather disagreeable film (X).

label: shame
text: Once I had to visit a rather special person.

label: guilt
text: Once, I accidentally injured a boy in the eye and he almost lost à it.

label: joy
text: When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.

label: fear
text: A fall during a climb, with almost with no previous experience.

label: anger
text: On the occasion of assignment of tasks and responsibilities in à which such an assignment, dispropotionately carried with it high à responsibility and low ability of organisation and resolution.

label: sadness
text: Moving to an unknown place, away from the familiar surroundings à and into a situation of loneliness.

label: disgust
text: When I had to sleep in a bed at a hostel, which was full of dirt.

label: shame
text: While shopping, a person close to us created an uncomfortable à situation for those who were with her.

label: guilt
text: Incomprehension and repression towards a child's behaviour, à commonly not accepted, and making the child cry.

label: fear
text: In a dark street at 4 o'clock in the night and there was à complete silence.

label: anger
text: When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.  Changes were à made and it was broken without permission, they had no right to à do this.

label: sadness
text: When the train taking me to my military service left the station, à on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I à had a hard year ahead.

label: disgust
text: A situation of overt unfairness, manipulation of people and its à consequences.

label: shame
text: A children's film in which I played a clown, with spotlights, à cameras and the director who demanded jumps and guffaws.

label: guilt
text: When a close classmate failed a year.

label: joy
text: I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very à funny.

label: fear
text: When I was young I saw a horror film.  Then when I went to sleep, à the film came back too my mind and the characters frighteneed my à imagination.

label: anger
text: In a confrontation with a person, he provoked me several times à till I reacted in an angry way.  Fortunately there were no à disastrous consequences.

label: sadness
text: I was watching a sad film and it affected me deeply.

label: disgust
text: When I was reading a book.  It had nothing to do with the book à itself but with the disagreable smell of the pages of the book.

label: shame
text: In class I had to say something aloud and people reacted  by à laughing.

label: guilt
text: In an exam I answered the questions rather carelessly and à afterwards I thought that the exam would have been better had I à answered more carefully.

label: joy
text: When I knew that there were, at last, no problems in making a à journey that I had been wanting to make for a long time.

label: fear
text: It was more that fear - anguish -that I felt before my last exam.

label: anger
text: When I had an argument with my best friend and I thought that I à was right and she was not.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I à had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.

label: disgust
text: The first time I saw a pornographic film, all that in practice is à so beautiful but on the screen appered as something mechanical, à irrational, disgusting and dehumanizing.

label: shame
text: When I stated sharply something I was not very sure of and a few à days later I was shown to be wrong.

label: guilt
text: When I do or say something inappropriate which hurts people close à to me.

label: joy
text: When a study tour got confirmed, I was happy all the time till    à the tour began.

label: fear
text: I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence à and started barking angrily.  They were jumping and it seemed à that they would come for me any time.

label: anger
text: When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from one à university to another.  I began to insult the educatioon à authorities and the government, I ended up at the door.

label: sadness
text: We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and à said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints à and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.

label: disgust
text: My dog had been run over and died near the house.  We had to pick à him up, cold and glassy eyed, to get rid of the corpse.

label: shame
text: A professor was going to read aloud in class a composition of à mine in which I had criticized some political attitudes and also à some class-mates.   I was ashamed at having written that.

label: guilt
text: In an exam when I answered the questions with very little à assurance due to insufficiet preparation.

label: joy
text: When I received my report card in C.O.U.  I was afraid of obtaining à low marks, but they were much higher than expected.

label: fear
text: I was at the cinema with my sister and her boyfriend.  A man à sitting beside me started to stroke my leg for a while, he left in à the middle of the film.

label: anger
text: My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and à my own behaviour towards him.  His biased (authoritarian) and à ridiculous point of view made us angry.

label: sadness
text: I had failed some subjects in mathematics.

label: disgust
text: I was at the table at a French friend's house.  They served me a à big dish with roast cauliflower and sauce.  I had to eat it.

label: shame
text: This morning I spent a lot of time on my toilet and missed the à train to the university.  My mother told me that I spent more à time than a woman on my toilet.  I felt a mixed emotion of shame à and anger.

label: guilt
text: I was alone at home when I broke a figure and then mended it.  A à few days later my mother noticed it and asked me about it, I told à her that I had no idea.

label: joy
text: When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned à my love.

label: fear
text: When I was caught by the police and was kept with a group of à delinquents, which added to my fear of being shut up.  I was à afraid of the people near me and the future consequences.

label: anger
text: When I was the target of a great many insults and completely à unfair accusations of a large group of people.

label: sadness
text: When my best friend died, at the age of 16.

label: disgust
text: When I entered a brothel and saw two sailors with a young à prostitute who was not older than 18.

label: shame
text: When I was in a religious school my teacher showed me up in front à of all my class-mates.  They were very sarcastic and cruel.

label: guilt
text: Having suffered a not very pretty sight, I reacted by uttering à some very cruel and sharp words.

label: joy
text: When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very à long time.

label: fear
text: I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having à injured it badly.

label: anger
text: When I was accused of something I had not done.

label: sadness
text: A close friend died.

label: disgust
text: I saw some images of a decapitation in a horror film.

label: shame
text: I slipped and fell in to a puddle and people started looking at à me.

label: guilt
text: I made another person cry for an unjustified cause.

label: joy
text: I received an unexpected letter from a friend I had met a short à time before.  He sent me a poem and wished me good luck.  I felt à very happy because I had great esteem for that person.

label: fear
text: I was walking with another person when a "gang" separted us and à pushed me in to a house, hit me in the stomach and the face, then à they left - leaving me bleeding.

label: anger
text: A certain person started to say dreadful things very calmly, I à felt hurt and disgusted.

label: sadness
text: A certain person whom I respect and esteem a lot pays me no à attention.  She keeps up appearances but shows almost no interest à in me.

label: disgust
text: In a bus I fell sick and vomitted in a bag.  The entire situation à was disgusting in itself.

label: shame
text: A person (a male) told me that he liked me.  He has a problem, he à is a homosexual.

label: guilt
text: I rejected a person whom I had always thought to be a friend.  I à told him so and he reacted angrily.  I felt guilty at not having à realized it before and at having hurt him.

label: joy
text: When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I à needed to buy something I had been planning to buy.

label: fear
text: When my relatives and I were in a car going slowly on a frozen à road.

label: anger
text: My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and à saw the scene and became angry.

label: sadness
text: I was going away, leaving a dear person behind.

label: disgust
text: I visited a place in Morocco where they worked the leather.  I à saw the skins emerged in a liquid which ressembled putrification.

label: shame
text: At a friend's party there were several allusions to my sexual adventures.

label: guilt
text: I was in a cafe with another person when, suddenly, several close à friends of my partner appeared.  I did not know what to do and my à partner felt uncomfortable.

label: joy
text: When I talk to my friends.

label: fear
text: When I am walking on the streets and see a gang of thugs.

label: anger
text: When people harrass me I feel oppressed by their behavior.

label: sadness
text: When I am with a friend and we have to leave each other.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and    à his skin came peeling off.

label: shame
text: When I was in the toilet and someone came in.

label: guilt
text: [ When I act thinking that I know everything and I then realize à that there were things I had not thought about, thus hurting à others.]

label: joy
text: [ Any situation in everyday life has this emotional sense, in à class, in the street, at home, at the table..........]

label: fear
text: On a dark night I felt that there were several people near me à and I did not know who they were.

label: anger
text: When I learned that several people had died in the street due to  à the cold weather.

label: sadness
text: When I saw in the newspapers, on the T.V, and magazines the à chaotic situation caused by the drought and hunger in à Mauritania.

label: disgust
text: The physical appearance of a meal.

label: shame
text: I was with a group of people and everybody told me to do or say à something.  It was a confusing, strong and traumatic situation à for me.

label: guilt
text: In a situation with my girlfriend I took a decision.  Later when à I thought about it, I realized that it was an erroneous decision.

label: joy
text: One night, at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I à most wished, around me.

label: fear
text: During a demonstration I climbed up the closed central door of a à bus.  When the bus stopped I had to go back to the same place, à afraid that the police would see me.

label: anger
text: When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he à had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should à not have been punished for it.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine was hurt as he thought that our relationship was à not the same as before and something had gone wrong.

label: disgust
text: When I was young, one day in the car we fell sick and ended up à vomitting on each other.

label: shame
text: The parents of a friend of mine surprised us and another couple à sleeping in thier place.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine felt bad because of something I had done to à something that belonged to him.

label: joy
text: When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of à medicine.

label: fear
text: Almost always when I go to fetch the results of an exam.

label: anger
text: [ No description.]

label: sadness
text: When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked à quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.

label: disgust
text: I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        à operation.

label: shame
text: I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes à came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents à attention by talking to them.

label: guilt
text: When I used an adjective for a person without knowing what it à meant.   When I got to know the meaning, I felt guilty as it was à a clear and unfair insult.

label: joy
text: When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.

label: fear
text: When a friend of mine told me a horror story.

label: anger
text: I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I à wanted to help them but everyone said no.  We then left.

label: sadness
text: At my grandfather's death.

label: disgust
text: Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.

label: shame
text: At a concert an old man arrived and began to danse, sing and do à silly things.

label: guilt
text: I had an argument with a friend of mine.  She would not let me à speak and then I began to shout at her.  She got angry and left, à I did not try to prevent her from leaving.

label: joy
text: When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film à marathon I wanted to see.

label: fear
text: We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.  We had to à swerve and we almost got run over.

label: anger
text: I had applied for a job and they had assured me that the exams à would take place a few months later.  A week later I went to à obtain some more information and they told me that the exams had à already taken place.

label: sadness
text: I received a letter from some friends, who do not live in Madrid, à telling me that they would not come on holiday.  I had arranged à everythiing for them.

label: disgust
text: I found a big, black spider near a bag of food.

label: shame
text: I was in a very small class and the professor said something à about me that made everyone look at me at the same time.

label: guilt
text: I had arranged to meet my friends at a certain place, and I was à with other people.  My friends did not arrive and the people who à were with me began to get tired.  My friends were one hour late.

label: joy
text: The man I am going around with gave me a very special present.

label: fear
text: I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which à I should not have made.

label: anger
text: My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied à up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had à done nothing.

label: sadness
text: At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he à liked and respected most was earth, I thought that he had à attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.

label: disgust
text: I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the à bathroom on time.

label: shame
text: In a very crowded shop I was distracted and missed my turn in the à queue.  A woman who was behind me began to shout at me asking me à either to pay more attention or to leave.

label: guilt
text: When I was very young, one day, I kicked my grandmother and à caused her an injury which took a long time to heal.

label: joy
text: When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time à and I had lost his address and telephone number.

label: fear
text: I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started à chasing my friends and me.  We were very frightened till we à climbed up a tree.

label: anger
text: When I saw a car run over a child, out of carelessness.

label: sadness
text: I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a à lot for it.

label: disgust
text: When I was walking in a field which had a lot of manure.

label: shame
text: I liked a boy and I would feel shy and then blush.  The more I à wanted to avoid it the more I blushed.

label: guilt
text: I am not very affectionate and I feel guilty as I do not give as à much affection as I receive.

label: joy
text: I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting à for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a  à woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I à was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found à him.

label: fear
text: I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody à in the steet.  A dog began to bark, I felt that it was following à me.  Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.  At à last I arrived home.

label: anger
text: My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.

label: sadness
text: I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.

label: disgust
text: Finding a hair in the soup.

label: shame
text: I was at the University dining room, alone, and at a table next à to mine thre were several professors.  One of them asked me to à join them.  I refused but she insisted.  All the others started à looking at me and I had to move to their table.

label: guilt
text: I had promised to say goodbye to a person who was going on a à trip, and I did not turn up.

label: joy
text: I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had à not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.

label: fear
text: We were camping in the mountains, and a friend and I went for a à walk.  It was getting darker and darker and we were not sure of à the right way back.

label: anger
text: I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me à and he lost it.

label: sadness
text: To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.

label: disgust
text: Ever since I have been a child, the sight of any kind of wound.

label: shame
text: At the seaside, when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.

label: guilt
text: One night, I went out with some friends for dinner and I did not à tell my parents that I would come back late.  I thought of à phoning but in the end I did not.  When I arrived home, my à parents were very worried.

label: joy
text: My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some à problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything  à was all right.

label: fear
text: Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.

label: anger
text: I gave some personal information to a friend of mine, and he told à it to some others who were implicated in the affair.

label: sadness
text: The holidays come to an end, and the next day we had to go back à to University and to the exams.

label: disgust
text: There was a cat on the street.  It had been run over and its head was à open.  We passed beside it.

label: shame
text: At a meeting with over one hundred people, they decided who had to speak à from the stand by drawing lots.

label: guilt
text: I had a small argument with a relative and some other people got à implicated.  It resulted in a proper row.

label: joy
text: Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had à previously failed.

label: fear
text: I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.

label: anger
text: My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.  Despite à my age, as long as I am in her house I must do what she says.

label: sadness
text: When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did à not know what would happen.

label: disgust
text: I was drinking coffee in a cafe and I found a piece of scrubber à in my cup.

label: shame
text: When I went to my boyfriend's house for lunch and saw his à parents, I felt that they were watching me all the time.

label: guilt
text: At school, I did not tell the teacher that it was me who à had laughed, and she punished the entire class by making them à stay behind for one hour.

label: joy
text: One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There à was a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.

label: fear
text: We were walking in the park at night.  It was very dark and very à late.  We began to hear foot steps all around us, and we could à not find our way out.

label: anger
text: [ One day I arrived home rather tired and found the house..... In à addition I was asked many questions which I did not want to à answer.]

label: sadness
text: I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not à have the money to do it.

label: disgust
text: In a film there was a scene in which a rat was sliding on a bed, à leaving a trace of blood behind, finally it entered the mouth of à one of the actors.

label: shame
text: I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.  I à did not notice it and came out of water.  There was a à disagreeable classmate watching the scene.

label: guilt
text: At a party, several comments were made about the personal à situation of one of the people present.  She was rather affected à and uncomfortable.

label: joy
text: It was Saturday, my duties were over for a few hours and I could à at last be with the people I wanted to see.

label: fear
text: One night, I was alone at home.  My fear was caused by some à strange noises which put my imagination to work.

label: anger
text: When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a à certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.

label: sadness
text: I felt alone among a large number of people.  I was sad to see à that nobody cared about what was happening to me.

label: disgust
text: I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.

label: shame
text: When I met a friend of mine after several months.

label: guilt
text: When I noticed the negative changes in a friend's behaviour.

label: joy
text: I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in à Madrid.

label: fear
text: I was watching a procession during the Holy week, and a penitent à approached me.

label: anger
text: My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me à telling me how she had got drunk the last time.

label: sadness
text: [ No response.]

label: disgust
text: I found a cockroach crushed between two folders in my bedroom, I à called my mother.

label: shame
text: I ride my motorbike in my village and everyone stares at me as if à I was a rare specimen.

label: guilt
text: I was spending a few days at my aunt's place.  One night I got à home very late, I had told them I was going to a party but I went à to another place.  They were very worried.

label: joy
text: Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a à long time.

label: fear
text: I was in a camp and went out for a walk at night on my own.  I lost  à my way and spent several hours looking for the camp.

label: anger
text: My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.  It was à my sister who had done it.

label: sadness
text: [ No response.]

label: disgust
text: At the hypocrisy of some of my friends.

label: shame
text: I greeted and embraced the wrong person thinking that it was my à friend.

label: guilt
text: Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friends à quarelled.

label: joy
text: When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been à very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers à from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.

label: fear
text: When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until à midnight.  I had no place to go to and there were strange reports à at the police station.

label: anger
text: When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which à I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more à money to carry on studying.

label: sadness
text: The person whom I liked most left me for a friend of mine, after à several months of mutual help and a profound knowledge of each à other.

label: disgust
text: In a park near our home, a group of young people who were à strangely dressed were seated in the middle of the street.  They à began to eat while carressing each other.

label: shame
text: I feel this emotion very often when I try to express my feelings à in public, because other people do not understand my reactions à and think that I am silly.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely and à withdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.

label: joy
text: When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished à with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one à which I had desired a lot.

label: fear
text: When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous à for me and the people close to me.

label: anger
text: When my father made my mother go through really terrible à situations, I felt furious, impotent, nervous, upset, ........

label: sadness
text: When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died.  I felt empty, à lonely, helpless, without support, not knowing what to do.

label: disgust
text: When I came to know that my father and his parents were : self à interested, dirty, negative, egoist, bad peolpe,......

label: shame
text: I think that the only time I really felt shame was when I was à very young and I had to defecate on the street.  I was very à worried in case someone should see me.

label: guilt
text: When I was young I felt guilty because I thought that I had à commited a grave sin.

label: joy
text: On my birthday, when I was given my presents.

label: fear
text: We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and à suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My à friend had to turn the car rapidly.

label: anger
text: When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the à wardrobe.  My brother had done it.

label: sadness
text: When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had à failed.

label: disgust
text: When I was getting up, I found a live cockroach in my bedroom.

label: shame
text: The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting à on a boy's lap.  I tried to greet her but could not help à blushing.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine had the sleeves of a leather coat stolen from à his car.  It was me who had left them there for everyone to see.

label: joy
text: The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get à there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there, à everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a à wonderful time all day long.

label: fear
text: I went to visit a friend in hospital.  He was going to be à operated the next day.  I was afraid that they would not let me à in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.

label: anger
text: A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the à telephone.  This friend, crying, called me and I got very angry à and made the other person apologize.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another à girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years à and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not à believe it.

label: disgust
text: I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and à vomited.

label: shame
text: I was dancing in a theatre.  I was not sure whether some frieends à of mine had come to see me.  I was very scared of doing things à wrong.

label: guilt
text: Classes were over and I wanted to go home.  A friend of mine à asked me to wait for half an hour to take him back home.  I said à no.

label: joy
text: On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.

label: fear
text: Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.

label: anger
text: They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that à the one I had was out of date.

label: sadness
text: When I came back from my holidays.

label: disgust
text: When I saw an insect going up my arm.

label: shame
text: When I entered a bar looking for a friend.

label: guilt
text: Arguing with my younger cousin.  She is rather a nuisance but I à felt sorry.

label: joy
text: When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a à fortnight.

label: fear
text: Once, when I was very young, my mother left me alone in the à house and came back very late.

label: anger
text: When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and à she was fed up with my behaviour.

label: sadness
text: When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated à from them for about three months.

label: disgust
text: When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.

label: shame
text: When the literature teacher made me recite a poem in the middle à of the class and I had to gesticulate.

label: guilt
