text: Once, when I arrived home very late, my parents had an argument à because of this; my mother wanted to stand up for me.

label: joy
text: I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in à an exam.  She told me that I had passed.

label: fear
text: I was spending my summer holidays in a village.  My friend and I à were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise à from an alley.  We were very scared and we got into my friend's house. à  A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from this à alley.

label: anger
text: My mother and I had an argument over buying some clothes for me.  à She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things à as her, and we ended up shouting at each other.

label: sadness
text: One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that à some of my relatives had died in an accident.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cut à to pieces.  Above all, it was the blood and the confusion which à impressed me most.

label: shame
text: I was walking to school and I passed by a red cross post where à there were many soldiers.  They began to pass remarks at me.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine trusted me to back her in a decision she had à made.  But when the moment came I did not agree with her opinion.

label: joy
text: I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.  I had not à expected this so I was very happy.

label: fear
text: When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at the sports à practice.  For some time he could not remember what had happened à but he recovered later.

label: anger
text: I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something à that I do not like.  They know this and still do it so as to à tease me.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: When opened a box of biscuits and found worms inside.

label: shame
text: When I was young I was told to to the shop to buy a dozen eggs.  à I went and asked for one egg and the people in the shop laughed à at me and so did my family when I told them what had happened.

label: guilt
text: When I arrived home late at night.  I know that my mother gets à worried and this made me feel angry.

label: joy
text: When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck for the à examinations she was about to take.

label: fear
text: When I was told that my daughter, who is at a boarding school, à was very ill and that they needed me there the same day.

label: anger
text: One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted à a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that my uncle had passed away.

label: disgust
text: The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the à driver made the same excuse every day.

label: shame
text: One day when I came back home, I found my favourite dish broken.  à I blamed the servant for it, later I found out that it was not à the servant but my daughter who had broken it.

label: guilt
text: When I did not give back a text book to a friend in time.

label: joy
text: When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after       à a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.

label: fear
text: When a man who had a knife grabbed me and threatened me with it,   à during my holidays in Monze.à

label: anger
text: A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent à way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about à something.

label: sadness
text: When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by à thieves in Kabwe.  They stole his van.

label: disgust
text: When we were young, a friend of mine tried to dissect a frog while  à we were playing near his home.

label: shame
text: The time I shouted at most of my friends at a party.  It was as if à  all my friends had done something wrong, or may be it was the à influence of the beer.

label: guilt
text: When I blamed my niece for misplacing my book, she denied having à touched or seen it but I carried on insisting that it was her.

label: joy
text: After going through much shame, I became a Christian and à something new happened in my heart.  Joy that overflows was à manifest in me.

label: fear
text: When I was about six years old, I mistook a cat for a leopard      à when it entered my room at night.

label: anger
text: When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him à "Mister".  I refused to succumb, but he persisted and I got angry à as he had belittled me.

label: sadness
text: When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of à a sore on the leg.

label: disgust
text: When I failed the grade 7 twice and only passed it the third à time.

label: shame
text: I was going around with a foreigner's wife and my entire family à got to know about it, this was just when I had become a à Christian.

label: guilt
text: When they found out that I was absent from school, I had gone to à the girl's secondary school.

label: joy
text: When I first passed a job interview.

label: fear
text: I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, I à would have been expelled from school had I been caught.

label: anger
text: When I was accused of having refused to do some hostel work while à I was at school.  Actually I had not been allocated any work.

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine could not make it back to Unza after having à failed the exams.

label: disgust
text: I usually come back home early but this day I came home back late à to find some visitors at my place.

label: shame
text: I got pass marks in the H.S.S compulsory courses while most à people performed well.

label: guilt
text: I destroyed my step-brother's bedsheets by mistake, they were the à only ones he had.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.

label: fear
text: When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who had à guns.

label: anger
text: When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.  This made à me wonder if he was a really a good friend.

label: sadness
text: When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.

label: disgust
text: When someone whom I trusted, disappointed me terribly.

label: shame
text: I was with my colleagues and we met an elderly man who was very à drunk, as he approached us he started to undress.

label: guilt
text: When I lied to my mum, who later came to know that what I had à been teling her was false.

label: joy
text: When I hooked a girl in Kitwe.  She was very beautiful for my à standards, a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.

label: fear
text: When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.

label: anger
text: When I was victimized for running away with a girl who was à somebody else's wife and niece at the same time.  I was very à angry over this issue because I was told to pay him money after à having been punished for it.

label: sadness
text: 1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's à reaction to the students demands concerning the educational à system.

label: disgust
text: When I got  grade "C" in M160 at the end of my first year at à UNZA.  I had expected a "C+" or a "B" as M160 is easy, going by my à capacity in mathematics.

label: shame
text: When I was found urinating, behind a toilet instead of inside it, à by my class mates and the teachers.  I was told to pick up my own à urine from the wet soil, I did it.

label: guilt
text: When my uncle found me having sexual intercourse with a distant à relative of mine in the sitting room, on the couch.  I failed to à stop and get up, I carried on.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted for further education, here at the à university.

label: fear
text: When I was walking at night, I saw fire suspended in the air and à it was split into several segments by something I could not see.  à I suspected that it was witch-craft.

label: anger
text: When I was accused by my brother of having stolen a 5 kwatcha à note from my mother's bag.  I was beaten up for this, the money à was found later.

label: sadness
text: When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill and à was in hospital.

label: disgust
text: When I was refused a transfer from my school to another, simply à because it was far away from my house.

label: shame
text: When I was taking an exam in grade 5.  The examinator found me à with a note-book and accused me of copying, All the students à laughed at me.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.

label: joy
text: When I got first division in the exams before leaving school.

label: fear
text: When I went to town in a double dekker bus.  The bus was about to à fall on the way when the driver controlled it.  It had almost à fallen.

label: anger
text: When I was in form 3, my aunts lied to my daddy telling him that à I had told them that I was pregnant.  My daddy  told my mother à and she asked me if it was true.  I was very angry with my aunts.

label: sadness
text: When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.

label: disgust
text: When a drunkard, in town yelled at me saying that I was a à prostitute.

label: shame
text: My brother came to see me and found me with a boy friend.  When à my boyfriend greeted him, he did not answer and instead started à shouting at me and scolding me in the prescence of my boyfriend.

label: guilt
text: When I went to my room-mate's drawer to see if she had an iron  à which I could use, she came in.  I felt guilty as she may have à thought that I had been stealing.

label: joy
text: When I had my four children.

label: fear
text: When two of my children were critically ill with measles.

label: anger
text: When I got a low grade in an administration course.

label: sadness
text: When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.

label: disgust
text: When my mother betrayed me by obtaining money from my husband à when we were separated - pending divorce.

label: shame
text: When I gave my boyfriend a brush-off.

label: guilt
text: When I beat up my son for having beaten up his sister.

label: joy
text: This happened when I went to check my first year results, I had  à thought that I would fail and I found that I had a clear pass in à all my courses.

label: fear
text: When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed à -rooms.  I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.

label: anger
text: When a friend of mine was trying to make a fool out of me.

label: sadness
text: I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after à we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's à problems.

label: disgust
text: When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime-minister, à Indira Gandhi.

label: shame
text: When I got drunk at a party and made a fool of myself by à vomitting all over the place and insulting the people who were à there with me.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after à having  gone to a disco without permission.

label: joy
text: When I was told that I had passed the exams.

label: fear
text: When a thief broke into my house at night.

label: anger
text: When my sister broke my china tea set.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.

label: disgust
text: I met my best friend's husband with a prostitute.

label: shame
text: When I failed to answer a simple question.

label: guilt
text: My brother wanted money but I refused to give it to him, two days à later he stole it from my father.

label: joy
text: When I learnt that I was selected for form I.

label: fear
text: When I was nearly beaten up by the brother of my girlfriend.

label: anger
text: When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and à looking down on me.

label: sadness
text: When a friend, who has been with me at school, failed to make it à to UNZA.

label: disgust
text: When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested in à me.

label: shame
text: I choked on a cold drink in front of girls who were strangers.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught with my girlfriend in the house at night.

label: joy
text: When I passed the grade 7 exam.

label: fear
text: When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing, à that I had tuberculosis.

label: anger
text: When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in à it and threw it in the dust-bin.

label: sadness
text: This happened when one of my uncles died just whan I was à planning to go and visit him during the next holidays.

label: disgust
text: When I realized that my closest friend had said bad things about à me when I was not around and had betrayed me by making friends à with my boyfriend's other girl.

label: shame
text: When five of my friends at the secondary school found out the bad à things that I had been saying about them.

label: guilt
text: When my mother returned from a holiday, I told her a lie i.e my à father had brought another woman home while she was away.

label: joy
text: The time I qualified to enter secondary school.

label: fear
text: One evening I saw the old guard-man I knew, change into something à inhuman for about 5-10 seconds, this really frightened me.

label: anger
text: When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidently à gave a fake coin at a counter.  I realized this before I handed à over the coin, but the man called me a thief and called a à witness.

label: sadness
text: The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had à been eaten by the neighbour's dogs.  It had been locked out by my à wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.

label: disgust
text: The day I was forced to use a public convenience place in town.  à It was so filthy that it really made me sick.

label: shame
text: My mother caught me stealing some food when I was a young à boy.

label: guilt
text: When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out, it à was killed by the dogs.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I came to know Christ.  That is when I became a à Christian.

label: fear
text: When I broke the window pane of my next door neighbour's house.

label: anger
text: When my brother did not send me the transport money to resume      à my studies in time at UNZA.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my nephew had passed away.

label: disgust
text: When my father thought that I was an unrelaible son.

label: shame
text: When I stole a book in class and the teacher caught me, the rest à of the class laughed at my attempt.

label: guilt
text: When I insulted an elderly person for no reason.

label: joy
text: When my uncle gave me my first year's results.  I opened the à envelope and my eyes ran into two "B+" - in EC110 and M160, this à meant that I had qualified for a major in economics.

label: fear
text: I turned the knob of my granny's two band radio and did not hear à any broadcast,  " What ! Have I broken the knob ? How much does à it cost ? What if the spare part is not available ? "  --I did à not know how to tune a radio.

label: anger
text: I peeped into Maurine's bedroom and saw two people - Maurine anbd à my step-dad.  I thought, " Why did she break her promises ? Why à had she invited me ? Why do old men go for young girls ? "

label: sadness
text: When I missed the chance of becoming a graduate in mining à engineering, after having prayed one week in the church I was à not even selected.

label: disgust
text: I stormed into the room, hoping to cool myself with some soft à music from my three band radio cassette.  There was only young à Kaley there and he explained, " Your aunt has sold it as she à wanted to buy clothes."

label: shame
text: When a lady I was flirting with told all my class-mates that she à was in second year while I was in first year, everyone laughed à and started looking at me.

label: guilt
text: My cousin knocked on the door, looking for me to get her watch à back.  I had given it to my girlfriend, Lizzy, as a present.

label: joy
text: This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposal à and everything went smoothly, just as I had wanted it to.  It was à contrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about her à response.

label: fear
text: It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan, he wanted to grab me à and take me to his kingdom.  He was very repulsive and I have à never seen anything like that before.

label: anger
text: This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my à trousers without my consent.

label: sadness
text: When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7 à and we were about to take the main exam.

label: disgust
text: This was when I saw, for the first time, a naked woman à (prostitute) run away from a house after having been discovered à by the guardian.

label: shame
text: This was when I was discovered stealing a piece of bread at home, à I was very hungry a few hours before supper.

label: guilt
text: When I was afraid to tell my sports teacher at secondary school à that I had not participated in the sports activities the previous à day.

label: joy
text: I was in grade 7.  We had an inter-house volley-ball competition. à  In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored  à the winning goal using my head.  I jumped up with joy and fell à down.

label: fear
text: I was escorting a relative on a bike, we passed by a dark road à with bushas on each side.  Half way down this road, suddenly, we   à saw a white dog appear from one side.  Before we could do à anything, it had vanished and moreover it did not seem to have à any legs.

label: anger
text: The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called  à the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.  à I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining à school to cool off.

label: sadness
text: A close relative was at odds with a very powerful firm.  All his à things had been taken, His dad had died a little before this à event.  He gathhered his children and vowed to give them a good à life with a new start - the words were hollow, he bit back his à tears .....I asked to be excused and then went and cried in the à loo.

label: disgust
text: A pig in the well from which we drink.

label: shame
text: My girlfriend had started going around with another boy.  Her à cousin, also a friend of mine, asked her as to who she preferred. à  Both of us were present and she chose the other guy.

label: guilt
text: I bumped my dad's car in a lamp post.  He was not at home then, à neither was he home when I left for the campus.  I did not tell à him about the accident and I will never tell him.

label: joy
text: I was at school whhen I received a letter from the dean of my à school congratulating me for my performance at the previous à year's exam.

label: fear
text: This was at secondary school, a prefect framed up some case and à took it to the deputy head-master.  I was called by the à head-master and he threatened to suspend me.

label: anger
text: When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my à certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew à nothing about this.

label: sadness
text: My sister was in a hospital, later in the evening we received the à information that she had died.

label: disgust
text: When at school I thought that I was going to get the best results à in mathematics, but it was someone else who got the prize.

label: shame
text: When I received a letter from my girlfriend telling me that she à was engaged to an another man.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I heard the results of my friend, who had à failed.  I wished that I had helped him.

label: joy
text: My being admitted to UNZA.

label: fear
text: While paddling in the river during a storm.  I feared drowning.

label: anger
text: I entrusted a friend with the delivery of some money to my à father, however he misused the money.

label: sadness
text: The loss of my mother.

label: disgust
text: Over an argument.

label: shame
text: At school - being whipped by the teacher in front of the class.

label: guilt
text: When I had sufficient amount of money, I brought more clothes for à myself than for the children - I  felt bad about it.

label: joy
text: My first kiss.

label: fear
text: When I saw a ghost.

label: anger
text: My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.

label: sadness
text: When a friend left me and went back home for good.

label: disgust
text: When I failed an exam.

label: shame
text: Insulted my girlfriend during a peptalk.

label: guilt
text: I caught a close relative with the servant of the house.

label: joy
text: When I passed my form three exams.

label: fear
text: The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (form à four).

label: anger
text: When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talking à behind my back.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of my aunt.

label: disgust
text: When my brother promised me money but he failed to fulfill the à promise.

label: shame
text: I was running in front of a crowd when I slipped and fell on a à wet lawn.

label: guilt
text: When I took drugs.

label: joy
text: As the time to get the results drew near I became more and more à anxious.  My friend called me and said, " You have passed."  My à heart was full of joy.

label: fear
text: I watched a very terrfying film in LT2.  This film really pushed à my heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before the à second reel ended.

label: anger
text: I have been hearing rumours that you have not been allowing à people in your room, he said.  This sentence really shot my à heart.  I failed to find the right words, instead I walked away à without uttering a word.

label: sadness
text: One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my à friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we à stayed indoors.

label: disgust
text: One day I went to town to get my grocery.  On my way back, I took à a mini bus which was full of drunk students.  I felt very à disgusted.

label: shame
text: I had gone to aa bookshop to buy some books.  Somehow, I got very à cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought. à  I lost my temper and screamed at him.  Later I felt very ashamed à at myself as a lot of people I know were there.

label: guilt
text: I remember deceiving my brother, I told him that I was going to à attend the Sunday service, instead I went out to the town with a friend.

label: joy
text: When I heard that a close relative of mine had given birth at a à very young age, in a very remote area and had had very few problems.

label: fear
text: The possibility of having failed the examination.

label: anger
text: When someone chased me from his house.

label: sadness
text: When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a à student like me.

label: disgust
text: When some people, including me, are treated in a way which à equates them to an animal or a thing.

label: shame
text: When someone I know was caught in an "adultery" situation.

label: guilt
text: When I did something wrong in the past and denied having done it à when asked about it later.

label: joy
text: My girlfriend wrote to me telling me that she was four months à pregnant and that I was responsible for the "damages".  This made à me happy as I longed to have a child to call mine.

label: fear
text: The shooting started and we all lay down to protect ourselves à from the flying bullets.  This incident occured on our way to à Feira, during the Zambia army patrols in the Rhodesia war.

label: anger
text: I went to the dining hall and found that the cooks were cleaning à the plates and there was no food for me, and the blue birds  à (security guards) were busy eating the food that was supposed to à be for me.

label: sadness
text: That afternoon I received two messages informing me, one that my à brother was in a coma in the U.T.H suffering (kidney disease) and à two, that my uncle met with an accident on his way to the hospital à  to see my brother.

label: disgust
text: This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and à found him screwing my girlfriend.

label: shame
text: When I walked out of my room with only my pants on and found my à girlfriend and her female friend looking for me outside.

label: guilt
text: My father caught me having sexual intercourse with my closest à cousin.  There was nothing wrong with it but the female was too à old for me.

label: joy
text: When a girl I wanted very much, said "yes" and fell in love with  à me.

label: fear
text: One evening, when I had gone fishing with my friends, we heard à the roar of a lion near by and had to run for our lives.

label: anger
text: When somebody stole my brother's disco machine.

label: sadness
text: When my uncle died.

label: disgust
text: A class-mate answered (accidentally) the call of nature in the à class during a tough mathematics examination.

label: shame
text: I was double crossing my fiancee and one day she caught me red à handed.  She forgave me later.  I was very ashamed of what I had à done.

label: guilt
text: I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for à it, and I was caught red handed.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I discovered that I had passed my first à year examination and was among the thirty students who would à major in economics.

label: fear
text: I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.  I was in à a panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to be à considered for the economics quota.  I cried a lot but that did à not help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.

label: anger
text: I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds were à not in my favour.  My grandfather added fuel to the fire, when I  à had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.

label: sadness
text: It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my à sister had passed away.  The news had been hidden from me, so à that I could take my exams.

label: disgust
text: When I discovered that my mother had been involved in adultery.

label: shame
text: I was caught stealing food at my aunt's place.  I had tried to à hide the food I had taken from the pantry while my aunt was in à the kitchen, however she went to the pantry and discovered the à stolen package.

label: guilt
text: Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I did à not like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to her à dresses.  Eveyone suspected my brother and he had to bear the à consequences.  Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had à done it.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted at UNZA.

label: fear
text: When I heard a lion roar for the first time.

label: anger
text: When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with à our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made à me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.

label: sadness
text: When my beloved grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at the university wanting some of us to travel à from our homes to the lectures here every day.  The way the whole à thing was handled disgusted me.

label: shame
text: When I was leaving home I decided to leave without saying à good-bye to my young brother.  My brother saw me and said,        à " Will you not say good-bye to me?"  He is only 31/2 years old.

label: guilt
text: When I cheated my father about the book allowance at university.  à He discovered that we were given K150 per year for books.

label: joy
text: I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to the à second year.

label: fear
text: When I was going home, I saw somathing which looked like a snake   à on the road but later I found out that it was only a stick.

label: anger
text: This happened recently, I  was in the dining hall and one of my à friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.

label: sadness
text: I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away.  She à was the last of my grand parents to pass away.

label: disgust
text: This happened when I could not get into the school I had à initially wanted, and ended up doing something I had never à thought I would do.

label: shame
text: I insulted the girl to whom I had proposed when she turned me à down.

label: guilt
text: My mother had sent me to buy a few things.  The change I brought à back was not right as I had given away some money to a friend à thinking that she would not notice it.  However, my mother told à me that the change was not correct.

label: joy
text: When my first child was born.

label: fear
text: I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at à a distance of about four metres.

label: anger
text: When my daughter began staying away from classes - at the age of à nine only.

label: sadness
text: When my wife died in hospital, she was pregnant and had undergone à an operation.

label: disgust
text: When my best friend started getting involved in my private à affairs.

label: shame
text: I was very drunk at a certain wedding party and I got involved in à a fight.

label: guilt
text: I send a word to my boss through my servant telling him that I à would not report for work as I was not feeling well and that the   à doctor had refused to give me sick leave.  My intention was à actually to go out of Lusaka for a week-end.  I left the same day à and the following morning my boss found me in Mongu.  I felt à guilty when asked to explain things on my return.

label: joy
text: I received a letter of acceptance from UNZA.

label: fear
text: We were driving at night and I realized that a car was following à us.

label: anger
text: I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.

label: sadness
text: I saw a dead child which was not covered, it had been knocked à down by a car.

label: disgust
text: I saw a friend's husband with another woman.

text: I scolded my sister without waiting for her explanation.

label: guilt
text: I accused my husband of being late deliberately when he came to à pick me up from work.

label: joy
text: When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the à teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.

text: When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and à urine for some other examination, he told me that something bad à would happen to me as he would play magic on me.

text: When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was à occupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full time à student at UNZA.

label: sadness
text: When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away à instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to à wait at his home so that I could see his new car.

label: disgust
text: When I was told that the brother who was staying with me would à not go to the training school that year but only the year after.

label: shame
text: A patient, to whom I had given a powerful medicine, shouted at me à in front of many people.  I realized that he did so because he à was very ill.

label: guilt
text: When I broke up my relationship with my former girlfriend as she à would ask me irrelevant quetions about my past.

label: joy
text: When I received my promotion letter.

label: fear
text: I was sleeping when I heard the neighbours screaming, I peeped à through the window and saw a thief  trying to enter my à neighbour's house.

label: anger
text: I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular à job was not done, it was not my job to do it.

label: sadness
text: My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the  à family.  I felt sad because I thought that if my mother had not à gone away when this brother was younger, things would have been à different.

label: disgust
text: I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly and à attracting everybody's attention.  The worst thing was that she à was discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.

label: shame
text: After a jogging session I had severe abdominal cramps and this à lead to my wanting to empty my bladder.  My friends gathered à around me and two of them had to help me to the toilet.  I was à ashamed at having to go to the toilet in the presence of my à friends.

label: guilt
text: A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept à putting it off.  When I finally made it, I did not see her for à days only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.  I à felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do à what she had requested me to do.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former à secondary school.

label: fear
text: I had gone for a medical check-up at the U.T.H and failed to make à it back on time for the C119 practical sessions at 1400 hours à last academic year.

label: anger
text: When I was mistreated by my step-mother.

label: sadness
text: When my aunt passed away in early 1982.

label: disgust
text: When I failed to secure employment after my form 5 in Lusaka despite à my excellent certificate.

label: shame
text: When I failed my grade 7 exam at the first attempt in 1975.  My à father and the entire family thought that I was finished in life. à  I really felt like hiding.

label: guilt
text: When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school in à my capacity as the deputy head boy.  He had woken up late in the  à morning for manual work.

label: joy
text: When I heard that someone who is very close to me did very well à in the exams despite having fooled around a lot.

label: fear
text: When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had run à in order to get away from him.  We were all alone and all I could à see was this hand coming towards me.

label: anger
text: When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her à boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole à thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend.  He à embarassed me in front of a crowd.

label: sadness
text: When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had à  seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been à waiting to see us.

label: disgust
text: When a boy put a handful of cooked potatoes down my dress and à there was no water to clean up.

label: shame
text: When a soppy poem that I had written to a boy was found and every à one read it and started teasing me about it.

label: guilt
text: When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused à because I wanted to go out with another guy.  I did go out and my à boyfriend found out.

label: joy
text: After a long time (of no communication with him, physical à illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected à to see him.

label: fear
text: Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying à and flapping their wings in the bedroom at night.  It was very à dark and I could not even see my nose.  I did not know that it à was the birds till my mother told me so.

label: anger
text: The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and à make a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by the à prefect who was my class-mate and was very cool and dull.

label: sadness
text: My elder sister scolded me in front of my younger sisters and à cousins.  She said that I was very lazy and I felt so sad that I à cried myself to sleep.

label: disgust
text: On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirt à on, he dansed, spoke nonsense and behaved stupidly.

label: shame
text: When I wet my bed at boarding school.

label: guilt
text: My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get à her on my back, she slipped and fell.

label: joy
text: My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the         à primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.  à Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.

label: fear
text: When I came back from work one day, the friends of my son told me à that he had not come back from school and that he was lost.

label: anger
text: My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I would à find the keys.  I had to spend several hours in my other friend's à room.

label: sadness
text: I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much.  I had not known à that he had been ill for a very time, when I received this à message he was already dead.

label: disgust
text: The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questions à going from a to e for each question.  She asked me to do all this à in one and a half hours.  It involved a lot of describing and à explaining and even though I knew all the answers, I could not à finish the work.

label: shame
text: I forgot that the course instructor had directed us to go for à special classes after the usual class hours.  I missed this the à first day and when he asked me about it the next day I said that à I had forgotten.

label: guilt
text: I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been à spotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front.  à I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into this à neighbour's house.

label: joy
text: When my father bought me a suit.

label: fear
text: After having taken an exam i feared having failed it.

label: anger
text: I was badly beaten up by one of my friends during a wedding à party.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.

label: disgust
text: I was disappointed by a girlfriend when I visited her at her home à in Woodlands.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed at being the only one to have got a C+ in ED120 à assignment.

label: guilt
text: I was caught stealing a box of matches in the supermarket and had à to plead guilty.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.

label: fear
text: When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I à would find here and the kind of behaviour they would have towards à me.

label: anger
text: I had gone home for a week-end and when I came back I found that à my clothes and my bedding had been stolen.

label: sadness
text: When my father passed away.

label: disgust
text: Someone stole a K10 note and the teacher thought that it was me à when I was not responsible for the theft.

label: shame
text: When I failed the grade seven exams.

label: guilt
text: One day my mother went to visit her friends.  When she came back à she scolded me for not having kept the house in order, so I à decided not to talk to her.

label: joy
text: When I saw my family after a separation of one year.

label: fear
text: When my little sister was sick at home and I thought that she à would die.

label: anger
text: When I found out that my sister had been playing with my à confidential things which she had taken from my hand-bag.

label: sadness
text: When one of my best friends commited siucide during these à holidays.

label: disgust
text: I am disgusted at the number of second year students who are à pregnant illegitimately.

label: shame
text: When I got very low marks in one of the assignments.

label: guilt
text: When my aunt went out of her way to help me out with my financial à problems.

label: joy
text: When I fell in love with "X".  Overnight I felt confidence, self-esteem,    à responsible and worthwhile.

label: fear
text: When a thunder belt hit the roof top of the building I was in.

label: anger
text: When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due à at 1400 hours.

label: sadness
text: When my friends died one after the other.  The first died in a à car accident and the second one recently, due to an illness.

label: disgust
text: When my cousin put feaces in my washing.  A silly idea which was à meant to be a joke.

label: shame
text: Getting drunk and creating a lot of trouble at a place I respect à - my friend's home.

label: guilt
text: When I took a small boy's share of choclale.  He was our guest à and so had been given a larger share of the sweets.

label: joy
text: The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for à a B.A at UNZA.  I felt happy because I had not expected to be à selected.

label: fear
text: The day I encountered a queer mamba face to face in a chunk of à leaves behind our house.

label: anger
text: When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship with à certain other friends which they thought was improper.

label: sadness
text: The day my teacher of Latin and French died.

label: disgust
text: The day I went to eat dinner in the dinning hall and found a à dead fly in my gravy.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed of myself the first time I drank as nobody in the à family drinks.  I felt that I had let down my parents and my à friends.

label: guilt
text: The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I received the year end results as I was à worried about how well I had done.  I was very happy to know that I à had passed.

label: fear
text: I was caught doing something I was not supposed to do.  I did à something with the person who caught me (bribe) and even though à he promised not to report me, I am still frightened.

label: anger
text: I told my friend something confidential which was supposed to à remain between the two of us.  The next thing that happened was à that a girl who is not even close to us came laughing and askad à me to tell her about it.  I was very angry with my friend as I à had trusted her.

label: sadness
text: I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every à time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.

label: disgust
text: When thieves broke into our house, I was disgusted by their à behaviour.  They did not find anything so they broke things like à the windows, glasses etc.

label: shame
text: When I bribed the person who caught me doing something I was not à supposed to have done.  I was very ashamed of what I had done.

label: guilt
text: I was caught doing something bad and I bribed the person who à caught me.  Later I felt very bad, maybe I should have paid for à my bad behaviour.

label: joy
text: When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my à registration at UNZA.

label: fear
text: I was a passenger in a vehicle when suddenly another vehicle came à from behind to overtake us.  However another one was coming right à in front so the other vehicle changed course and blocked our way à and so we crashed against the side of the road.

label: anger
text: I was asked to stop studying economics, a field which interested à me, by my employers.

label: sadness
text: When I learnt of the death of a friend.

label: disgust
text: When I learnt that my offer to study at the university had been à withdrawn  and so I would not get hostel accomodation at UNZA, à even though I registered as a student later.

label: shame
text: My love proposal was turned down by a lady I really loved.

label: guilt
text: I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and à asking for money, though I had some money I did not give him à anything.

label: joy
text: When I first came to the campus.

label: fear
text: When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock. à  I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the à gallows.

label: anger
text: When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towards à another friend turned into a quarrel.   I lost my temper and nearly à knocked him out.

label: sadness
text: When I lost my father in a car accident.

label: disgust
text: When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima à with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when a friend, I had always respected, insulted me à in public.  He was drunk.

label: guilt
text: When my library books were overdue and I did not have the money à to pay for them.

label: joy
text: When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had à not expected to do so well.

label: fear
text: When I was an exploration with my friends and almost got lost in à an unfamiliar environment.  It was getting dark and we did not à know how to get back home.

label: anger
text: When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus à holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt à angry over his actions.

label: sadness
text: When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from à what I was told about it.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train, just off à Kafue.  The woman had been cut to bits, there was blood and        à splinters of bone every where.

label: shame
text: When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and à myself.

label: guilt
text: When I "passed out" a female friend of mine for no apparent à reason.  I was under the influence of drugs and when I am like à that I get mad at anyone, however small the provocation.

label: joy
text: When I was accepted at UNZA.

label: fear
text: When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard à gunshots.

label: anger
text: When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.  à A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see à him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a à murder).

label: disgust
text: When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.  It was so à bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized à how bad it was.

label: shame
text: When my friend had a child out of wedlock.

label: guilt
text: When I lied at home.   I told them that I was going to a à Christian meeting and I went to see my boyfriend instead.

label: joy
text: Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.

label: fear
text: When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary à school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.  à The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel à us.

label: anger
text: At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed.  à When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my à inability to find out my enemies.  I lost my temper.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died.

label: disgust
text: My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell face à down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.  Then he à fainted and so I called the first aid.

label: shame
text: As a kid my mother caught me stealing sugar and giving it to a à neighbour.

label: guilt
text: I got into a bad fight in a bar and my friend received a bad cut à above his left eye while trying to separate us.

label: joy
text: I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.  à I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.

label: fear
text: I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and à threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money. à  I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.

label: anger
text: A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to à marry him.  The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not à leave her alone.

label: sadness
text: When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to à rest.

label: disgust
text: When I witnessed an accident.

label: shame
text: When my father found me in bed with a girl, we were deep in actioon à when he entered the room.

label: guilt
text: I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked à if it was me who had taken the money, I denied it.

label: joy
text: When I won some coins in a small competion.

label: fear
text: I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights à were off.  I got inside the gate and just then I realized that à the dogs may be outside.

label: anger
text: My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very à naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.

label: sadness
text: This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was à attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate à woke me up.

label: disgust
text: When I learnt that my cousin sister was pregnant.

label: shame
text: My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drunk like fools à and made a lot of noise.  We had drunk two much of wine.

label: guilt
text: The fridge we had at home had a lock.  One day when I wanted à something, I unscrewed the door but unfortunately I was caught in à the act.

label: joy
text: When I was selected for the university.

label: fear
text: When I saw an accident, a woman was run over and she died on the à spot.

label: anger
text: When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my à wardrobe.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother passed away.

label: disgust
text: While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting à helplessly.

label: shame
text: When I ate my sister's food and then she found out that it was à me.  I felt very ashamed but still refused to admit that it was à me.

label: guilt
text: When I told a person something that had happened to my friend, à and this person went and told my friend.

label: joy
text: When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a à long time.

label: fear
text: When I was told that the form five results were out.

label: anger
text: When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not à know.

label: sadness
text: The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the à Zambia closed badminton championships.

label: disgust
text: When I was taking my girlfriend out, she seemed to have taken à her time.

label: shame
text: When my dad caught me with a honey (girlfriend) in my bedroom.

label: guilt
text: When I beat up a stupid boy who was fond of cracking jokes on me.

label: joy
text: When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.

label: fear
text: When I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would be à forced to marry her or go to court.

label: anger
text: When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given à me.

label: sadness
text: When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation à and they are together now).

label: disgust
text: When I patronized a certain tavern which had prostitutes, it was à almost a brothel.

label: shame
text: When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.

label: guilt
text: When I sided with my mother in a quarrel she had with my father à before they briefly separated.

label: joy
text: When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever à cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to à learn that it was me who was delaying things.

label: fear
text: Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them à would be killed.

label: anger
text: When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.

label: sadness
text: I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead à mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.

label: disgust
text: I feel disgusted at not having got aa "A" in yesterday's à practicals of G220.

label: shame
text: I felt very ashamed at having got a book by force from a girl.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty of having suspected my room-mate of stealing the à money last term.

label: joy
text: Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her à abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our à suprise she had a baby 2 months back.

label: fear
text: My uncle was taken to the UTC for an operation as he had cancer.  à There had been a lot of deaths of late - 3 out of every 4 à operated.  I was scared for my uncle's life.

label: anger
text: I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she à went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It à was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who à had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we à went to town.  I was really angry with my friend.

label: sadness
text: I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school.  I à was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my à friend.  That day I was really sad.

label: disgust
text: I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when my à brother came home he ate it all.  I was really disgusted about it.

label: shame
text: We were at a party, this guy I liked and me.  I really loved him à and gathered enough courage to ask him to kiss me.  He did not do à it but instead asked me what I would like for my birthday.  I à told him that I would like a kiss more than anything else but he à excused himself and said that it was impossible.  I really felt à embarassed.

label: guilt
text: We were at secondary school and I was making a lot of noise.  The à teacher came to ask us as to who was making all the noise.  I did à not own up so the  whole class was punished.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA à was approved after it had been cancelled.

label: fear
text: When I met an elephant in the bush.

label: anger
text: When someone took my pen away.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell à ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.

label: disgust
text: An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to give à me a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.

label: shame
text: I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my à extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to à leave their home.

label: guilt
text: I broke a glass of glycerine at the Z.C.B.C store in Ndola.

label: joy
text: When I was with someone I love.

label: fear
text: When I was walking around all alone at night.

label: anger
text: Being made to look like a fool by a girl.

text: When my dad passed away.

text: Getting very low marks in mathematics.

text: When one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.

label: joy
text: At my sister's wedding.

label: fear
text: When I had to walk along a dark road alone.

text: When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.

label: sadness
text: When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of à Zambia.

label: disgust
text: When I found out that someone close to me was flirting around.

label: shame
text: When I swindled money out of someone.

label: guilt
text: I did not deliver a message on time.

label: joy
text: When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my à lover and future wife.

text: When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be à heard.

label: anger
text: When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.

label: sadness
text: The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my à grade six.

label: disgust
text: When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I à had learnt all the lines.

label: shame
text: When a woman who I respected very much was made pregnant, à unexpectedly by a man of a caliber I never expected.

label: guilt
text: When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later I à thought that I would be found out.

label: joy
text: I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last à born in the family.

label: fear
text: My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I à was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay à unconscious in hospital for two weeks.

label: anger
text: I felt very angry when a mishanga seller robbed me of the à transport money I had to go to school.

label: sadness
text: I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and à she could not be accepted at the institution of learning.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him.  I à had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when my friend and I were cross with each other à till we apologized to each other.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I said bad things to my sister, I had not à intended to do so.  She cried a lot and later she fell ill and I à felt responsible for her illness.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to study here at UNZA.

label: fear
text: In 1960,  I was going to a school which was near my village and I à met a lion on the way, which disappeared suddenly.

label: anger
text: When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.

label: sadness
text: When I heard of the death of my mother.

label: disgust
text: When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them à financially.

label: shame
text: When I failed one of the first year's courses.

label: guilt
text: When I was late for work and told my boss that it was due to à transport problem, whereas the truth was that I had woken up à late.  I thus cheated my boss.

label: joy
text: I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter à to UNZA.  This happened again when I passed all my first year à courses.

label: fear
text: In 1977 when my friend was caught by a crocodile.  We were à swimming in a river on whose banks our primary school was à situated.  When my friend was caught, he was on the banks of the à river and some of us were still in the middle of the river.  I à was very frightened.

label: anger
text: In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating à up his old father.  He claimed that the father was responsible à for his guardian's failure.

label: sadness
text: Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had à passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the         à biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.

label: disgust
text: Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in à a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.  à He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.

label: shame
text: A few years back I had proposed love to a girl who later turned out à to be related to me.  Though we were in love with each other, we à both felt ashamed and withdrew from each other.

label: guilt
text: Last year I was asked to look after my niece while her mother was à cooking.  Unfortunately the kid fell off the bed, I was confident à that she would not fall and had not been paying much attention.

label: joy
text: When I qualified for form I.  I was one of the three pupils who à qualified for form I that year.

label: fear
text: When I learnt that the girl I had impregnated was in hospital and à was on the verge of dying as she had refused to accept the à responsibility of her pregnancy and had wanted to commit suicide.

label: anger
text: When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been à disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few  à days earlier.

label: sadness
text: When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the à death of my father.

label: disgust
text: When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the à rooms were allotted to first year students who were from "Rucher" à and came from influential families.

label: shame

label: guilt
text: When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss à that it was not me who was responsible for the delay.  The boss à was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary à was taken away from him.

text: One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab à his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.

text: This is a kind of confession - my mum found me stealing meat from à the pot.

text: Some people were sitting outside and saying things which were not à really true.

text: An item which belonged to a friend of mine was missing.  I had à taken it earlier and I thought that I had returnrd it so when he à asked me for it I stubbornly refused having it.  Later when I à looked for it, I found it in my room.

text: When I got my results ( I had made it to the second year ).

text: When I had lied, saying that I never take bread from the dinning à hall and a friend of mine caught me doing it.  He thus proved to à me that I did in fact take the bread.

text: When my girl told me that she loved me more than any male à creature on earth and that I would be the only one in her heart à for all her life.

label: fear
text: The day I was nearly stabbed to death by ruffians who wanted to à take my money.  I refused to give them any money and they started à running after me, I ran into somebody else's house to save à myself.

text: When a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which he à had just repaired.

text: When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and à that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange à for the ones I had given her.

text: When a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she had à actually refused me.  When I confronted her she started insulting à me.

text: When I told a lie to a friend of my sister on April fool's day.  à She later came to see me and told me that it was a very foolish à thing to do.

text: A girl dropped some stuff from her bag and when I tried to help à her I realized that she had used me and I was made to look like a à fool.

text: When thieves broke into my house at night and held my wife and me à on gun-point for at least ten minutes and took away a lot of à property.

text: When I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mine à as they thought that I had a lot of money and would not part à with a few coins for their drinks.

text: When I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.  I à depended heavily on them for their guidance and the running of à their daughter's buisness.

text: When my younger sister visited me during the school holidays and à told me that she would not go back to school because she was à pregnant.

text: When I lied to my wife and told her that I was going to the à Copperbelt on a buisness trip, she later found me in a hotel with à a girlfriend.

text: When I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.  I had just à come home from work when my kind sister handed me an enveloppe à which I opened and was overcome with joy.

text: A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was à not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.  à I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.

text: A certain girl asked me what my major was and when I told her à that it was P.A she started criticizing it saying, "I hate that à course."  She just shows off in front of other people.

text: Every time I was around this one person I would stick my foot in à my mouth by being nasty. One time I accidently said something à fairly cruel that was totally inappropriate.

text: Right before I went to a concert with my last boyfriend he told à me that although he told me he was going to take me to the à concert, he didn't want to see me anymore. After that we stayed à overnight and I said "well, when he leaves me I will be ruined à for awhile, but for now we're together." I woke up in his arms à and it was the happiest moment of my life.

label: fear
text: I was river rafting in Nev. and our boat tipped over and I was à sucked under in to some rocks and got stuck and all I could think à was that I was going to die. And it was so quiet under the water à it seemed like no one would care or remember.

label: anger
text: One of my first boyfriends got mad at me because a lot of my à close friends were guys and he didn't want me to see them anymore à because he was jealous.

label: sadness
text: I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I à realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never à see eachother again and none of it mattered.

label: disgust
text: I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was, à and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to à please God. I could never understand how something that brings you à joy could be a sin.

text: My third grade teacher caught me cheating on a spelling test. I à couldn't spell Australia and she said in a loud voice something à like "We don't have cheaters in my class".

text: When I was 5, a few of my friends and I would light matches for à fun. One of my friends confessed to her parents and my parents, I à guess, knew or suspected I was involved but I said I knew à nothing about it.

text: I felt extreme joy the day I was baptized. I was one with God.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when my friend and I broke into an abandoned military à base in Los Angeles this summer. I feared because I didn't want à to be caught.

label: anger
text: I experienced anger most recently when I had committed a sin à which I had gone a week and a half without doing. I had made a à vow to God and had blown it. Now I had to start all over.

label: sadness
text: I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all my à long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.

label: disgust
text: When I committed a sin mentioned in ANGER. A sin of sexual à immorality.

label: shame
text: When I just took a shower with a girl down the hall. I felt that à I had let my devotion to God go out the window. Although nothig à happened I felt ashamed.

text: When I committed the sin of immorality mentioned before.

label: joy
text: Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.

label: anger
text: A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left à some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My à uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that à we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.

label: sadness
text: When I took the B.A exams,I was expecting a 1st class even though à I had not done very well. When the results came out I felt sad as à I had missed the 1st class by 12 marks.

text: A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she does à not like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to me à by this same friend of mine.  I would like to be friends with à both of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive and à would like me to be close only to her.

label: shame
text: A friend of mine had said something about not liking to come to à my place just before coming to my place.   In the meanwhile I got à to learn about this from another friend of mine and when she à arrived at my place I really treated her badly.  I was later à ashamed of the way I had treated someone when the person was at à my place.

label: guilt
text: A few days back my mother was not feeling too well and still did à all the house work.  I felt guilty as I had not offered to help.

label: joy
text: When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry on à my studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.

text: [ I have not felt this emotion.]

text: During a class I was asked a question which I did not hear very à clearly, so I gave an answer which was not related to the à question and everyone started laughing at me.

text: When last year in college I received the award "Best Student of the Year", à   I felt very happy as I got what I had wanted and my wish had à been fulfilled.à

text: Once I was caught by thugs aged between 20-35, they asked me to à surrender all the property I had and I remember feeling very scared.

At my father's refusal he à abused my father, my brother and I could not control our temper à and we rushed at him.

text: Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very à controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed à with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So à I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally, I felt very à sad about this.

label: disgust
text: After joining my M.A in Social Sciences, I appeared for the first à semester exam.  I failed one of the exams, and when I looked at à my results I felt disgusted and then I got angry.

text: [ Never felt the emotion.]

text: I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my à birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.

text: I tried my level best to care for my client, I took an à appointment with a doctor and before meeting the doctor he à expired - a poor small boy from Uttar Pradesh.

text: I had known the girl for a few months when I proposed to her and this à put an end to our friendship, as from then on we started à withdrawing from each other.  I liked her very much.

text: When my room-mate locked up the keys of my room in our room after à I had told her that I was  only in the bathroom having a shower. à  She left and I had to do without supper.

text: During the last academic year i.e 1983/1984 just before the à closure, we were surrounded and threatened by the paramilitary à forces.

text: A few monthe ago, when my brother's wife told me that I had bad à manners.  To make matters worse she did not let me use their à telephone as she only allowed people of her own tribe.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted to discover that my girlfriend of few weeks was à already fooling around with another guy.  I was disappointed as à the guy was a rogue and I respected my girlfriend.

text: I was saying bad things about a man I had never seen.  I was à with a friend and did not know that she was related to this man.  à My friend did not tell me about it and I discovered this myself.

label: guilt
text: A very, very close friend of mine used to come to my room to      à see me and I naver bothered to pay him a visit.  One day he asked à me the reason behind this and I gave him a shirt.

label: joy
text: When I received the first year results as the first year had à involved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got the à results.

label: fear

label: anger
text: When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I à was stopped from punching him for it.

label: sadness
text: When I heard the news that my brother had passed away.  It was à the first time that I lost a brother.

label: disgust
text: When a student accused me of having stolen his textbook  as he à had found a form bearing my name in his other books and all my à explanations fell on deaf ears.

label: shame
text: When my first sexual intercourse turned out to be a flop.  I was à in a panic and ended up without an erection.

label: guilt
text: When my mother found me in her bedroom "stealing" sugar in her à bedroom.  According to our customs there comes a stage when a à child stops using the parents bedroom and I was well past that à age.

label: joy
text: The computer at school had left out my name along with four à others and I had no rights for one year.  So I was happy to find à my name on the medical schhol list.

label: fear
text: We were driving on a very dusty road at night and the driver à tried to overtake a very big truck only to find another big truck à parked right in front.

label: anger
text: I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving à me any thing - money to come back to school.

label: sadness
text: I remember being sad whe my aunt's child died (2 days old).

label: disgust
text: I was eating in the dinning hall and some women joined me.  I à could not eat with them so I left the dinning hall.

label: shame
text: I was about to share lunch with my aunt's husband when she told à me that I would have to wait and eat with my cousins.

label: guilt
text: When my friends and I were caught with our girlfriends outside à the school grounds when I was at the secondary school.  We were à caught by the headmaster.

label: joy
text: I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, no à visitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a card à and some pocket money for me; and she told me that she was à working now.

label: fear
text: A friend gave me a lift and we met a road-block.  He tried  to à turn back when an officer shouted at us to stop.  My friend took a à turn suddenly and the officer raised his gun but by the time we à were gone.

label: anger
text: I had worked very hard during my vacations to raise some money à for a few major items (e.g a radio).  but when I arrived at the à inter-city bus terminal, my hard earned money had been stolen à from me.

label: sadness
text: My younger brother and sister were involved in an accident on à their way back from school and my brother was quite badly hurt.

label: disgust
text: I went to the shopping centre to buy something and saw packets of à Kapenta  with maggots in them. Oh !

label: shame
text: I had a misunderstanding with my father and after some time I à found that I had been wrong.

label: guilt
text: A very close friend of mine invited me to spend the holidays with à him.  He was very kind, good and understanding.  However it à turned out that he had two of his cousins at his place.  He, à however gave me everything I needed - even transport money.

label: joy
text: When my girl and I decided to get back together after our à separation.

label: fear
text: I was so sick that my relatives thought that I was bewitched.  I à felt like dying.

text: When my girlfriend left me to go out with another guy, even à though she knew that she was wrong.

text: When my girl went away for a holiday without saying good-bye to à me.

text: I was trying to have sex with my best friend's girl but she did à not agree to it.

text: I was in love with a very beautiful girl and when I went back for à my holidays I found her wth another guy who she said was just a à friend.  Later I found them together and was convinced that there à was something fishy.

text: Achieving my goal at a swim meet. I worked toward the goal for 9 à yrs. I was capable of achieving it, but I didn't know when.

text: Housesitting and hearing the alarm go off. I knew someone had to à be breaking in. I called the police and was panicking while on à the phone. It was awful. It turns out that I stepped on the à hidden alarm without prior knowledge of its existance.

text: Going to Cowell Hospital and finding out tediously that I had a à stress fracture. The anger came when the senile doctors found out à 4 weeks later that I had 2 stress fractures in one foot and à should have had crutches. I was in distinct pain and barely could à walk to classes. They said it would be better in 2 weeks.

label: sadness
text: Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally and à cried for 6 hours off and on. I wanted to hide away and did for a à few days.

label: disgust
text: Seeing a friend "making love" to a high school girl. I à accidentally was dragged into this room where the happenings had à occurred. I was disgusted at the reality.

label: shame
text: I borrowed a gold bracelet without the girl's knowledge. I had it à for so long I had to keep it. To this day I feel ashamed at à myself for having it. I never wear the thing anymore.

label: guilt
text: After moving out of my apt. I took all the furniture and dishes à and everything. It was mine but I took it all just to spite my à roomies. We had a few (a lot) of disagreements. I felt guilt for à moving out for the bad reasons.

label: joy
text: It was the weekend of my homecoming. I saw my sister for the à first time in 3 months. She's my best friend and extremely close.

label: fear
text: After my shoulder operation, I woke up in the hospital room à alone. I was in pain and was still under heavy medications. I à could not find my parents.

label: anger
text: When I found out my cousin had been killed. I was angry at the à world, and her murderer who was her ex-boyfriend. It was the worst à and most hateful day of my life.

label: sadness
text: I spent a weekend in San Diego visiting my boyfriend Rob. We were à at the airport and my plane was just about so leave. After saying à goodbye, I boarded the plane. It was the hardest thing to do and à it was a sad trip home.

label: disgust
text: I was supposed to be studying for my math midterm a few days ago, à however, I fooled around with my roommate, and didn't start à studying until 12:00 am. I was disgusted with myself.

label: shame
text: Since I've been here I haven't written to any of my relatives. I got à a letter from my mom telling me how upset my grandparents are à from not hearing from me.

label: joy
text: I got an A in anatomy - the first one I have ever gotten in a à science class here.

label: fear
text: A man in a car was following me when I went running early one à morning in a fairly secluded area.

label: anger
text: I caught a "peeping tom" at my window when I was getting à undressed.

label: sadness
text: Saying goodbye at the airport to my boyfriend who has to go to à school back East. We are very close and have been together 4 à years.

label: disgust
text: My parents claimed me on their income tax after I had been out of à the house for two years receiving no financial support from them. à As result I had to work more during school because they were à expected by the FAO to contribute to my education when they à refuse to do so.

label: shame
text: I was wearing a short skirt one day and someone told me my à underwear was showing.

label: guilt
text: Getting a D in a class last semester and knowing it was because I à didn't study.

label: joy
text: Went to a movie with a date, walked on the beach (in Alameda) à spent some time afterwards in her apt.

label: fear
text: At age 10 my foster grandmother died, I had a fear of dying.

label: anger
text: I am currently taking CS 50P. I had to finish a couple of à assignments but I was hindered because I could not get a passing à score on my program.

text: While studying chemistry with a friend we became angry with à eachother because we were both fed up.

text: I received a letter from my grandmother. She has obviusly à suffered a lot from my grandfather's suffering health. She à mentioned things she had gotten him and he would never use.

label: disgust
text: One of my good friends told people something I had told her à in confidence about someone else.

text: I wanted my boyfriend to stay when he didn't. He stayed but when à he left I felt ashamed because I should have let him leave when à he wanted. I was too selfish.

text: Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous à when my school's team won the conference championship last year.

text: I was driving on to a busy freeway during rush hour and it was à slightly raining. A diesel truck was coming very close behind me à and I was close behind a pick-up. I changed lanes and barely hit à the truck and ran a Honda of the road. I was scared to death to à go back and see if I caused him to crash.

label: shame

label: guilt

label: disgust

text: I went to go get a bike innertube fixed. I fixed it and I was à supposed to pay previously but I didn't. I said I would after I à fixed the tire. label: joy
text: I had met someone and we became good friends. Our relationship à grew closer and now he is my boyfriend. I felt joy when I found à out how he felt about me.

text: I feared that my dog's eye was infected too much. He had played à around in the weeds and a foxtail had gotten under his eyelid. I à took him to the vet and I feared that he may go blind because of à the foxtail.

text: One of my friends kept criticizing me about everything I did. I à thought she was kidding, but later I found out that she was à serious.
