text: When a classmate hit me on my occipital region when I was busy à studying and concentrating on my classnotes.

label: sadness
text: When my father died.

label: disgust
text: When somebody made me touch human faeces.

label: shame
text: Soiled my short trousers with faeces.

label: guilt
text: When a crawling child got burnt because of my negligence to keep à the child away from the fire.

label: joy
text: When I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had been à successful in an interview for admittance for a medical Assistant à training course. I was really happy and I enjoyed myself by à dancing to music from the Radio cassette.

label: fear
text: One time I was injured when I was playing football at School in à Blantyre. I was brought to the hospital while my leg was totally à swollen. The x-rays confirmed there was no fracture but à collection of blood n the muscles. I feared when they started to à incise the swollen part with surgical blade.

label: anger
text: One day I was really angry when all my food was eaten by a dog. à My anger was against my mother because she was careless. She à didn't keep the food in a hidden and proper place.

label: sadness
text: One day I came across a certain boy who was intruding my à friendship as lovers with my girlfriend and I was very sad à because I didn't expect that girl to disappoint me I regarded her à as being very faithful.

label: disgust
text: One time at the hospital I passed near the intensive care room. à The offensive smell that came out disgusted me in such a way that à I didn't even dare to enter the room.

label: shame
text: At one occasion I was ashamed of being refused after a proposal à for a friendship with a certain girl. I was ashamed because she à refused publically in the presence of my fellow friends.

label: guilt
text: I once stole my father's money and denied having done it. Instead à father threatened my young brother and he was beaten. He was à innocent and I felt guilty.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary School à out of the 100 pupils I was among the 4 who were successful. à Family History showed that I had done better than all my brothers à who had passed after repeating for several times.

label: fear
text: We went fishing some 5 or 8 kilometers off the shore of Lake à Malawi. Before we could settle down the lake became very rough to à the point of threatening our lives.

label: anger
text: I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. He à was trying to use a short-cut method in getting his supper. à Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I was à retreating from a hungry congested people I knocked his plate à with my head. He didn't accept being wrong but blamed me for à pouring his soup.

label: sadness
text: I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football à match a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I was à disappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.

label: disgust
text: I was dancing Malipenga (traditional dance). I exaggerated the à steps I was supposed to make in the negative way. This happened in à front of spectators. It was bad for our Boma (group) because I à was on the front line where ability is displayed and it is this à ability that counts when choosing the winning side.

label: shame
text: News was spread that I had been found doing sexual intercourse à with a small girl. At first this annoyed me but later on I became à ashamed because many people seemed to believe it.

label: guilt
text: I argued with my father on matters concerning marriage. à Traditionally speaking, I was not supposed to, so I felt guilty à of violating my traditions which I must hold in esteem.

label: joy
text: I passed my MCE Examination. at first I was worried but when I à heard my name I had joy in my heart and I arranged for a trip to à attend a wedding ceremony.

label: fear
text: I was studying in class at night. I was in Form II by then. There à were rumours about an earthquake. That night dogs were chasing à one another and passed through the window outside the classroom. à Those who saw the dogs thought it was a lion and were terrified. à Trying to run away the desks were dragged and there was a shaking à movement. I thought it was an earthquake and jumped out of the à window.

label: anger
text: Someone told a lie that I had stolen his money.

label: sadness
text: My Uncle was beaten by his troublesome son. He fell unconscious à and gained consciousness after some time. That time I was at à school; this news reached me through someone.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust when I received visitors at an odd hour. I was à seriously preparing for Examinations, so I did not appreciate à their coming.

label: shame
text: I answered a certain question from Dr. Maqgda wrongly. She asked à something about Femur and my answer was saying something à concerning the brain. So I was very ashamed amongst my friends.

label: guilt
text: I wrote a bad letter to someone concerning our relationship which à we created ourselves.

label: joy
text: I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love to à her and at the same time she accepted my proposal.

label: fear
text: My father gave me money for school fees and I didn't pay school à fees instead I spent it on beer and did not tell him about this.

label: anger
text: There was a cup final match between Limbe Leaf Wanderers and à Silver Strikers and someone promised to give me some money for à admission fee to watch this game. Unfortunately he did not give à me.

label: sadness
text: I had received bad news informing me that grandmother and à grandfather had passed away. The first one to die was my à grandmother and after two days grandfather died too.

label: disgust
text: It happened that one of my best friends just took my shirt à without my knowledge, I hadn't put it on for many days and I was à short of clothes.

label: shame
text: I had high-heeled shoes one time, but a certain girl who saw the à shoes told me that they were out of fashion and I looked as an à old man when I was in those shoes.

label: guilt
text: I happened to have met one of my teachers in town during working à hours. The badness was I didn't ask for permission to go out and à I was guilty-conscious.

label: joy
text: Passing a very difficult examination which I didn't expect - MCE.

label: fear
text: As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid it à might bite me.

label: anger
text: Brother took my money to use for his own purposes.

label: sadness
text: After hearing the news about the death of my sister, I felt very à sad.

label: disgust
text: After buying a ticket, I lost it before I reached my destination à and the bus Inspector dropped me at a place I didn't know.

label: shame
text: I was very much ashamed after a friend beat me at school and I à was defeated.

label: guilt
text: I hit my cousin badly after she threw away my dresses in a à pit-latrine that the little girl fainted.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to a University College of Nursing.

label: fear
text: When one of my relatives went out at night leaving me and my à friend alone, I cheated my parents that she didn't go out, after à they had heard that she was out, I was afraid that she might have à beaten me.

label: anger
text: When someone took my writing materials yet I was to write à Examinations in a few minutes.

label: sadness
text: When I failed my Standard 8 Examination for the first time.

label: disgust
text: When a boy whom I refused to be my lover told all his friends à that I was his girl he has refused me because I was not faithful à to him.

label: shame
text: When someone pointed out that I was proud, yet I didn't dress up à properly. This was when I and my friend went for a dnce one à Saturday.

label: guilt
text: After I had cheated my parents that I had lost my textbooks so à they had to send me money.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I heard my name being called on the radio as one à of the students who had passed the interview of Nursing and was à selected to start Nursing.

label: fear
text: I felt fear when one night my aunt and Uncle left me alone at à their house to look after the baby when they went to a party.

label: anger
text: I felt angry at one time when I was chatting with friends and à suddenly another friend joined us and started opposing any à comment I added to our chatting.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when a thief stole all the clothes from my friend's à cupboard at school (boarding).

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when I was not given money for lunch at school à by my father as a punishment for beating my little brother.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I was asked by my cousin that I promised to buy à her a birthday present but I didn't buy it for her in front of à friends.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt when my friends were punished to slash grass at the à gound because of making noise in class. I was in the group of à noise-makers but I denied having done any noise.

label: joy
text: When I passed my MSCE Exams and was selected to go to college.

label: fear
text: I was with my boyfriend forgetting that I had left the house à unlocked. Unfortunatly a thief came and stole all the kitchen à utensils. Thereafter I was afraid of the consequences.

label: anger
text: My best friend started moving out with my boyfriend. When I heard à this my heart sank because I didn't expect that my own good à friend could do such a thing, so I got angry.

label: sadness
text: I was sad when I heard that my cousin died because of being à bewitched by her husband's second wife.

label: disgust
text: My friend promised to take me out for a movie but he didn't turn à up.

label: shame
text: I met a woman who was looking for our house. She stopped me but I à ran away. When I arrived at home I found the same woman and she à told my parents what had happened so I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I went to my boyfrien's house. There I found clothes of a certain à girl. Without asking whose clothes they were I started tearing à them only to realise that they were his sister's and so I felt à guilty.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to come here.

label: fear
text: Somebody told her friend that she would hit me wherever we would à meet.

label: anger
text: This was when my boyfriend told me that I was double-crossing him à with a certain boy.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my friend had started drinking beer.

label: disgust
text: I went to a party and there were some cakes which weren't good à and had a bad smell.

label: shame
text: One day I was supposed to go to a movie with my boyfriend. In the à morning I went to see my Auntie and I didn't come back up to à evening.

label: guilt
text: I slapped my sister's daughter and after several hours, she had a à high temperature and she ended up being admitted in hospital.

label: joy
text: When the church choir came one Sunday after being away for some à weeks.

label: fear
text: When I came home late one day. I was afraid I would be shouted at à by my parents.

label: anger
text: When a little brother of mine damaged a cassette.

label: sadness
text: I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes à came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents à attention by talking to them.

label: disgust
text: I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an        à operation.

label: shame
text: When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked à quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.

label: guilt
text: [ No description.]

label: joy
text: When I had my first boyfriend.

label: fear
text: I and my cousin went to a filmshow at night. We went without à making it known to my mother. While we were there at interval, I à came across my mother just close to where we sat.

label: anger
text: During the Xmas holiday, I and my best friend at Secondary School à had planned to meet at a Cultural afternoon at the Mt. Soche à Hotel after missing each other for such a long time. When I asked à my mother for permission, she told me not to go for no good à reason. I felt very angry with her.

label: sadness
text: When I was transferred from Chichiri Secondary School to St. à Mary's Sec. School. I was happy at Chichiri as a day scholer and à had made a lot of friends. I was going to a boarding and that à meant parting with my friends as well as my boyfriend for the à first time.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when my cousin decided that she would stop à going to school saying she wanted to get married. She was only 14 à years by then and she didn't understand what she was thinking.

label: shame
text: When I failed my Primary school leaving Examinations. I never à thought I would fail. When I heard I had failed I really felt à ashamed of myself.

label: guilt
text: One time I felt guilty when I told one of my previous boyfriends à we were through just because I never felt like having one at that à particular time.

label: joy
text: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected for a à University course.

label: fear
text: Sometime back, my boyfriend and I were having a walk nearby my à parent's house. Suddenly we met my grandfather and I was à afraid that he would report to my parents.

label: anger
text: One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and à took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and à used it for her business without my knowledge.

label: sadness
text: It was shocking news to me when I received a telegram from home à telling me that my grandmother had passed away. I had to go home to attend à the funeral but unfortunately I found that the burial had already à taken place.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted with my brother's behaviour when he kept throwing à things away because of his anger, after mum had shouted at him.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed with my biology lecturer when he asked me a à question and I could not answer it.

label: guilt
text: One day I was chatting with children at home. Then I took a lump à of soap and gave to one of them pretending that it was a sweet. I à thought the child would realise that it was not. Unfortunately he à did not and he put it in his mouth.

label: joy
text: I wrote a difficult Exam at one time while in my Secodary School. à When the results were announced on the radio, I came second out à of 80 students hence I felt joy.

label: fear
text: When the week for Exams came. I got afraid as to how I would à tackle the questions.

label: anger
text: Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and à difficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.

label: sadness
text: I experienced this emotion when my grandfather passed away.

label: disgust
text: In my village there was this tax collector who used to cheat à people and collected more than was wanted, the surplus was for à his family and himself.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed when my lecturer said in class that I à happened to be the dullest of all.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I was found to be the chief leader of making à noise in class.

label: joy
text: When I received a beautiful birthday gift form my parents.

label: fear
text: When I was called for an Interview at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

label: anger
text: When I damaged my wristwatch which I liked very much.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away.

label: disgust
text: When my fellow classmates were involved in a quarrel.

label: shame
text: When I failed Psychology examination when most of the students à passed.

label: guilt
text: When I promised to visit my boyfriend and I didn't fulfil the à promise.

label: joy
text: I had stayed for months without seeing mother because our à holidays were short and my home is far. Some times, mother came to à see me at school, I was very joyful, and I didn't want her to go.

label: fear
text: One day during our clinical practices, we had a very ill patient. à Unfortunately the patient passed away. I had seen him dying and à it was the first experience. During the night I became afraid à fearing the dead body.

label: anger
text: It was during the beginning of the term. I had K100 and kept it à in my handbag. I left the handbag in the wardrobe but didn't à lock it. Next time I found that K30 were stolen.

label: sadness
text: My best friend had failed Exams. She had to leave and so we got à separated.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when my appointment to meet the E.N.T. à specialist had been turned down. The specialist came from U.K. à and went the same day and we do not have one.

label: shame
text: I had been telling lies and people discovered instantly that I à was telling lies. I felt very shameful and I felt like à disappearing from people.

label: guilt
text: I had spent the weekend visiting relatives and friends and didn't à study for Anatomy class on Monday.

label: joy
text: I had an interview for entry into college. The results were to be à announced on radio. After a long period of waiting the results à were released. I had succeded - tension was relieved by joy.

label: fear
text: When I stepped on a snake at home, it was dark but there was à moonlight.

label: anger
text: I went to a fair where a guy who was drunk kept bothering me and à in the end I got really angry.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic à accident.

label: disgust
text: I went to a party with my boyfriend who got so drunk and started à vomiting. It was so disgusting.

label: shame
text: We were writing Primary school leaving Examinations when I had à fallen at the steps going into the Exam room.

label: guilt
text: I was keeping a friend's Library book which went overdue. My à friend was charged for the delay in returning the book to the à Library. I felt guilty when I realised I was responsible.

label: joy
text: I was given a gift by my sister. There were many pleasant things à in this parcel.

label: fear
text: I was alone walking in a deserted part of the city and I had some à fear that some men would attack me and rob me.

label: anger
text: I wrote an Exam and happened to have not done as well as I à thought I would. I was angry to myself for not having done so à well.

label: sadness
text: I lost my purse that had money in it. I was sad until I found it.

label: disgust
text: I received a letter which was too strong for me. It said I had à done something which I really didn't do.

label: shame
text: A friend of mine was shouting at me in a group of juniors.

label: guilt
text: Before going to school I usually take something to eat right at à school and this time I took Father's money without him knowing à it. I felt guilty and I returned the money.

label: joy
text: The day I was told that I had passed my Malawi School leaving à Exams and I was selected to go to college.

label: fear
text: When I was travelling home by bus and suddenly the bus hit and à the bus leaned against a wall.

label: anger
text: I was angry when someone stole a magazine which I had borrowed à from another friend and locked it in a drawer.

label: sadness
text: When my best friend promised to come at my house and I had to à prepare so many expensive things for her but only to learn at à last that she would not turn up.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted one day when, as we were eating, a child à defecated on the table side.

label: shame
text: I felt ashamed one day when my teacher shouted at me in the à presence of my boyfriend.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty one day when I stole a slice of bread in a à cafeteria.

label: joy
text: When I had passed MCE examinations.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my boyfriend came home because my parents à disapproved him of his coming home. I thought they would chase me à out of the house.

label: anger
text: I was angry when my friends said that I should not receive à Nursing Science books because there was a rumour that I was à intending to leave the college.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away.

label: disgust
text: When I was a child I broke plates because I wasn't given food on à the grounds of coming home late.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed of being laughed at by my colleagues when I failed à to answer a question in the classroom.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty after stealing a cookery book from my colleagues.

label: joy
text: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected to à come here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

label: fear
text: I was afraid to walk through the forest one day when I dropped à off the bus around 6.30 pm.

label: anger
text: I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when my father was sick.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when somebody told me that my previous boyfriend à was her boyfriend.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when my boyfriend went to sit with another girl à when he invited me to come to watch Drama festival.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt to have come back from home without seeing my father. à When I went home he was at work.

label: joy
text: The time I learnt that I had passed my Malawi School leaving à Certificate Examinations.

label: fear
text: Afraid of a dead body.

label: anger
text: A tailor ran away with my skirt.

label: sadness
text: Cooks refused to give me food.

label: disgust
text: I saw a septic, smelling wound.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when I was being introduced to the church à congregation.

label: guilt
text: I cheated my boyfriend.

label: joy
text: A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.

label: fear
text: I was playing with friends then I decided to splash some sand à into a car which was moving nearby. The driver got angry and came à to report to my parents.

label: anger
text: Sometime back another girl who was in terms with my ex-boyfriend à came to shout at me at twelve midnight. It was because she à thought I was still interested in the boy.

label: sadness
text: In May 18th, 1984 my boyfriend went to the U.S.A. In December I à was told he passed away. He had cancer of the Oesophagus.

label: disgust
text: One day I was walking with my boyfriend. We met my ex-boyfriend à and out of jealousy he started calling me names.

label: shame
text: My father who is very quiet discovered I was going out with a à coloured boy. He called me names and was really upset.

label: guilt
text: I was at a boarding school during my primary school days. I was à broken so I pretended I was very sick. My father came and he à picked me up. He spent a lot of money on medical expenses which à all proved to be negative.

label: joy
text: When I passed standard 8 exams I jumped, rolled over the ground.

label: fear
text: I felt so afraid when dad fell ill, he had never suffered from à that disease since and I had never seen him as he was.

label: anger
text: I was furious when the teacher pointed out in class that I à was the quietest girl in class.

label: sadness
text: It was extremely sad to me when I heard that a patient who I was à taking care of in hospital had passed away. He had some abdominal à pains.

label: disgust
text: I felt this situation when a certain woman from a close village à shouted at my mother because she didn't get what she wanted, she à wanted some salt to put in her relish.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when I got the lowest result (mark) in class. All à the same I didn't worry too much because I knew I would have got à much better if I had read enough.

label: guilt
text: At one time while at primary school I lost a pencil case of a à friend and I didn't mention it to her until after a fortnight.

label: joy
text: The time I first saw my cousin who is living in Tanzania.

label: shame
text: I failed my Nutrition paper which was the paper ending the à course.

label: guilt
text: When a patient in the ward died (one who had been under my care). à I felt as if I didn't give the appropriate care to the patient.

label: joy
text: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had passed my Secondary à school leaving certificate exam.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my mother left me alone to live in our house à for one month.

label: anger
text: I was angry when my boyfriend did not turn up as promised.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I heard that my uncle had passed away à untimely at home.

label: disgust
text: One day my friend told me that she had heard that I was moving à about with her boyfriend. I was disgusted with the news.

label: shame
text: I was walking one day and I met a man who wanted to ask me about à my brother but I didn't stop to hear what he was saying. I was à ashamed when I found him at home and he told my brother what had à happened.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I tore a photograph I found at my boyfriend's à place only to realise that it was his sister who was on the à photograph.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend came form Rumphi to Lilongwe for a visit I was à very happy to see him and couldn't believe it was him with me.

label: fear
text: When I dream of anything terrifying I used to have fear for the à rest of the day that the dream might come true e.g., being beaten à (or eaten ?) by a snake.

label: anger
text: I had been in love with a certain young man who pretended to love à me but one day I found out that he had another girlfriend who was à also a friend of mine.

label: sadness
text: I wrote a letter to my boyfriend but he couldn't answer it in à time so as a defence mechanism I just found that I felt so sad à about it and couldn't talk to anyone.

label: disgust
text: Once I offended a friend, instead of her coming to me to ask and à discuss the matter she was just telling other people about it and à say all she could about me.

label: shame
text: I was once chatting with friends. Then some boys came and joined à us. These boys took all my 3 friends away and I was left alone in à shame without knowing where to go from there.

label: guilt
text: One day I found an incontinent man in the ward. This patient had a à guardian who couldn't give him a bath. So I just left him like that à but felt guilty until I went back to give him a bath.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and I à was ready to enter 2nd year because I felt I had failed as they were à very hard.

label: fear
text: I broke a window of a neighbouring house and I feared my mother's à judgement and action on what I had done.

label: anger
text: The headmistress at a secondary school accused me of banging the à classroom door when I didn't in front of the whole class.

label: sadness
text: I received a message that my elder brother was involved in a car à accident and was admitted in hospital.

label: disgust
text: The carterer refused to give me sugar to add to my tea saying à that there was no sugar whilst it was there, so I left the cafe à disgusted without taking the tea.

label: shame
text: I insulted my friend for a small reason and after time I realised à that I was wrong and felt ashamed; everytime I meet her I feel à ashamed.

label: guilt
text: My patient died of Anaemia while I was organising blood à transfusion for him, so I felt guilty, because I thought that may à be I was slow.

label: joy
text: When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.

label: fear
text: When a thief entered the house in which I was sleeping.

label: anger
text: When my dress was stolen.

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother died after a long illness.

label: disgust
text: When I boarded Yanu Yanu bus I sat near a man who was smoking à tobacco.

label: shame
text: When I refused to fetch water for my aunty while she was busy.

label: guilt
text: When I hit my young sister without a valid reason.

label: joy
text: I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8 à exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated my à birthday.

label: fear
text: I was in the house at night and I heard a hyena crying outside. à It cried for almost an hour and I feared it might break the à window and enter inside the house.

label: anger
text: I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many à bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the à girls who did him wrong.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I heard that my Auntie had passed away.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted the other day I was told to take off the dog's à faeces around the house since they smelled bad I did the job but à in the end I felt disgusted.

label: shame
text: I was very ashamed when I failed a test in Standard 7. The à teacher told the other students to shout and laugh at me.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty because I stole some sweets from my father's à grocery. When he asked me who stole the sweets I told him it was à my brother who stole the sweets and he was scolded.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed my MCE Exam, I spent the whole à day dancing and eating sugarcanes from our garden.

label: fear
text: When I heard that my father had found a letter from my boyfriend à and he was calling me to talk about it.

label: anger
text: When a certain boy went about saying that I am his girlfriend. I à wrote him an insulting letter to him and called him names.

label: sadness
text: When I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat for à a week and was only crying. I could not find the courage to go to à bath.

label: disgust
text: When a boy I hated most in our classroom took my T Jersey from my à desk and put it on.

label: shame
text: When I wet my head (or bed ?) one day my sister discovered it and reported à it to the other siblings. So my mother had to scold me.

label: guilt
text: When I insulted my young sister for a very little misconduct of à putting on my shoes. She wrote me an apology letter and the à message she included made me feel guilty.

label: joy
text: It was in 1983 September when MCE results were being announced on à the radio. When I heard my name that I had done well I just kept à quiet. I was so happy that I couldn't even talk.

label: fear
text: I was on my way home when suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from the à bush and blocked the road. I was in fear and didn't know what to à do.

label: anger
text: A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was married à here, when I am here at school. When I went home for holidays my à parents asked me about it and I was angry with that man.

label: sadness
text: When I went home on holidays I found that my niece and nephew had à passed away I was very sad for the children were not even sick à before death but suddenly died.

label: disgust
text: I met a certain lady at the bus depot who was using a bad à language but was a very smart looking lady.

label: shame
text: I wore a dirty dress a certain day I was going to town I met an à old friend who made a comment about my dress so I felt ashamed.

label: guilt
text: One day I shouted at my brother who didn't do any wrong to me à only that I had a disappointment from a friend and projected it à on to him. He cried and I felt guilty after sometime.

label: joy
text: I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil) à from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I became à No 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.

label: fear
text: I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the car à broke down, so my other sister said I had to walk alone from à Ndirande to Chirimba at around midnight. So we reached home at à 1 am. I was afraid of robbers and dardness.

label: anger
text: I was angry the other day because the teacher told me to sweep à some orange peels. It was my friends who were supposed to sweep, à but the teacher told me to do it.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I heard that my brother had failed the à standard 8 exams for the third time.

label: disgust
text: I was very disgusted the first day I went to put a dead body in à the Mortuary. There were many dead bodies and some were uncovered à so we had to put on top of the other bodies.

label: shame
text: I was really shameful when my mother beat me in the presence of à my friends because I didn't cook lunch up until 2 o'clock.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty the other day because I took two pieces of bread à instead of one in the Cafeteria and some of the girls were short à of bread.

label: joy
text: I was happy to hear that my sister had won a prize at running à competition.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when I met my Uncle because this time I was with my à boyfriend I thought I was not going to be given pocket money.

label: anger
text: I was angry when I had not been granted a leave out pass during à the last weekend.

label: sadness
text: I was sad to hear that my brother had a motorbike accident.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted when my little sister had been hit badly by her à friends.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed to tell my mother that I fell down with a bicycle.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend who à needed it immediately.

label: joy
text: When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.

label: fear
text: I was asked to join my friend in a boat at Mangochi Lake Malawi à and when making a turn, it seemed as if the boat would sink on à the side.

label: anger

text: In 1983, my results at the university entrance exam were very à poor - far from what I had expected.   I thought that I would not à be accepted at the university.

text: I am disgusted by people who spoil their identity because of à misbehaviour.  This morning when I was in a crowded bus, I found à a seat on which a university student was sitting on one side and à he had put his bag and files next to him.  There was very little à space left and I sat down while he kept on reading.  Even when I à leaned on him he did not put his bag away.  He did not respond and à I felt very angry.

label: shame
text: During a lecture six students (including me) were asked to leave à the class as we had not prepared for the lesson.  I felt ashamed à and angry.

label: guilt
text: One evening I went fishing with some friends but we could not à fish as a fisherman had already put his net there.  We pulled à out the net to find only crabs in it so we threw the net away.  à The net was large and may have cost $1000.  The fisherman used à the net to earn a living and we had had thrown it.

label: joy
text: I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B, his  à departure was unavoidable.  When he came back during the Summer à holidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us.

text: The day before the university results came out I was both excited à and scared.  If I failed I did not know what I would do as I did à not want to work, my family was ambivalent.

label: anger
text: Before the certificate examination I was very poor in Biology à (the worst result in my class).  Ever since F.5 it had been à getting poorer and poorer.  I had tried my best and had spent à most of my time studying this subject.  Finally my results were à so bad that I thought that it was just not fair.

label: sadness
text: My cat died from an illness.  It had been with us for 7 years.  à It was a lovely cat.  It had been ill for one or two weeks and à the veterinary surgeon had told us that it was dying.

text: In secondary school I had a class-mate who talked too much.   à Once we went to the cinema after school and she sat next to me and à commented the movie throughout  - very disgusting.

label: shame
text: Our teacher had invited us to lunch and once at the canteen we à started introducing ourselves.  Two of the boys showed a lot of à interest in knowing personal details and then they started à talking about some activities held in the college.  I had little à interest in those activities so I talked to another student à sitting next to me as I was afraid that they would ask me à questions on those activities.

label: guilt
text: My younger sister wanted to take classes to learn a musical à instrument.  One Saturday morning my mother asked me to go with        à her for the registration.  I did not want to go  so I said that à there might be many bad people at the club.  As a resullt my à sister was scolded by my mother.

text: I felt disgusted on seeing my boyfriend after our separation.  à One day he was begging at the mass transit railway station and at à that moment I hated him.

text: My friend had organized a birthday party for me secretly, I was à very happy not so much for the presents but because they seemed à to care for me.

text: My 80 year old grandfather underwent three successive operations à during a single year.  The third operation was risky and I was à scared that he would die and feared that my grandmother would be à very sad.

label: anger
text: My elder brother often criticizes my mother's cooking.  Once he à did it very impolitely and lost his temper.  This made all of us à very sad.  I was very angry and I scolded him.  He asked me not à to interfere with what was his buisness.

label: sadness
text: When my grandfather died I was extremely sad.  However my family à members did not have any special feelings, they said that he was à already 80 years old.

text: I was an instructior in a youth organization.  Whenever we, the à instructors would have a meeting the advisor would be present.  à He did not understand our worknig conditions but talked a lot à and had a lot of outdated ideas.  Whenever we disagreed with him à he was very discontent and said that we had a prejudice against à him.  Why did he have to treat us as his subordinates ?

label: shame
text: When we received  our academic result I learnt that my  results à were bad as I had not done my best.  The results of my à accquaintances were good and when they asked me about my results à I really did not want to answer.

label: guilt
text: When I was fighting with my elder brother I unintentionally hurt   à him in the eye with a wooden bar.  I felt guilty and feared that à he would be blind, fortunately he recovered after 15 days.

text: I finished my homework; an important task.

label: fear
text: Fear of the turn that the examination paper would take as I à lacked confidence.

text: Mr C took my drawing pens, without having asked for my permission à first, and lost them.  He did not tell me about it till I asked à him and then did not try to find them.

label: sadness
text: When I learnt that I had to repeat the first year, I found the à solution immediately but was blocked by many difficulties.

text: My girlfriend lost her temper without any reason and she did not à consider or respect my feelings.

text: After I had given the wrong answer to my students they pointed à it out to me and I had to correct myself.

text: I prayed unfaithfully.

label: joy

text: One day a fierce looking man came to our house  and said that my à father should apologize to him, however I was alone at home.

text: My cassmate laughed at me when I was being scolded by the à teacher.

text: I knew a girl so lovely that everyone would like her.  But she à refused to accept my Christmas present and I tried to forget à her.

text: I hate the behaviour of my so called friends, they use bad à language, spit, boast and treat the youngsters badly.

text: When I was young my mother told the neighbour that I had wet the à bed.  I felt ashamed thinking that the neighbour's children would à get to know about it.

text: One day while we were strolling along the road one of my à friends suggested that we go and watch a blue film.  I was à curious so I went along but I felt quite guilty later.

text: One night we were having a barbecue on the beach and I needed to à go to my car, which was far away from the beach.  It was very à dark as there were no street lamps.  I ran in the dark, very à scared, I ran as fast as possible.

text: [ No response.]

label: sadness
text: I separated with the one I liked most.  She refused all my dates à and told me that she had dated another one.  My heart seemed to à cease beating.  I was silent for some time and then I whispered à goodbye and left without turning back.

label: disgust
text: When I was a teacher in an evening school, a girl raised a lot of à questions and expressed her opinions.  She, very often, took a à stand which was different from mine and she thought that it à was better than mine.  Her opinions were helpful academically, but  à she did not take into consideration my position in public.  Also à she seemed to be very talkative and so she disgusted me.

label: shame
text: I had lunch in a restaurant with a friend and I paid the bill.  à The change was that of a two dollar and a ten cent coin.  As I à was talking with my friend I took the two dollar coin and forgot à to leave a tip.

label: guilt

label: anger
text: When I was studying in the library - preparing for a test, two à people sitting next to me talked to each other for 20 minutes.  à There were no other seats so I could not go elsewhere and I did   à not want to interrupt them, so I could only be angry in my heart.

label: sadness
text: I had been separated from my girlfriend for about a year.  On her à birthday I put a present in her mailbox.  I had spent two days à choosing a suitable present for her.  I waited for a few days and à there was no reply from her; at last I received a thank-you card à in my mailbox.  On the card there was only my name, the words thank-you  à and her signature.  I was very sad then.

label: disgust
text: When I was travelling to school by bus, I went past a place à where a sewer had been repaired.  There was a bad strong smell à which suffocated me and I wanted to leave the place immediately.

label: shame
text: I received the results of the test paper of my major subject and à I found that my result was not as good as a classmate who had à recently changed his major subject.    I felt very ashamed.

label: guilt
text: I had promised myself that I would do one good deed every day.  à One night I saw a beggar whose muscles had been atrophyed.  I à walked passed him thinking that he was feigning.  Later I à realized that he had not been pretending and I had a feeling of à guilt as I had not kept my promise.

label: joy
text: Talkiing about the past happy hours with two friends at night in à a camp a few months ago.  We shared our feelings, notions and à every hidden anxiety.  I thought that they cared for me and I à was very happy and satified.

label: fear
text: I remember that my form 2 teacher was very fierce and dogmatic.  à My feet would tremble whenever I saw her but I had to face the fact that à I had to go for her class.

label: anger
text: One night I could not practise my violin as my family was à watching T.V with the lights off, so I wanted to listen to some à tapes.  It was dark so I asked my brother to bring me a torch, à however he scolded me.  I was so angry that I slammed my violin à on the floor.

label: sadness
text: My mother suffers from a mental illness.  One night she was not à feeling well and was sent to the hospital.  I was scared that à she would die, and all night I was very sad and did not dare to à close my eyes.

label: disgust
text: At the crowded conditions of living.  I always quarrel with my à elder brother as he puts the T.V volume at a deafening level and à I can not practise my piano lessons.  Thus I feel that my home is à disgusting.

label: shame
text: I lost my temper at my mother while she was teaching me.  I felt à ashamed and sorry at having hurt my loving mother.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty at not having practised the piano.  I waste my à teacher's time and guidance.

text: I watched a football match with my old friend.  The performance à of the team was very good and the team members were full of à spirit.  The match was excellent and every time a goal was scored à I felt excited.

label: anger
text: When I came back to my hostel, my bed was full of newspapers and à dirty clothes.  My room-mate asked me to wash the clothes for him à as he had no time (this was his responsibility).  The food we à shared had been eaten up by him (I ate little).

label: sadness
text: My sister was impolite to my father when the family was having à lunch together at a restaurant.  She thought that our parents had à been prejudiced against her, this was an extreme thought.

label: disgust
text: When I was giving private tutorials to my student; he would not à concentrate and was lazy.  He had not done the home work that I  à had assigned and his academic level was very low.  It was a à nuisance.

text: I entered the hostel this year.  My mother was ill and could not à move and needed people to look after her.  Every week I left home à to go back to school, I felt guilty.

text: I received a letter from a friend whom I was missing

text: Looking for the toilet in a dark place.

text: An hour before receiving the certificate results I was very à frightened.  When I saw others crying I felt very tense and as à time went by my fear grew.

text: When my mother went through an operation, it was not very serious à but I was sad and could not sleep before the operation.

text: When I was doing my homework at home, some relatives came and à advised me to help my mother do the house-work.

text: While quarreling with my brother I broke the glass door of the à cupboard and a china doll.  We were scolded by my father for à breaking the door but we did not tell him about the door.

text: My friend and I had offended our classmate unintenionally.  We à wanted to apologize to her so we decided to visit her.  We knew that she à was stubborn so we were frightened.  When we rang her door bell, à our fear was at it's climax

label: anger
text: My girlfriend disliked it when I played majong (a game of gambling).  à I expressed my regrets and when I went to see her she neglected my à existance.  I was very angry and left in displeasure.

label: sadness
text: When I said good-bye to my girlfriend.  I had spent two years on à developing this relationship and it was unsuccessful, I felt very à sad.

label: disgust
text: My classmate got a "B" for his homework while I only got a "C".  à When we got the results he acted as if he did not merit this à grade.  I found that his humility was hypocritical and I found it à disgusting.

label: shame
text: Once in primary five, I had forgotten to take a book to class and à the teacher punished me by asking me to stand at the back of the à class. label: guilt
text: I had fixed a meeting with my classmates and I missed it as I was à tired.  Besides everyone at the meeting was a stranger to me and à I did not want to make friends with them.  Whatever the reasons - I  à felt guilty.

text: I learnt from the newspaper that I had been accepted at the à Chinese university of H.K.  It was 7 o'clock in the morning.  à Later I told my family and relatives about it and had tea with à them very joyfully.

label: fear
text: I was camping in an old broken hut which had no lights.  I had à brought along a lamp which was not working very well. The most terrifying bit was that there were many à wardrobes in the hut and everytime that I looked in the glass of à the wardrobe I felt that there were "objects" behind me.   The à whole night was spent in fear and restlessness.

label: anger
text: During a football match, the other team was rude and they hurt my à team members and me.  The coach was prejudiced against us and à punished us unreasonably.  Later we fought with each other and à the match had to be cut short.

label: sadness
text: I heard of the death of a closefriend of mine.  I had gone camping        à with him shortly before his death and the whole thing seemed very  à sudden to me.

label: disgust
text: A  group of youngsters dressed in fads talked foul language on a à bus.  They also insulted the  pedestrians on the road and were à impolite to the passengers of the bus.

label: shame
text: In a Christian gathering's lucky draw I mistook a girl's name for à mine (a boy's name).  I realized my mistake only when I went up à to the stage for the prize.  I did not know what to do as à everyone was looking at me.  I blushed and went back to my seat.

label: guilt
text: While playing basketball I broke a team member's spectacles.  His à face was injured by the  pieces of glass.  It was not serious but à I felt guilty and blamed myself for being too careless and à vigorous in my game.

label: joy
text: After a busy day I went back to my hostel.  I closed the door and à had a drink, then I read my favourite book on the bed.  Suddenly à I felt peace and joy.

label: fear
text: When I went home and there was nobody, I waited till 2 A.M and      à still nobody.  I was suddenly scared and anxious as this had never à happened before.  In addition my mother was very weak and I à feared that she had met with an accident.  Therefore I was anxious  à all night.

label: anger
text: Yesterday I read in the newspaper that a 30 year old woman had à abused her 2 month old son and had caused his death.  I was very à angry after reading this as this is not a human act and to abuse à so fragile a life is not a forgivable sin.

label: sadness
text: I had a schoolmate who went to the hospital as her brain was à bleeding.  She fell unconscious for three days and when I went à to see her I saw the miserable state the family was in.  Moreover à I could not do nothing for her.  I was very sad.  Finally, she à died.

label: disgust
text: A tiresome person held me up all day long.  I was very busy then à (I can not remember what the problem was).  He continously tried à to make me talk to him and disturbed me.

label: shame
text: One day, when I was sitting on the bus, there was an old woman à standing beside me.  I was very tired and sleepy and did not à think of giving her my seat.  A 50 year old woman who was sitting à beside me got up and gave her seat to the old woman and said,  à " Old woman, please take my seat, the youngstters these days are à not used to giving their seats to others."  When I heard these à words I was very ashamed of myself and wanted to get off the bus à at once.

label: guilt
text: After an exam I was in a very bad mood as I had done it very       à badly.  At home, my mother took so long to ask me how things had  à gone that I lost my temper.  I overreacted and made my mother cry. à She still prepared lunch for me and did not scold me .  Suddenly, à I thought that it was my fault and I started crying.  à

label: joy
text: I was appreciated by others, especially my family members and my à friends.

label: fear
text: Whenever I am alone in a dark room, walk alone on the street, à sleep alone in the room at night or see something which is only à partly visible.  This emotion was very strong when as an 8 year   à old child I saw something horrible.

label: anger
text: [ Whenever I put myself in other's shoes and try to make the à person happy, comfort him or make friends and I am misunderstood à and rejected, especially when this person is a family member or a friend.]

label: sadness
text: There was a conflict of interest between me and a close friend of à mine.  He only thought about his own interest and not about our à friendship.  This behaviour hurt his friends.  Another incident à is when a friend isolated himself without giving any reasons.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a lot of rubbish and animal waste on the floor.

label: shame
text: When I was emotionally unstable I said things which may have hurt à others or made them feel unhappy.  When I calmed down I realized à that I had been selfish and had not taken into consideration the à feelings of others.  Then I felt ashamed as someone pointed out my à behaviour to me.

label: guilt
text: [ When I break someone's things out of carelessness, or do something  à to make others feel unhappy  or hurt the self-esteem / self-confidence  à of others, especially if they happen to be friends or family members.]

label: joy
text: When I received the letter informing that I had been accepted to à be a Chinese university student, I was excited as I had longed à for it.

text: One day when I was a little boy, my friends asked me to play à with them outside and to catch some boys.  However our parents à did not know that we were out and when I got home it was very à late and I feared being scolded by my parents.

label: anger
text: When I learnt that a friend of mine had talked about me to à another friend and had said wrong things about my abilities and à attitudes.  I was very angry.

text: About two years ago my girlfriend suggested that we separate.  à This really gave me a shock as I had never thought that she would à say such things.  The reason she gave me was that we were not à suited for each other.

text: One day I felt dizzy during a lecture.  When the lecturer asked à us as to who had heard the fairy tale - I was the only one who à put up his hand and this surprised the whole class.

text: We always made a lot of noise during a certain lecture.  This may à have been because we did not respect the lecturer. Finaly, the à lecturer could not tolerate it and he scolded us angrily and à pointed out our misbehaviour.

label: anger
text: Once my father slapped my mother for a small quarrel.

label: sadness
text: A few years ago my mother suffered from canccer and died within à two years.  We had not finished our studies then and could not à bear our responsibilities as her children.  My mother had tried à her best to take care of us but she lived in pain these two à years.  Neither the doctor nor we could do anything for her as à cancer is incurable.  I was very eager to replace her in à suffernig , even die instead of her.

label: disgust
text: I used to play with a group of classmates and I found out later à that they were cheap in thought, behaviour and conduct - they à would smoke, fight and speak foul language.  I thought that they à destroyed the image of college students.

label: guilt
text: Many years back I quarrelled with my younger brother for a small à reason.  I used a pole to beat him and nearly broke his arm.  He à recovered after a treatment which lasted several months.  After à this our relationship was worse and he would not listen to me.

label: joy
text: One Saturday afternoon, I deliberately dressed up nicely (I had à been in a bad mood of late).  I hoped to go for a walk in the à soft sunlight to try and uplift my spirits.  When I was having à lunch in the canteen, two of my male classmates asked me as to à why I was dressed so nicely (they had seldom joked with me à before).  One of them said that he had a lounge suit and we would à look very nice if we wore them together.

label: fear
text: The exam was drawing near and I wanted to prepare for it.  But I à had a lot of other things to do so I did not have much time to prepare  à for the exams.  Whenever I sat down to study I was scared that I would  à not be able to finish it.

label: anger
text: A female classmate was always late for meetings which were for à the homework and not social gatherings.  We were very busy and à the deadline was close but we had to waste half an hour or an à hour waiting for her as we could do nothing else then.

label: sadness
text: After a meeting ended we started talking about when we would à have the next discussion ( I had many tests the coming week and à could not have a meeting in between, I thought that they would à understand this as they had always done).  They did not à understand my problem and thought that I should not have so many à other activities.  Their reaction made me burst into tears.

label: disgust
text: When I was studying in the library a pair of lovers were sitting à next to me talking in an intense and soft voice.  They were à disturbing others.

label: shame
text: During an informal discussion I contributed a lot even though I à had not spent much time studying.  Whenever someone said that à someone was not paying attention, or that he had too many other à things to do, or that the persoon was not trying his best, I à would feel ashamed.

label: guilt
text: Our class had organized a picnic in November.  I was the class à representative so I became the organizor.  However the picnic à was postponed by one week and I had something else to do then. à Initially I did not ponder on what to do and decided to go for à the picnic.  When I had the time to think about it I thought that à my decision was wrong.  My classmates thought that I would go as à I had signed my name but I did not go.  I told another class à representative that I was not going but he did not know the à reason behind my not going.  After the picnic my classmates asked à me why I had not gone to the picnic and everytime someone à mentioned it I was apologetic.  I should have decided right in à the begining that I would not go and then they would not see me à as irresponsible i.e promising to go and changing my mind à afterwards.

label: joy
text: It was the first time I met him (my boyfriend Mr.W).  It was à during the first term Summer vacations.  We met each other while à handing in our homework.  He invited me have a trip with him and à we were together till 8 P.M.

label: anger
text: One day I had sunned my favourite shirt and was putting it back à in the wardrobe when my younger brother snatched it from me and à wore it.  He had not had a bath and was very dirty. label: sadness
text: When I was a child I was playing on the upper deck of the bed à with my brother.  My parents slept on the lower deck.  My father à felt disgusted and beat me up.  I felt very sad as my father had à never beaten me or scolded me before.

label: disgust
text: My boyfriend and I did not have any contact with each other during  à the Summer holidays.  I met him the day of the registration and looked  à through him.  In the canteen he asked me if I wanted to have a drink and  à I said no as I did not want him to do me a favour.

label: shame
text: On Christmas eve I went to a classmate's home with other à classmates. I rushed back to the toilet but by the time the à others had guessed what had happened.

label: guilt
text: One night,when I was in primary 5 or 6, I felt thirsty so I à fetched the thermos to pour a cup of water for myself.  Then I à saw my brother lowering his head and I, jokingly, poured the       à water on his head.

text: I had gone camping with my old classmates and there was a storm.  à We were in a flurry but at that time I felt the love and concern à of my friends.

label: anger
text: I had a very good friend in secondary school.  The year after our à graduation I prepared to celebrate her birthday and I called off à all my appointments.  I got together the other friends and we à were ready to give the entire day to her.  However this friend à disappeared on her birthday.  When I phoned another friend I à didcovered thay she was busy, I did not call her anymore.

label: sadness
text: I am a Christian but I cannot find any meaning in life . It à seems that I am deceiving myself but I cannot find the way out.

text: A brother from one of the Christian fellowship often phoned me à and talked to me for half an hour or more.  However there was à nothing important in the conversation and I found the person very à disgusting.

label: guilt
text: Once I bought my sister a pair of sports shoes as she was going à to join an athletic meet.  However the shoes were a little big à and had a few flaws.  She muttered all the way and blamed me for à having wasted her money anf I felt guilty.

text: When the result of the certificate exam was announced.  I was à surprised and happy as the result was better than I had à expected.

label: sadness
text: My academic result was poor and I had to repeat the second year.  à I felt sad about the coming several years.

label: sadness
text: When I found that my ability to do ordinary work was worse than à my fellow mates.

The day of the carnival everything was à bright, the programmes went well and the attendants enjoyed it.  à I felt extremely excited about it.

text: [ No response.]

text: I was a prefect at secondary school. I thought that a brief rest was not  serious à enough to be blamed.

label: sadness
text: [ No response.]

label: disgust
text: I had joined a youth group that observed the affairs of our à community and so I had many opportunities to contact the à government and the committee members of the district board (a à local executive structure).
